name: Barossa Valley Bed and Breakfast
summary: Peppertree Cottage offers quality accommodation including full local gourmet breakfast provisions set in a gorgeous cottage surrounding for adults and children alike. With everything you could possibly need provided you will never want it to end.
space: Barossa Peppertree Cottage retreat is set amongst half an acre of glorious gardens with the feeling of total seclusion, while still located in the hub of Barossa Valley.
description: Peppertree Cottage offers quality accommodation including full local gourmet breakfast provisions set in a gorgeous cottage surrounding for adults and children alike. With everything you could possibly need provided you will never want it to end. Barossa Peppertree Cottage retreat is set amongst half an acre of glorious gardens with the feeling of total seclusion, while still located in the hub of Barossa Valley.  Barossa’s beautiful self catering bed & breakfast offers quality luxurious accommodation for up to 5 people including use of plush robes, exquisite king bedroom, gorgeous queen bedroom, FREE wifi, complimentary local wine, port and chocolates, full scrumptious gourmet breakfast provisions and is also set in a gorgeous cottage surrounding for adults and children alike. With everything you could possibly need provided and even more surprising treats, rest assured that this will be an enjoyable stay you will never want to end! Barossa Peppertree Cottage is non-hosted accommodati
neighborhood_overview: Stockwell is a quiet and friendly town with a lot of history. From the church built in 1904 to the popular Stockwell Hotel, there is a lot to discover about this quaint interesting town.
transit: With Nuriootpa only a 5 minute drive away, everything is accessible. You will find a lot of information in the cottage regarding transport and near by facilities.
access: Barossa’s beautiful self catering bed & breakfast offers quality luxurious accommodation for up to 5 people including use of plush robes, exquisite king bedroom, gorgeous queen bedroom, FREE wifi, complimentary local wine, port and chocolates, full scrumptious gourmet breakfast provisions and is also set in a gorgeous cottage surrounding for adults and children alike. With everything you could possibly need provided and even more surprising treats, rest assured that this will be an enjoyable stay you will never want to end!
interaction: Barossa Peppertree Cottage is non-hosted accommodation so our guests can feel the privacy and seclusion of a peaceful holiday!
house_rules: If your booking is for 1 couple, please continue using the 1 bedroom only, otherwise an extra fee of $80 will be charged for other  bedroom used. As well as our absolutely no pets policy, Barossa Peppertree Cottage is firmly non smoking accommodation and a cleaning fee of $200 will be charged if smoking inside the cottage is noted. Smoking outside the cottage is fine and ashtrays  are provided in obvious areas. We take pride in our beautiful cottage but are fully aware that accidents do happen. If damage does take place within Barossa Peppertree  Cottage estate, an appropriate fee will be charged. Cleanliness is important so our guests have the most comfortable stay, with this in mind it is up to you as guests to leave the property in a reasonably neat condition including bbq cleaned after use and dishes washed and put away. If extra cleaning is needed following your departure, a fee of $60 will be charged.

name: Strathlyn Spa Garden Suites Barossa
summary: The spa garden suites are located on the eastern side of the main residence at Strathlyn Estate. They are very private with their own access from the garden. They are tastefully and comfortably furnished. Each features a luxury bathroom with spa.
space: Strathlyn Residence was constructed in 1905 from local Angaston marble.  It graces the top of a hill overlooking surrounding vineyards next to the historic Saltram Winery. Originally comprising of 6 bedrooms the house has been extensively renovated. The Strathlyn Spa Garden Suites are tastfully furnished suites in the main residence with their own private entrances from the garden.

The accommodation is 1 km from Angaston town where guests can access the start of the bike track that runs through the centre of the Barossa Valley to Gawler.
notes: When first arriving check in at the Reception located on the eastern verandah of the main residence facing the tennis court. During certain times of the year (harvesting) there will be activities and some occasional noise within the vineyards.
transit: Please ask your host Heather about the local taxi service and tours of the Valley.

name: Strathlyn Lemon Tree Spa  Barossa
summary: Enjoy the charms of the Barossa Valley in this self contained cottage on the beautiful Strathlyn Estate located just out of Angaston. If you are on an extended holiday, you have the convenience of a guest laundry on the property and a new Gymnasium.
space: The Strathlyn Lemon Tree Spa Apartment is a self contained free standing cottage located at Strathlyn Estate, a privately owned 5 acre historic property located on the fringe of Angaston in the Barossa Valley.  The cottage provides quality accommodation for one couple, features a large 2 person spa at one end of the bedroom in a tiled area. A spacious living area and TV/DVD and comfortable large sofa encourage relaxation. The well equipped kitchenette is supplied with ample provisions for breakfast. A separate bathroom has a shower/toilet and vanity. There is an outdoor table setting in a walled area near the pond and garden allowing for outdoor relaxation or meals

name: Milk + Honey House
space: Milk + Honey House is a self-contained cottage offering beautiful rustic French/Hamptons style décor and a range of features for your comfort and enjoyment all year round. The accommodation includes two beautiful double bedrooms both with queen size beds and white sun dried cotton bed linen, plus an additional single bed ottoman in the larger bedroom (designed mostly for the use of a child).  You can relax in the gorgeous comfortable lounge room, large eat in kitchen, modern bathroom with MOR toiletries and white fluffy towels. There is a separate toilet with powder room, full laundry facilities, shaded outdoor eating area in a landscaped garden and driveway to undercover parking.  The house has reverse cycle air-conditioning in every room, a flat screen television and DVD player, iPod dock, full kitchen facilities including dishwasher, coffee machine and microwave. Continental breakfast provisions along with a selection of beer and a bottle of Barossa wine are also included in the pri

name: Barossa Barn Bed & Breakfast
summary: Beautiful boutique double story cottage packed with rustic features. Perfect for a romantic 1 or 2 couple getaway. Located within walking distance to Angaston in the Barossa Valley. $250 couple per night (min 2 night booking - max 4 guest stay).
space: Self-contained double story cottage with use of 2 bedrooms. The rustic upstairs is open plan with air-conditioning containing a queen four poster bed, shared modern kitchenette, lounge and dining area. (Please note this room is open plan not a separate bedroom). Downstairs features stone walls and slate floors and features the 2nd air-conditioned bedroom containing a Queen bed (2nd couple use).  Shared downstairs bathroom with separate shower, claw foot bath and separate toilet. We include luxuries to make your stay comfortable including fresh fruit, fruit juice, bottled spring water, plunger coffee and quality teas, with complimentary port and chocolates. (Rate also includes a $20 cooked breakfast voucher per person daily at Soul with Zest in Angaston).

neighborhood_overview: Situated in the historic town of Penrice, you can enjoy the picturesque walk or short drive to Angastons' cafe's, restaurants, pubs and shopping district.
notes: For those looking to indulge in the best that the Barossa has to offer, you are only a short drive away from Barossa Farmer's Market (open Sat from 7.30 - 11.30am, showcasing local produce and real food from the homes and farms of the Barossa Valley) and some of the most popular wineries, restaurants and destinations in the region.
transit: We include a Barossa Valley Touring map as part of your stay. We can assist with taxi bookings if required.
access: Private entrance from the main house with off street parking. Guests have access to backyard including shared courtyard and BBQ area.
interaction: Our information folder includes helpful ideas including local restaurants and eateries, wineries, local attractions and things to do and see in the Barossa Valley. We are happy to help with taxi and winery tour bookings for you.
house_rules: Non-smoking property. If evidence of smoking is detected inside property then guest/s will be charged a $50 cleaning fee. Use of 2nd or 3rd bedroom during a one bedroom booking or use of 3rd bedroom during a two bedroom booking will attract an extra $60 per room to cover laundering/cleaning costs. We have a "leave it as you found it" policy. No parties allowed. Property not suitable for children or pets.
host_about: We look forward to meeting you and providing you with a comfortable and relaxing stay.

name: Martinsell Cottage
summary: A self contained private 3 bedroom cottage, set amongst 77 acres of ancient old red gums, nearby vineyards and historic barn / stables. The cottage is set on the estate of one of SA's most significant Georgian manors, 'Martinsell', built in 1901.  The Cottage is 500m from the main residence.
space: There is a lovely large lounge with cosy wood heater and split system reverse cycle air conditioner and a fully equipped kitchen. The cottage is in a very peaceful country location with the closest neighbour being a kilometre away. Horses are welcome with secure yards and plenty of parking for horse floats. Daily permits are available nearby for horse riding in the neighbouring forests. Car enthusiasts are also extremely welcome with safe and secure space for cars and trailers. Mountain bikers or road cyclists are well catered for with plenty of secure space for bikes, and great roads - the famous Menglers Hill is just over an hour's ride away with a choice of sealed or gravel roads. Mountain bike trails abound in Mt Crawford Forest, right at our doorstep.
description: A self contained private 3 bedroom cottage, set amongst 77 acres of ancient old red gums, nearby vineyards and historic barn / stables. Mountain bike
neighborhood_overview: The Pewsey Vale area was settled by English, Scottish and German settlers. Pewsey Vale is a part of the world-famous Barossa Valley food and wine region, famous for bold red wines, delicate Pewsey Vale Rieslings, and the finest boutique foods. The Barossa and its surroundings offer a wide variety of activities from hot air ballooning to trekking, cycling, horse riding, wine tasting and more. Closest large stores: Gawler (25min drive / 20km nth west) has a many large town facilities and services including; •Supermarket open until 9pm mon-sat •24 hr petrol station The local town of Williamstown (10min drive / 10km west) has a small general store with limited supplies and a bottle shop. We are close to the National Motor Museum in Birdwood 18km, the famous Collingrove hillclimb circuit, and some of the best driving roads in Australia,  through the Adelaide Hills and Barossa Ranges. A Barossa Valley information guide & maps are provided for your information and convenience.
notes: For longer stays cleaning and linen service is available. Extra service charges apply.
transit: Martinsell is approximately one hour drive from Adelaide, bordering on the edge of the Adelaide Hills, Southern Barossa, making a unique scenic driving experience. As we are approximately 10km from Williamstown and 24km from Tanunda, you will need to come by motor vehicle, bicycle, on horseback, or in good hiking boots! Unfortunately there are no buses nearby but a taxi service is available.  There are stunning views over the rolling hills which are surrounded by forests, with walking, cycling and horse trails. Adjacent to the property is the famous Heysen Trail, and the Kidman and Mawson Trails are not far away.
access: Guests have free access over the property, but we ask that guests respect our privacy as we respect theirs. We are usually happy to arrange visits through the private gardens and to look closer at the manor house on request. As we often have friendly roaming livestock we ask that gates be closed on entry or exit.
interaction: We reside in the main residence on the property, so we are always available for our guests. We can be contacted in person or by phone/text.
house_rules: Respectfully enjoy being in gorgeous Pewsey Vale by looking after our cottage as well as enjoying it!  Strictly no smoking inside. Please feel free to contact us with requests or questions concernig the Barossa Valley, the nearby Historic 1901 Manor and or anything else. :)
host_about: We are a recently retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond. However, as the cottage is self-contained, 500 metres from the main house, we also respect privacy.

name: Beauchamp House B&B
summary: Beauchamp House is set on a 168 Acre farm with Splendid gardens and views of the hills around you. We welcome you to stay and enjoy the quite and peaceful nature of Beauchamp House and discover all the Barossa Valley has to offer. Our 1870 built home is open for you to use and we dont book seperate people in that you dont know so if it's just the 2 people or a group of 6 the place is entirely yours. Sit back and relax or go for a walk and check out the animlas we have around the farm.
space: Beauchamp has 3 Bedrooms 2 with queens and one with a king bed and 2 rooms come with Ensuite and the other has a bathroom not far from it. Beauchamp house is a little luxuary with the old charms of a hills home. Guests on arrival will receive a bottle of wine and a cheese platter and all breakfast provisions while staying with us. Coffee machine and easy to you wood fired pizza oven add to the many amazing things that come with Beachamp house.

access: Guests have access to everything in the house and if needing WIFI just ask and we can hook you up. We have a veggie garden you can roam through and help yourself and a wood fired pizza oven to enjoy a cooked pizza and sit back and relax with a glass of wine.
interaction: Guests can have all the privacy they need or if wanting to ask questions or find out more about the place Denny and James are more then happy to have a chat or enjoy an evening drink or BBQ.

name: Southern Gateway to the Barossa
summary: Private suite in the quiet country town of Williamstown home of the Whispering Wall.  The Southern gateway to the Barossa Valley. Clean and simple decor with everything you need to relax and enjoy your stay. Not only are we close to the Barossa, but also about 45 mins to the German village of Hahndorf  and the Murray River Town of Mannum. We have two hotels, a bakery, cafe's and a general store and also within walking distance of the fantastic home grown cellar door Tearo.
space: South Para Suite has a queen size bed with en-suite bathroom plus walk in wardrobe. A separate sleeping area with two single beds plus a trundle bed for extra guests adjoining the lounge.  A cosy lounge area with two couches, TV, dining table, bar fridge, breakfast making facilities and a microwave we also have a bbq outside for your use. Our space is perfect for couples but flexible enough for a family to stay within budget.

name: Barossa Valley, Angaston - Pondicherri Guest Suite
summary: Set on 5 acres, Pondicherri is a small acreage landholding surrounded by larger farming land. Pondicherri is currently being redeveloped into a small  accommodation business alongside our home. Some of the accommodation buildings are of historic interest and date back to 1845.
space: The Pondicherri Guest Suite is a small but very compact self contained contemporary room.   A very comfortable king single bed with an adjoining private ensuite bathroom/toilet is your private sanctuary.  A TV with DVD player, reverse cycle A/C,  fridge, microwave and kettle are provided in the room for your use including a desk area with a very comfortable chair A second person can be accommodated on a single foldout ottoman bed.  Bed linen and towels are provided.  It is what is on the inside that counts!     We are slowly upgrading the grounds but at the rate provided,  you will be very comfortable and private.

neighborhood_overview: We are only 5 minutes drive to the pretty historic village of Angaston that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes,  restaurants, 2 pubs, a supermarket, butcher, hardware, medical centre, post office and houses speciality Barossa food businesses.   We are a 3 minute drive from the famed Barossa Valley Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning. There are many high quality wineries, restaurants, food establishments and historic buildings to explore across the region.   If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails, some easy bushwalks including spotting kangaroos at Kaisersthul Conservation Park.    Or you could  go  ballooning or a helicopter ride for the birds eye view!     Just about everything except surfing!    But we are about  one hour's drive to the nearest South Australian coastline,  only one+half hour's drive into  city of Adelaide and a one hour drive to the Adelaide Hills area.    There is so much to do and explore in
notes: Breakfast  can be provided at an additional cost - please request upon booking.
transit: Our property is accessible by car only.
access: We are a property under development and there are no sealed pathways to your room.  The grounds are still a work in progress but the privacy and views compensate.
interaction: As much or as little as you please!  You are independent in the guest suite and we will always respect your privacy.
host_about: I am for the most part a very private person on a public forum -  but I do enjoy travelling, cooking, meeting new people and I have enjoyed the AirBnB experience in Australia and India.  There is no better way to gain a deeper appreciation of the culture than to meet the people who live where you visit and AirBnB is a perfect forum to do that.    Welcome to my little bit of paradise.

notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience Two night minimum at all times - three or four on long weekends, Barossa Events or Easter
transit: Drive yourself or check out Barossa Vintage Tours for a personal chauffeur driven tour - tell them you are staying at Trinity Cottage for the best deal
access: Your self contained cottage has lounge, two queen bedrooms, country kitchen, spa bathroom and laundry facilities. There are wonderful outdoor nooks for relaxation
interaction: Your hosts live close by on the same property (500 metres away). They will meet you on arrival but leave you to enjoy the peace and tranquility. They are there if you need them.
house_rules: Trinity Cottage is strictly NO SMOKING indoors
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 20 years experience in the BnB industry.
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: The Old Manse Shed, Barossa Valley
summary: The Old Manse Shed is adjacent to main home here in Light Pass. Freshly painted, there is a comfy Queen bed, reverse cycle air con, heated blanket for wintry evenings. Self contained bathroom. TV, fridge, Nespresso maker, homemade Granola, milk, toaster + fresh sourdough, freshly home baked goods, bottle of wine upon arrival.  Table and chairs, room opens into garden. Church and vineyards at rear of property. Angaston, Tanunda and Nuri are all within 10 minute drive, 70 Cellar Doors in Barossa.
description: The Old Manse Shed is adjacent to main home here in Light Pass. Freshly painted, there is a comfy Queen bed, reverse cycle air con, heated blanket for wintry evenings. Self contained bathroom. TV, fridge, Nespresso maker, homemade Granola, milk, toaster + fresh sourdough, freshly home baked goods, bottle of wine upon arrival.  Table and chairs, room opens into garden. Church and vineyards at rear of property. Angaston, Tanunda and Nuri are all within 10 minute drive, 70 Cellar Doors in Barossa.
house_rules: - Check-out by 10am
host_about: I am an English girl living the dream here in the stunning Barossa Valley.  I am married with two children, two soppy Labradors and a cat. I am crazy about baking, cooking, wine, family and friends. We live in what is the former Rectory / Manse in this tiny Hamlet of Light Pass, just a few minutes drive from all the gems of the Barossa, namely Angaston, Tanunda and Nuriootpa.  We look forward to welcoming you into our much loved home and hearing your stories.  I am fortunate to work in Australia's oldest family owned winery and so meeting people is literally part of my job and just love it.

name: Barossa Old Garage BnB
summary: Step back in time to the 50s -60s. Unique luxury fully self contained 2 bedrooms & bathrooms accommodating up to 6 people. Emulates an American diner with all the mod cons. If you love playing records or pinball this is place for you! Sole occupancy.
space: Once you turn the key to this luxury Barossa accommodation, you’ll step back in time to the 50s and 60s when life was simpler and the world was black, white, red and chrome. Every room features an eclectic mix of 50s and 60s Americana to capture the unique style of the era of Rock and Roll, but you’ll still enjoy all the luxuries and conveniences you expect from this modern age

While The Barossa Valley is regarded as one the world’s premier wine regions, there is plenty more on offer for you to enjoy while you relax and unwind at the Barossa Old Garage Bed and Breakfast, which i
neighborhood_overview: While The Barossa Valley is regarded as one the world’s premier wine regions, there is plenty more on offer for you to enjoy while you relax and unwind at the Barossa Old Garage Bed and Breakfast, which is situated between the historic townships of Angaston and Nuriootpa.
notes: We offer wine tours and restaurant transfers for an additional cost . Let us show you around our backyard. So much to see and do. A bike trial across the road which meanders from Angaston to Gawler . Bikes can be hired and delivered to your accommodation
transit: Take a drive and enjoy the gorgeous scenery of the Barossa Ranges and vineyards, sample the region’s delicious cuisine at nearby award winning restaurants and gourmet stores, get your retail fix at local boutiques and antique shops and enjoy a tasting or two at the many world renowned wineries that are right on your doorstep.
access: Sole occupancy of the residence Under cover car parking
interaction: We live on the property and would be more than happy to offer you some local knowledge and places to visit.
house_rules: Please respect our property. Strictly no pets allowed Not suitable for children No smoking inside If you use additional beds and bathrooms you will be charged accordingly If excessive cleaning is needed you will be charged a minimum of $150. Any damage or breakages will be charged to your credit card.
host_about:
Love great food , enjoy listening to music from the 50s & 60s.
Would love to do Route 66 this is on my bucket list. Love meeting people.
My aim is to visit the 80 or so cellar doors in my own backyard The Barossa Valley.

name: The Chardonnay Room
summary: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! Whether you are coming for business or play, the Barossa is an international attraction for the wineries and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see.  There is a huge selection of local wineries and restaurants as well as glorious country sides of vineyards. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable.
space: You have a clean and tidy bedroom that has a comfortable modern queen bed, wardrobe, drawers, hanging space, bedside table and your own air-conditioning. You will have a key to lock your bedroom. It also includes a shared lounge, shared dining, and shared kitchen area. The bathroom is for guest use only and has a large vanity space, separate shower recess and separate toilet. The bathroom may be shared with other guests if other rooms are booked. The hairdryer/iron/toiletries in the bathroom and shower area are available for use while you are staying in the home.  You are also welcome to sit outside in the undercover area.

The bathroom may be shared with other guests if other rooms are booked. The hairdryer/iron/toiletries in the bathroom and
neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood consists of settled home owners. Most houses have high fencing in their backyards for privacy. It is a very quiet area and has respectful neighbours. A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation.  Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests.  Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and the main shopping mall is currently under construction to include more services. We have Foodland and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops. A number of cafes are located throughout the Barossa towns. We have two 24 hour food options with Hungry Jacks or the Big Grill located at Caltex on the highway.  Every town has a local pub which will serve great meals. The Vine Inn is a pop
notes: WIFI details are listed in your welcome letter.  Tourist brochures are available. Small library of books are available if you wish to read.  Winter can get very cold with some frosty mornings. Extra blankets are available. Similarly summer can be hot but dry. There is a ceiling fan in your room. Your room has split system air conditioning for heating and cooling to your liking.  A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation.  Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests.  Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and the main shopping mall is currently under construction to include more services. We have Foodland and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops. A number of cafes are located through
transit: Getting around the Barossa is best done by private car. There is a local taxi service if you are heading out for a big night. A bus service runs intermittently to Gawler where it meets the train line to Adelaide city. There are bike tracks in the Barossa, with a bike shop in Nuriootpa renting bicycles. There is a dedicated bike track from Nuriootpa to Angaston.
access: Access to:  •	key for your room is available by lockbox – check in when it suits you •	parking available on the front gravel area  •	WIFI / Netflix / TV / DVDs in the shared lounge space •	Light breakfast available – fruit and cereal (gluten free option available) •	tea / coffee / hot chocolate / water are available in the kitchen along with access to the kettle, microwave, sandwich press and toaster. I would be grateful if food is consumed in the dining area and not the bedroom. Please tidy after yourself by washing dishes or stacking cups etc. next to the kitchen sink.
interaction: I live in the front part of the house and work full time, so I may not be home very often or may not be available to greet you on arrival. Otherwise, key access is by a lock box so your arrival time is flexible. Your access code will be emailed to you.   I am happy to help answer questions and will do my best to ensure you have a comfortable stay. Either way I am happy to interact as much or little as you choose. I do have 2 indoor cats that will be kept in the front area while I am not home. Again, you can choose if you would like to interact with them when I am home, otherwise I will keep them away from the shared area.
house_rules: - Leave the area tidy please - Respect for Neighbours - no loud noise  - No visitors - Eating or drinking in the dining area only please - Conserve energy - turn off heaters / fans when not needed and when leaving the house - Smoking outside only, not near open windows or doors - thanks
host_about: I love my job as a teacher in a local primary school. I am a keen photographer of all things beautiful and often carry my camera wherever I go. I am a Christian and am involved with a local church and love helping others. I have stayed at a few places using Airbnb and was impressed enough to consider hosting others. I have been local for 5 years but have a long family history in the area.

name: Quiet Cul-de-sac
summary: This space is a room within a shed. Comfortable clean with own en-suite, and basic cooking facilities. Clean,tidy and value for what is on offer. Walking distance to shop restaurants and laundromat. Designed for a couple or a single
space: For the cost and facilities available here you won't find much better value. Its not the Taj Mahal but its clean tidy and compact. Queen bed and secure undercover parking is available for a single car. Designed for a couple or single person. Room is insulated with reverse air conditioning.
description: This space is a room within a shed. Comfortable clean with own en-suite, and basic cooking facilities. Clean,tidy and value for what is on offer. Walking distance to shop restaurants and laundromat. Designed for a couple or a single For the cost and facilities available here you won't find much better value. Its not the Taj Mahal but its clean tidy and compact. Queen bed and secure undercover parking is available for a single car. Designed for a couple or single person. Room is insulated with reverse air conditioning. The floor plan shows the area which is yours during your stay. We have an outdoor area for those balmy nights. As shown this room is part of a shed for which there is an access door but this is locked when the room is in use. The room is fully insulated with air conditioning. We are sociable but still like to give our guests privacy as required. I have lived all my life in the Barossa so have a good knowledge of the area. We don't have pets and if you smoke please do so o
neighborhood_overview: Our residence is in a quiet cul-de-sac. We have lived at the same address for over 17yrs. We have a very safe neighbourhood and we have a good relationship with our neighbour's.
notes: Room comes equipped with the following Tea,coffee,sugar,milk Toaster& kettle Fridge will contain the following: bottled water, jams, vegemite, milk If you are looking for a dinning experience the Barossa is home to a number of 5 star restaurants. Appellations, Fino at Seppeltsfield, Ferment Asian, and Hentley Farm. Bookings are essential. All are no more than a 10min drive from our home. If you are in the Barossa on a Tuesday evening Appellations have their locals night. Currently $59 for a chefs choice three course. Enquire at Appellations as the locals night is a seasonal event. Maggie Beers farm shop is a short drive from our accommodation of around five minutes.
transit: Our property is only a short stroll to the town centre. A laundromat is also in the town centre. There is a taxi service and a bus is available daily to and from Adelaide.
access: The floor plan shows the area which is yours during your stay. We have an outdoor area for those balmy nights. As shown this room is part of a shed for which there is an access door but this is locked when the room is in use. The room is fully insulated with air conditioning.
interaction: We are sociable but still like to give our guests privacy as required. I have lived all my life in the Barossa so have a good knowledge of the area. We don't have pets and if you smoke please do so outside. No smoking what so ever in any of the rooms.
house_rules: Smoking is fine but under no circumstances within the room. This is our place of residence and with that in mind no other guests shall be allowed without our consent.
host_about:
My wife and I regard ourselves as very sociable people. I myself am an avid home brewer and love fine wine and social gatherings. Married since 1992 and have two teenage kids. Born and lived in the Barossa all my life with strong family ties and local knowledge. I work within the wine industry. Enjoy open air concerts, having been to numerous "Day On The Green" concerts. Love all types of music 80's to current day trends.
I have a favourite saying, 
"We are on this planet for a good time not a long time"

name: Lavender Lodge
summary: My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. It is in a quiet area close to pleasant walking areas as well Nuriootpa town centre. Lavender Lodge is a separate flat at the rear of our home with a shared outdoor patio area in between. It is set within an organic garden area. The pleasures of the beautiful Barossa Valley are on your doorstep.

name: Comfiest bed in the Barossa!
space: Situated in the beautiful Barossa Valley just 15 minutes walk to the shops and hotels. There is some traffic on the road out the front but there is no houses across the road which makes it feel spacious and natural. There is also a retirement village around me so it's probably the quietest and slow paced part of town. The bathroom is shared. There's a bus

name: Vineyard Cottage - Under the Vines
space: Welcome to my vineyard cottage in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley! With 2 Kingsize bedrooms (1 can be split into singles) and a single rollaway bed available on request, I'm ready to accommodate your Barossa adventure in comfort and convenience. Both bedrooms are airconditioned, and offer added luxury with quality linen, mink blankets and pillow menu. Both bedrooms have their own TV/DVD so you can lie in and enjoy your favorite shows. You'll find the living area spacious - with comfy sofas, cushions and a snuggly blanket. Complimentary Wi-Fi and Foxtel, large flatscreen TV, PlayStation & Blu-ray DVD, and Audio Sound Tower dock complete the experience.  The bathroom has a double shower and 2 person spa, along with a generous assortment of towels, earth friendly body and spa products, and flatscreen TV (viewed from the spa, or used for background music.....) The kitchen has full facilities, with oven, cooktop, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher and coffee machine, and you'll l

neighborhood_overview: Easy driving distance to world class wineries and food destinations, quirky cafes, parks, walking and bike trails. Come and explore for yourself!
notes: Local produce for a country style breakfast Quality linen and towels provided Complimetary WiFi TV/DVD/Playstation/Foxtel Combustion heater R/C Airconditioning Laundry facilities BBQ / Outdoor furniture / Gas heater Earth friendly bathroom products Cot and highchair available on request
access: The cottage is yours to enjoy exclusively, along with the 5 acres of vineyard and native bushland. Multiple outdoor furniture settings on the return verandah accommodate the views from every angle, and a portable gas heater and bbq provide extra outdoor options, weather permitting! If you visit during vintage season (late February - April) you might get a job picking grapes or doing some winemaking!
interaction: I don't live on the property, but I'm only a few minutes away, and can be contacted by phone, SMS or email during your stay if there's anything you need assistance with.
house_rules: Make yourself at home, and have a great time in the Barossa! No smoking indoors please! There are plenty of outdoor spots - please leave butts in the pots provided, and help keep our space clean. Smoking inside will incur an extra cleaning fee of $200.

name: The Reserve Barossa Valley
summary: The Reserve sits on six acres and accommodates up to 10 people in five bedrooms. It has an open plan fully equipped kitchen for food lovers, three bathrooms, several living and dining areas.  There are magnificent views and a huge outdoor area with a wood fired pizza oven.  The Reserve Barossa Valley is an amazing place to .... escape, relax and indulge all the Barossa has to offer
space: If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. Located right smack bang in the middle of all the famous wineries and only minutes along Seppeltsfield Road to some of Australia’s best wineries including; Whistler, Heritage, Two Hands, Torbreck, Tscharke, Barossa Valley Estate, Seppeltsfield, Hentley Farm, Gnadenfrei and Greenock Creek. And just a few more minutes to Penfolds, Jacob’s Creek, Yalumba and Elderton. Appellation (the Barossa’s finest dining) less than a minute away. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through the Shiraz vines over to Maggie Beers Farm Shop for lunch by the lake.

neighborhood_overview: Where are the best Barossa Cellar Doors? Well, many of them can be found along Seppeltsfield Road! These include Hentley Farm, 2015 James Halliday Wine Companion Cellar Door of the Year. Hentley Farm, Greenock Creek Wines,Tscharke’s Place, Izway, Rolf Binder, Heritage, Two Hands and Torbreck are just a few of the wineries along the nine kilometres of Seppeltsfield Road where premium Barossa wines, including many famous Barossa Shiraz wines (the variety the Barossa is most famous for) can be tasted. Whistler Wines is a fabulous spot to combine wine tasting with a platter in the gardens under a gum tree, then visit their rescued pet kangaroos! Many of the wines produced in the Marananga/Seppeltsfield/Greenock sub-region of the Barossa are world class.  We have small, single vineyard producers without cellar doors as well as iconic establishments including the historic Seppeltsfield Estate Winery founded in 1851 and Winner of the 2016 Qantas National Tourism Award for Best Tourism Winery,
notes: Having access to the best local produce in SA, you can pick up your goodies from the Barossa Farmers Market each Saturday to cook up a storm in either the large kitchen or wood fired oven. However, should you wish to relax after a long day of wine tasting or walk the trails, we are able to point you in the right direction - Rachel from Destination Dining/ Owen Andrews Catering or Ellie Beer are just a few local business which specialise in customising your dining experience. Be it a family gathering, touring wine group or mates escape we can provide a long table lunch to 8 course degustation dinner.
transit: If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. Located right smack bang in the middle of all the famous wineries and only minutes along Seppeltsfield Road to some of Australia’s best wineries including; Whistler, Heritage, Two Hands, Torbreck, Tscharke, Barossa Valley Estate, Seppeltsfield, Hentley Farm, Gnadenfrei and Greenock Creek. And just a few more minutes to Penfolds, Jacob’s Creek, Yalumba and Elderton. Appellation (the Barossa’s finest dining) less than a minute away. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through the Shiraz vines over to Maggie Beers Farm Shop for lunch by the lake
access: Enviable in the extreme, this exclusive, self-catered residence comprises three King-size suites, one Queen-size suite, a self-contained studio appropriate for pilots, guides, guests or carers and three fully refurbished bathrooms. Immerse yourself and star-gaze from the six-person spa under the vines or host an old world “Tuscan style” get-together around the wood-fired pizza oven & BBQ. Drag yourself away from the fireplace in the open plan lounge and retire to stunning views of premium vines that compliment every bedroom. There are two dining areas, wine room/library, huge fully-equipped kitchen, separate laundry & boot room entry and all the “mod cons”. •Pizza Oven •Baking Oven •BBQ •6-person Spa We provide all bed linen, towels & spa towels
interaction: To make the most of your Barossa Experience, email thereser(URL HIDDEN) we are more than happy to make your stay memorable. We highly recommend visiting Barossa Visitor Information Centre 66-68 Murray St, Tanunda SA 5352
house_rules: - For Events or Weddings, please contact (EMAIL HIDDEN) directly. - *conditions apply for Weddings or Events - Accommodation for the entire property is for up to 10 guests, 2 further guests can be accommodated for with 2 x hotel roll-away beds @ an additional charge of $100 per person, per night. Rollaway beds will be based in the Studio bedroom 5. 12 guests are the maximum number we provide accommodation for. We are happy to allow up to 16 guests in total (12 overnight & 4 visitors) to dine at The Reserve as we are able to seat this amount inside if it is raining. Further than this number is considered a function, please contact Simone Tanner for event and marque details. Nightly rate: $1350 incl. GST. Deposit of 50% is required at the time of booking as a pre-condition of the booking being placed. Balance due 60 days prior to arrival.  - Refundable Bond: Will be required 3-days prior to arrival - Bedroom 3 & 5 Can be made into x2 Single Beds or King/Queen Beds - The Reserve Booking F
host_about:
There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place. 

We welcome you to Barossa. The place we love. The place we call home.

name: Elderton Wines Guest House
summary: Our guest house is located in Nuriootpa, in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Situated a short walk from Elderton's Cellar Door, this is a great base for any Barossa visit. Complimentary bottle of wine on arrival and continental breakfast provisions.
space: The Elderton Lodge offers three large bedrooms, able to accommodate up to six people comfortably (one room contains a king bed, one room a queen bed and one room contains two single beds). The Elderton Lodge offers reverse cycle air conditioning throughout, making it toasty in the winter and beautifully cool in the summer. The kitchen/dining offers a full kitchen, including oven and cooktop, microwave, dishwasher, fridge and sink. The separate lounge offers comfortable seating and a flat screen television. The wet areas comprise of a bathroom with shower, bath and toilet, a separate toilet and a fully equipped laundry. The back verandah offers outdoor seating and barbecue facilities. Off-street parking available.

transit: Onsite parking available. A bus travels around the Barossa and to Adelaide most days. More i(EMAIL HIDDEN)
interaction: Our Cellar Door is open every day, and will be your point of contact for: - tips on where to eat, things to do, wineries to visit etc - local contact information - maps of the area Our Cellar Door is about a 1 minute walk from the Guest House.
house_rules: Check in after 2pm, check out before 10am. Continental breakfast provisions provided. Mid stay service provided for stays of 6 nights or more. The Lodge is strictly a non-smoking premise inside the building. If evidence of smoking is detected, a cleaning fee will be charged to the Guest. We realise accidents happen, but any wilful damage will be charged to the Guest. Strictly a NO PARTY Policy.
host_about: Elderton Wines is a small, family-owned winery, situated in Nuriootpa, in the heart of Australia’s Barossa Valley. The second generation of the Ashmead family, brothers Cameron and Allister, now run the winery day-to-day and are passionate about producing wines that are balanced, varietally correct and classic in nature.

Very modern and clean, this property is perfect for the whole family or couples wishing to explore. Nuriootpa, or Nuri as the locals call it, is nestled in between Tanunda, Angaston and Greenock, and is the perfect place for your spring escape. With easy access from the highway, this home is close to all the best wineries with Wolf Blass, Penfolds and more just a short drive away.

name: The Cabernet Room
summary: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! Whether you are coming for business or play, the Barossa is an international attraction for the wineries and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. There is a huge selection of local wineries and restaurants as well as glorious country sides of vineyards. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable.
space: You have a clean and tidy bedroom that has a comfortable double bed, hanging space with hanging drawers, and bedside table. You will have a key to lock your bedroom. It also includes a shared lounge, shared dining, and shared kitchen area. The bathroom is for guests only and has a large vanity space, separate shower recess and separate toilet. The bathroom may need to be shared with other guests if other rooms are booked. There is a hairdryer and iron available while you are staying in the home. You are also welcome to sit outside in the undercover area.
description: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! Whether you are coming for business or play, the Barossa is an international attraction for the wineries and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. There is a huge selection of local wineries and restaurants as well as glorious country sides of vineyards. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. You have a clean and tidy bedroom that has a comfortable double bed, hanging space with hanging drawers, and bedside table. You will have a key to lock your bedroom. It also includes a shared lounge, shared dining, and shared kitchen area. The bathroom is for guests only and has a large vanity space, separate shower recess and separate toilet. The bathroom may need to be shared with other guests if other rooms are booked. There is a hairdryer and iron available while you are staying in the home.
neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood consists of settled home owners. Most houses have high fencing in their backyards for privacy. It is a very quiet area and has respectful neighbours. A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation. Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests. Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and the main shopping mall is currently under construction to include more services. We have Foodland and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops, and soon Aldi and Cheap as Chips. A number of cafes are located throughout the Barossa towns. We have two 24 hour food options with Hungry Jacks or the Big Grill located at Caltex on the highway. Every town has a local pub which will serve gre
notes: WIFI details are listed in your welcome letter. Tourist brochures are available.  Winter can get very cold with some frosty mornings. Extra blankets are available. Similarly summer can be hot but dry. There is a quiet split system airconditioner in your room.
transit: Getting around the Barossa is best done by private car. There is a local taxi service if you are heading out for a big night. A bus service runs intermittently to Gawler where it meets the train line to Adelaide city. There are bike tracks in the Barossa, with a bike shop in Tanunda renting bicycles. There is a dedicated bike track from Nuriootpa to Angaston.
access: Access to:  •	key for your room is available by lockbox – check in when it suits you  •	parking available on the front gravel area  •	WIFI / Netflix / TV / DVDs in the shared lounge space  •	Light breakfast available – fruit and cereal (gluten free option available)  •	tea / coffee / hot chocolate / water are available in the kitchen along with access to the kettle, microwave, sandwich press and toaster. I would be grateful if food is consumed in the dining area and not the bedroom. Please tidy after yourself by washing dishes or stacking cups etc. next to the kitchen sink.
interaction: I live in the front part of the house and work full time, so I may not be home very often or may not be available to greet you on arrival. Otherwise, key access is by a lock box so your arrival time is flexible. Your access code will be emailed to you. I am happy to help answer questions and will do my best to ensure you have a comfortable stay. Either way I am happy to interact as much or little as you choose. I do have 2 indoor cats that will be kept in the front area while I am not home. Again, you can choose if you would like to interact with them when I am home, otherwise I will keep them away from the shared area.
house_rules: - - Leave the area tidy please - - Respect for Neighbours - no loud noise  - - No visitors - - Eating or drinking in the dining area only please - - Conserve energy - turn off lights / air conditioner when not needed and when leaving the house - - Smoking outside only, not near open windows or doors - thanks
host_about: I love my job as a teacher in a local primary school. I am a keen photographer of all things beautiful and often carry my camera wherever I go. I am a Christian and am involved with a local church and love helping others. I have stayed at a few places using Airbnb and was impressed enough to consider hosting others. I have been local for 5 years but have a long family history in the area.

name: Gawler River Farm B and B.
summary: The comfortable, stylish, large one bedroom apartment is situated on a working sheep farm. Enjoy country life, night stars, birds at dawn. 30 min. to the Barossa Valley, 60 min. Clare Valley, 40 min. Adelaide CBD. 10 min. Gawler Gliding club.
space: Experience a country stay. Beautiful country outlooks, no traffic noise, clean fresh air. Very comfortable for 3 adults, with a Queen double and a single bed. Also a three seater lounge and en suite bathroom. A cot is available on request for  small children.
description: The comfortable, stylish, large one bedroom apartment is situated on a working sheep farm. Enjoy country life, night stars, birds at dawn. 30 min. to the Barossa Valley, 60 min. Clare Valley, 40 min. Adelaide CBD. 10 min. Gawler Gliding club. Experience a country stay. Beautiful country outlooks, no traffic noise, clean fresh air. Very comfortable for 3 adults, with a Queen double and a single bed. Also a three seater lounge and en suite bathroom. A cot is available on request for  small children. Guest have access to the garden and veranda areas. Tea, coffee and continental breakfast is provided. Inroom fridge facilities. i We live nearby and will be available to provide information and assistance if required. Tours of the farm and sheep viewing may be available if requested. The Gawler River area is the closest flat farming area to Adelaide. Studded with gum trees the farm land is park like. The view to the East is of the blue Mt Lofty ranges sweeping round to the Barossa Valley.  A
neighborhood_overview: The Gawler River area is the closest flat farming area to Adelaide. Studded with gum trees the farm land is park like. The view to the East is of the blue Mt Lofty ranges sweeping round to the Barossa Valley.
notes: We are centrally placed to Adelaide, Virginia and the Barossa Valley, Clare Valley wine areas. Angle Vale, Gawler and Two  Wells are our nearest towns. The Gawler Gliding club is nearby for flights and training.
transit: A car is required, although metropolitan trains run from Gawler (10kms away) to Adelaide CBD. We are situated 3km from the Northern Expressway. Parking is available at the apartment. Adelaide airport is 45min. by car.
access: Guest have access to the garden and veranda areas. Tea, coffee and continental breakfast is provided. Inroom fridge facilities. i
interaction: We live nearby and will be available to provide information and assistance if required. Tours of the farm and sheep viewing may be available if requested.

host_about:
We are a farming couple. Our farm runs stud sheep and we grow cereal crops. Having lived in Gawler River all our lives we have a detailed knowledge of the area, its history and attractions.
We enjoy traveling, meeting people and have many friends around the world. Especially through our long involvement with Rotary Youth Exchange.

name: Cornucopia Homestay, Greenock, Barossa Valley.
summary: Large bedroom with own private breakfast lounge/hall/porch area - in the centre of the sleepy village of Greenock. Walking distance to wineries, brewery, tavern, PO, a breakfast/ brunch cafe, general store, two bathrooms/toilets. Close driving distance to numerous winery and eating destinations in the Barossa.
space: The house was originally a police station in 1882 and a small winery in 1916.
description: Large bedroom with own private breakfast lounge/hall/porch area - in the centre of the sleepy village of Greenock. Walking distance to wineries, brewery, tavern, PO, a breakfast/ brunch cafe, general store, two bathrooms/toilets. Close driving distance to numerous winery and eating destinations in the Barossa. The house was originally a police station in 1882 and a small winery in 1916. You will have access to your room, the front porch, your own eating/dining room adjacent your bedroom and shared  bathroom and kitchen areas. There is a door shutting your area off from the shared areas for privacy. Vicki and John are happy to advise on where to go and what to do.  John is particularly knowledgable in regards to wine/winemaking and things to do here in the Barossa. As its name suggests, Greenock is delightful unassuming village in the Barossa with a largely untouched 19th century streetscape. The township is located on the Mawson Bike Trail and the Heysen Bushwalking Trail.  You can wal
neighborhood_overview: As its name suggests, Greenock is delightful unassuming village in the Barossa with a largely untouched 19th century streetscape. The township is located on the Mawson Bike Trail and the Heysen Bushwalking Trail.  You can walk to Murray Street Vineyards, Kalleske Wines and small winery Ballycroft Winery. Barossa Brewing Company is also in easy walking distance and is open for tastings on weekends.  The local tavern, 50 metres away, has local beer on tap and great pub meals 7 days a week. El Estanco, is a popular little cafe serving from a breakfast/brunch style menu 8am to 6pm (except Tues.) and great coffee. Watch out  for when they fire up the wood oven for pizza and paella! We have a PO and general store. The Food Luddite cooking school is just down the road.  Greenock is also in close driving proximity to Seppeltsfield Winery and the Jam Factory (think art not jam) and some excellent dining.  (Hentley Farm, Appellation, Fino's)
notes: A fold up bed is available for a third guest if required. It can be set up in your private lounge/breakfast area.
transit: It's best to have a car in the Barossa.  Organise car rentals in Adelaide.
access: You will have access to your room, the front porch, your own eating/dining room adjacent your bedroom and shared  bathroom and kitchen areas. There is a door shutting your area off from the shared areas for privacy.
interaction: Vicki and John are happy to advise on where to go and what to do.  John is particularly knowledgable in regards to wine/winemaking and things to do here in the Barossa.
house_rules: Please no smoking inside.  No visitors. We are a mature couple that value respect, honesty and kindness.
host_about: I have travelled extensively over the years mostly preferring to spend my travelling money on experienced and meeting locals rather than luxurious accommodation.  I think this is reflected our style of hosting. It's comfortable and clean and right in the heart of a village life experience.   An ex-teacher, I now pursue my interests and passions.  I make fermented vegetables (sauerkraut, kimchi etc) for the local Farmers' Markets. I make art in various mediums including encaustic wax.  I also make Eco Wax Foodwraps.  We have chooks and 2 hives on the large residential block.  Our bees are friendly and you would have to go looking for them to find them.  John, my partner,  left the wine industry to pursue his passion for olives and olive oil full time about 8 years ago.  He is well versed on the making of wine and knows the local wine industry very well.  We understand that sometimes you want to chat and connect - and sometimes it is nice to have your own space and privacy.  Our home is unusual because both rooms can be closed off from the main shared spaces.

The property is near the village Lutheran church and cemetery. We are not under any flight paths or near live firing ranges, busy intersections, schools, night clubs etc. So you can expect a quiet peaceful stay!

name: Barossa Bank Great Escape
summary: 1880's Bluestone Heritage Bank at Greenock in the Barossa Valley Wine region, South Australia. Explore wineries, gourmet foods, curl up with a book or laugh with kookaburras. History-Antiques-Modern amenities. A Perfect Blend Rediscover 'You"
space: I'm passionate about travel, real estate and furniture restoration and interior design, as well as family. My brother Bernard, a Chef, is equally passionate about Cooking, Cooking and Cooking. As he'd spent many years away from his home at Greenock we decided to team up and offer to others, accommodation in this  beautifully renovated 1880's bluestone Heritage Bank on the main street of tranquil Greenock.

Experience the charm of an authentic, historic building with all the convenience of modern amenities. The extension gives a
neighborhood_overview: Greenock is characterised by streets lined with shady peppercorn trees. Established in a small town on the north-west edge of the renowned Barossa Valley Wine region. There's a farmers market " Artisans at Greenock" every 2nd Friday of the month from October to March 5.30- 8.30pm make time to wander in, meet the locals and stock up with food and wines , homemade crafts, cheese and honey along with live music. The Greenock Creek Tavern is only steps away, great food and friendly folks,the hub of the town. Position perfect to slip into Sepplesfield or take off to Tanunda, Barossa Bank Great Escape is an oasis, a place to call home.  Local award winning restaurants Fino and Hently Farm are not to be missed but do book early before you leave home . "So close but so far"  if it's fully booked . They're only a few km away.
notes: Barossa Bank Great Escape overlooks is the charming Greenock recreation park with oval, rotunda, grandstand and playground facilities. Feel free to take your morning and evening stroll around the oval, watch the cricket and football teams train after work. Participate with the locals for special events. Just 2kms away, FINO restaurant at Seppelt's Winery has just open their door for amazing Lunch or Dinners. On the way try a tasting at the much awarded Greenock Creek Winery. SPECIAL RATES  apply for South Australian Public Holidays Christmas, Easter,Anzac Day, Adelaide Cup, Queens Birthday, Labor Day and School Holidays, Vintage Festival period in APRIL and for Regional Special Events.  MINIMUM BOOKINGS  3 nights  MINIMUM ROOMS - Two rooms (4 guests) ADDITIONAL GUESTS after initial 2 at $75 per person CLEANING CHARGE $150 for all bookings
transit: Adelaide 1 h (72.3 km) via National Highway A1, National Hwy M20 and National Highway A20  Barossa Bank Great Escape has a local general store and Post office and is a 5 minute drive to Nuriootpa for shops and supplies and surrounded by wineries and small providores such as Maggie Beer Car hire is available from the Adelaide Airport and you'll need a car to explore the wealth of options available from winery and farm tours to restaurants. The speed limit is 100km per hour unless otherwise indicated Some expressway zones are 110kph Speed in built up areas reduces to 50kph and speed cameras will catch you with costly fines if you exceed limits. Chauffeured tours are available for visitors wanting to enjoy the wine experience with out drink driving. Drink responsibly.
access: Books! an amazing historic Library/ Parlour. Eclectic style of Antiques and contemporary, air conditioned luxury when you choose to take a break from fine dining, wine tasting and tours through the historic Barossa Valley. Experience the charm of an authentic, historic building with all the convenience of modern amenities. The extension gives an upmarket kitchen entertainment area with access through stack back doors to year round undercover alfresco lifestyle. Quality Bed linen, upmarket kitchen wares, great selection of DVD's and CD's Please use any of the kitchenware and pantry provisions as if it were your own home.  The linen cupboard /store while unlocked is not for general usage as all necessities are provided in bedrooms and bathrooms.
interaction: Key will be left on a lock box for the guest to collect on arrival. I will speak to you by phone once you have arrived. If arriving after dark you may need a torch app on your phone to see the key code to access House keys.
house_rules: Relax and Enjoy Use any of the pantry and fridge contents Please leave a message if you use the last of anything so we can restock Library/Parlour fireplace and bedroom fireplaces are ornamental only  The home is fully ducted for heating and cooling . Animals not allowed Smoking in the house not permitted Use of additional beds or bedrooms not booked will be charged  We want you to enjoy the serenity and hope you'll respect our neighbours right to quiet too.

name: Greenock's Old Telegraph Station
summary: Escape, Relax, Unwind, Explore..... Experience all that the Barossa Valley has to offer from your home away from home in this restored heritage cottage located in a quiet village setting close to award winning wineries.
space: The cottage is for your exclusive use when you stay. It offers accommodation for up to four guests. There are two bedrooms (one containing a queen bed and the other a double bed, both with electric blankets). The separate lounge room has comfy couches, with a television and a selection of DVDs to watch. In the fully equipped kitchen you will find a cooktop, microwave, fridge, table and chairs, coffee and tea making facilities, utensils etc; everything you need for self catering. The large bathroom contains a 2 person spa with shower over, hand basin and toilet. There is also a washing machine. We provide quality bath towels and bath robes for your use. Heating and cooling is provided by reverse cycle air conditioning and a combustion heater. There is a selection of books, magazines, games and puzzles to keep yourself entertained. Outdoors, in the fully enclosed rear garden (pets welcome by negotiation) is a gas barbecue with hood, undercover table and seating.

neighborhood_overview: Within easy walking distance of the cottage are two award winning wineries and a boutique brewery as well as the local pub which serves generous sized meals. Within close driving distance are many more well known wineries and restaurants and the main shopping/tourist precincts of the Barossa Valley.
notes: Included in your stay are generous continental and cooked breakfast provisions, including cereal, bacon, eggs, tomatoes, bread, selection of spreads, butter, milk, juice, tea and coffee. We also provide a bottle of complimentary Barossa wine (your choice of red or white) for stays of two or more nights. There is free wireless internet access. A baby cot and high chair are available free on request.
access: Guests have exclusive access to the entire property. There is onsite parking and free on street parking.
interaction: The cottage has a keyless entry lock so guests are welcome to check in at their convenience. I am available for assistance with any concerns if needed.
house_rules: The cottage is strictly a non-smoking premise. If evidence of smoking is detected, a cleaning fee will be charged to the guest. We realise accidents happen, but any wilful damage, including any damage by pets, will be charged to the guest. The cottage is for the use of the booked guests only.

name: Shea-Oak Log Studio Shed
summary: Our converted shed is a cozy and comfortable one bedroomed studio with glossy kitchen, granite bench tops, timber floors, shiny bathroom and large carpeted bedroom with a comfy queen bed. The studio has everything you could possibly need to have a wonderful and comfortable stay. Located in western Barossa, just off the Sturt Hwy, minutes away from Barossa attractions and 50 minutes from Adelaide. Be Consumed-In the Barossa.
space: The Shea-Oak Log Studio AKA The Shed, is a lovely space. A large double glass sliding door lets the morning sun stream in onto the timber floor. There is 2 leather lounges which seats 5 people with ease. The extra large bedroom has a queen bed and room for a portacot, if needed. The Studio is set up to fit 2 people with comfort.  The Studio is full insulated and very comfortable in any weather, with 2 air conditioners, portable heater and a fan. The Studio is located at the southern end of our property, which is only around 200 metres off of the Sturt Highway. You will hear some road noise from time to time.

The Studio is full insulated and very comfortable in any weather, with 2 air conditioners, portable heater and a fan. The Studio is located at the southern end of our property, which is only around 200 metres off of the Sturt Highway. You w
neighborhood_overview: The Studio is located in a very unique area. There are no close by neighbouring houses, you are moments off of the Sturt Highway which leads you to the heart of the Barossa in 10 minutes and to Adelaide in 50 minutes. The studio is situated at the southern end of our property which is close to the Sturt Highway, this is great for access but you can hear the road noise from the studio. You are surrounded by the Barossa Ranges, vineyards and broadacre crops. No one will bother you here! Only our little miniature schnauzers Hugo and Alfie, who likes to come and say hello from time to time!
notes: The Studio is located on an old vineyard. We are in the middle of rebuilding the vineyard as the Pinery Fire in 2015 destroyed the majority of our lovely vines.  Also, it is good to remember that this a farm and we are surrounded by broad acre crops and vineyards. Occasionally you may see some of the local wildlife like mice and snakes around the place, but we do do our best to keep them at bay. Its all a part of country living! Our property was burnt out in the Pinery Fire in 2015, destroying the majority of our vineyard, all the fences, gardens and a lot of the trees. We are gradually rebuilding and replanting. It's a very slow process but we will return the property back to its former glory soon enough.
transit: A car is a must if staying at the Studio. There is no public transport available. Your car has its own double carport! Taxi's are available. The Airport Flyer also is available. The closest public transport is in Gawler, only 10 minutes away, with trains and buses available.  Tour buses pick up guests regularly from the The Studio.
access: The Studio is a converted shed. With half of the shed converted into living quarters and the other half remains an implement shed for the vineyard equipment. There is a door joining the two areas but this remains locked at all times.  Guests will have access to all the living areas, bathroom and bedroom and are also very welcome to wander through the orchard and vineyards around the Studio. The Studio does not have a washing machine. But there are laundry mats in Gawler and guests can use the clothes line out the back of the studio.  Please be conscious that this is a working vineyard and machinery does move around the vineyard from time to time. Also, we are very rural and have numerous wildlife come to visit including foxes, mice, kangaroos, emus, snakes and endless birds.
interaction: The Studio is totally self contained with access to the property via a locked security key box. The code is given to guest prior to arrival. We understand that guests like to be independent and not disturbed, so we leave you to your own devices. But, as we are only 500mt away, if there are any problems, we are close by to lend a hand or offer some advice on where to go and what to see. The Studio also has a wide array of local brochures and maps.
house_rules: Check-in time is from 2PM onwards unless with prior arrangement. Check out time is by 10am unless with prior arrangement. No smoking inside the property. If smoking on the deck, please dispose of all butt. Be very careful with smoking outside as we live in a high fire risk zone and were severely effected by the Pinery Fire in 2015. Two people maximum sleeping in the property, unless with prior arrangement. A portacot can be arranged if a baby is required to stay. Feel free to pat the ponies but be aware that the fence is electrified. The ponies love apples and carrots but nothing else please. Please be aware that this is a rural property and we coexist with little creatures such as rabbits, lizards, mice and the odd snake. Please take care. Our property was severely impacted by the Pinery fire in November 2015. We lost everything besides our house and the studio. The vineyard along with all fencing, sheds, equipment and gardens were destroyed. It was devastating. We are slowly bring th
host_about:
We are a family of 4 who live, work and play in the Barossa Valley. We live on a small vineyard and make our own wine. We love the big outdoors, camping, the Murray river and doing things as a family. 
We are true locals and know the Barossa inside and out.
We live on the property but are far enough away to not bother you at all and let you enjoy yourselves but close enough if you have any problems.

name: Grand Cru Estate Homestead
summary: This Homestead is a rural splendour surrounded by a 5 ha garden with its own lake & vineyard. The Homestead has been set up to be a luxury experience with its own unique and personal touches inc. a library full of books.  A complete experience with peace and tranquillity. Peter Seppelt Wines available too. The Homestead is ideal for couples or works exceptionally well for a group travelling together.
space: If one couple books the Homestead then no other bookings can be taken. In other words there is no sharing with strangers even though only 1 or the 3 bedrooms have been booked! If two individuals wish to book then two bedrooms need to be paid for. If three individuals book then three bedrooms need to be booked.

It works wonderfully for 2 and 3 couples sharing as a group travelling together.

name: Sunset Cottage at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
summary: Created from the old 1860 stone dairy, the two-bedroom Sunset Cottage features open plan living, dining and kitchen areas with French doors that open out into a paved outdoor entertaining area with tranquil country views.  With warm timber floors, antique and contemporary furniture, modern amenities and a full kitchen, it’s designed for your absolute comfort and privacy. The bedrooms are at opposite ends of the cottage – each opening out via French doors to private landscaped gardens.
description: Created from the old 1860 stone dairy, the two-bedroom Sunset Cottage features open plan living, dining and kitchen areas with French doors that open out into a paved outdoor entertaining area with tranquil country views.  With warm timber floors, antique and contemporary furniture, modern amenities and a full kitchen, it’s designed for your absolute comfort and privacy. The bedrooms are at opposite ends of the cottage – each opening out via French doors to private landscaped gardens. 1860 Wine Country Cottages is non hosted holiday accommodation.  Our philosophy is to respect your privacy so we wont disturb you in your cottage during your stay. We visit the property mid morning on most days so please say hello if you see us. We live 10km away and you will receive telephone contact details for emergencies. Breakfast provisions are provided as an extra at $15/person/night - min 2 nights.

name: The Stables at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
summary: This old stone building has been in use since the 1860s, including as crop storage,  machinery shed and stables.   Now it’s been reimagined into a secluded hideaway for two with the perfect ingredients for pure luxury. There’s more of everything in The Stables – set on its own 500m2 block away from the other cottages, it includes a large living space, a spacious entertaining deck, private garden, high ceilings, cathedral skylights, extra large spa bath and log fire to cuddle up next to.
space: Recharge your senses and enjoy a restful escape in the heart of boutique wine country at 1860 Wine Country Cottages, only an hour’s drive from Adelaide.  Here you’ll find all the ingredients for a relaxing break away from the everyday:  •Explore new tastes. Work your way through our three unique Boutique Wine and Food Trails, designed to give you a taste of the very best Eden Valley and the Adelaide Hills has to offer. •Take a stroll on the wild side. Take your time and explore our neighbourhood set amongst vineyards, rolling hills, farms and wildlife.  •Experience the quiet of the countryside.  Breathe in the fresh country air while you soak up the sun in your private outdoor area. Listen to the birds’ call and watch them wheel around the sky. Hear the wind whisper through stately red gums. Feel yourself unwind! •Rejuvenate yourself. Rest up in your secluded luxury stone cottage – they’re the perfect mix of picturesque and contemporary style.   The perfect base to explore Eden Valley

name: Dawn Cottage at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
summary: The studio style Dawn Cottage is a retreat for couples who want that intimate stay with a dose of luxury and privacy.  Enjoy a large private timber deck and paved BBQ entertaining area with elevated views of the original 1860 Homestead, original stone outbuildings, paddocks, dam, surrounding hills, our own vines and livestock.  The cottage’s spacious open plan design features an exquisite mix of antique and new furniture.  Cook up a lavish breakfast in the kitchen or have a BBQ on the deck.
