name: (M) Large room in Country Guest House-w/breakfast
summary: Barossavilla Guest House is a country style hosted Bed & Breakfast, offering genuine Barossa hospitality. Set on a peaceful 11 acre property, with an outlook to the Barossa Ranges, there is plenty of space to explore and wander. Centrally located in the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyards, and on the outskirts of Tanunda, there are garden and/or vineyard views from every room. This ideally situated property is just a 5 minute drive from the main street of Tanunda.
space: Offering: - 4 large and secure bedrooms - Complimentary country style continental/hot buffet breakfast - Free Wi-Fi - Guest lounge/dining room with TV/DVD player - Tranquil setting with great views -All guests share two large and modern guest bathrooms during their stay (the new second bathroom is wheelchair accessible) Guest comfort is assured with meticulous attention to cleanliness and freshly washed linen a top priority - Separate shared guest toilets - Tea/coffee making facilities - In room and household heating/cooling - Piano, air hockey, table tennis, foosball & board games available - Extensive back-yard with children’s play area - Shaded verandah/patio outdoors with views to Barossa Ranges - Porta-cot/camp beds available for small fee (0-12 yrs only) - Free on-site parking A communal lounge/dining room with TV/DVD player, piano, air hockey, table tennis and foosball is available for guests should they wish to relax and unwind somewhere informal. The large back-yard is perfect
description: Barossavilla Guest House is a country style hosted Bed & Breakfast, offering genuine Barossa hospitality. Set on a peaceful 11 acre property, with an outlook to the Barossa Ranges, there is plenty of space to explore and wander. Centrally located in the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyards, and on the outskirts of Tanunda, there are garden and/or vineyard views from every room. This ideally situated property is just a 5 minute drive from the main street of Tanunda. Offering: - 4 large and secure bedrooms - Complimentary country style continental/hot buffet breakfast - Free Wi-Fi - Guest lounge/dining room with TV/DVD player - Tranquil setting with great views -All guests share two large and modern guest bathrooms during their stay (the new second bathroom is wheelchair accessible) Guest comfort is assured with meticulous attention to cleanliness and freshly washed linen a top priority - Separate shared guest toilets - Tea/coffee making facilities - In room and household heating/cool
neighborhood_overview: The main street of Tanunda is about a 30-40 minute stroll (or 20 mins if you're a fast walker!) and about a 5 min drive by car. Barossavilla Guest House is within walking distance to: The REX (Barossa Aquatic and Fitness Centre)  Rusden Wines Barossa Arts & Convention Centre Tanunda Bakery
notes: Barossavilla Guest House has two outside farm cats who are not allowed inside (they are country cats whose sole purpose is to catch mice!)...naturally, they are fed daily and they get frequent pats and attention :o) This property runs on tank rainwater, so please be water conscious during your stay.
transit: Tanunda is approximately 65 kms ( 1 hour drive) from Adelaide by car. There is no public transport available directly to our home, although Link SA provides limited bus transport between Angaston, Nuriootpa & Tanunda and Gawler where you can catch the Metro train to/from Adelaide.   Timetables are available on the Link SA and Adelaide Metro websites.
access: Barossavilla Guest House is a country style hosted Bed & Breakfast, so the family share this residence. (The family have separate living quarters and bathroom) A key may be provided for after-hours access.
interaction: Please be considerate of other guests who may also be staying in the Guest House. Guests are at liberty to make their own plans, however, assistance and guidance is provided to guests when requested.  Barossavilla Guest House is able to offer many suggestions and recommendations of favourite places to visit. For the comfort and security of all guests, unreasonable noise, illegal or inappropriate behaviour will not be tolerated.
house_rules: Barossavilla Guest House is pleased to provide a smoke-free environment. Guests are kindly requested to remove their shoes when inside the Guest House. Additional visitors are not permitted without prior approval. Whilst Barossavilla Guest House does not charge a cleaning fee, it is expected that all guests respect the Guest House and keep the rooms/house clean & tidy. No food or drink is permitted in the bedrooms (except water).  No pets are allowed on the property without prior approval. Guests may be required to show a photo ID and credit card upon check-in. When booking, please remember that your children/babies are counted as guests, so include them in your booking request.
host_about:
Barossavilla Guest House is a country style, hosted Bed & Breakfast set on a peaceful 11 acre property with plenty of space to explore and wander.  

Centrally located in the Barossa Valley, amidst vineyards, and on the outskirts of Tanunda, there are vineyard views from almost every room of the house.  

This family friendly property is just a 5-minute drive from the main street of Tanunda.

A message from resident hosts, Jim & Michelle...

Welcome to our little corner of the world...

We love sharing the wonderful Barossa Valley with people from all walks of life.    

We open our hearts, our home and share the things we love about the valley, and we hope you enjoy your stay! ​

name: Barossa family Holiday Home
summary: Our relaxing family home is spacious & beautiful. There is plenty to do here, or the perfect place to relax after enjoying all the Barossa has to offer. Perfect for a large family or friendly couples to enjoy. TVs in most room. We have a mini gym, table tennis, Foxtel, outdoor entertaining and plenty of activities to keep kids/families entertained. Fresh comfy linen supplied.Pets negotiable.
space: Our space is unique as it has the luxury of most other accommodations however it is also family friendly. It will be just as great for 3-4 couples to stay (please request extra double beds if this is the case) as it would be for a large family or even 2 family's to enjoy. With this in mind sharing the cost makes or beautiful home great value. Baby needs are also accommodated with a high chair and portacot supplied. Guests would be able to stay home for a rest day and still have as much to do, as if they had gone out! Us having 4 kids makes our home great for people to stay with their children as our house is child proof. It also accomodates the very loved family pet (upon negotiation) our back yard is fully secured. Entrance gates are able to be locked for children and pets safety. We can provide a pet bed as well. We know what it is like to travel with children so rest assured our home is a place parents can relax and let their children enjoy all our house has to offer. We have also a

neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is a beautiful base for exploring the Barossa. In Lyndoch we have online grocery shopping and pizza delivery available yet we also have amazing local dining in this quiet aesthetic town. From fine dining at the lord Lyndoch to the best cafe meal around at Kies winery Monkey nut cafe (lunch only) Lyndoch is surrounded by the beautiful Barossa ranges (of which you can see from our kitchen) and vineyards on every edge of town. The local people are friendly and always happy to help, and if you want to venture further into the Barossa we are a short 10minute drive to Tanunda!  If you are looking for accommodation for an event such as "day on the green" or a wedding, we are happy to provide transport to and from the event for a small fee so you won't even have to wait for a taxi (and much cheaper to)
notes: At our property we have  All Foxtel channels Unlimited wifi  TV/DVD player in all rooms except master bedroom Mini gym, including treadmill, exercise bike, cross trainer and row machine with a tv to watch while you workout.  Table tennis table Many board and card games. Ask about our WINTER SPECIALS
transit: There is a bus link available (information will be provided) how ever that is the extent of public transport. Many tours of winery's are available as are taxi companies. As I have already mentioned, we are available at all times to provide transport to and from an event, and even airport transfers for a fee.
access: Guests have complete access to our home. We want you to feel like you are at a home away from home. For long stays we are able to provide a cleaner (for a small fee) so you can enjoy your holiday without the everyday medial tasks. We love our home, and our aim is for our guests to Love and enjoy their stay. If you have any requests or special needs please feel free to ask upon booking and every effort will be made to accommodate these. Baby supplies also available. Please advise prior to arrival and we will have a high chair, portacot and any other requests available.
interaction: We are available 24/7 for our guests. My husband and I work as a team so that there is always someone available to answer questions or solve any problems/issues that may arise. We love and take pride in our family home, we want our guests to enjoy their time and make themselves at home.
house_rules: Smoking to be outside please. Ask about WINTER SPECIALS Pets are welcome but must be supervised when inside. The Garage is set up as the gym and "kids Zone" If you are wishing to park in the garage we need to be advised at least 2 days prior to arrival. Please ensure cars are parked in the driveway or on the barked area next to the driveway.
host_about: I'm a registered nurse turned b&b owner. I have four beautiful children, a wonderful husband and the best dad & sister a girl could ask for. Plus an amazing Mother in law who enjoys this b&b experience with me. We are Loving the Barossa life :)

name: Barossa Vineyard Cottages
summary: Situated in Bethany, our fully self-contained stone cottages are located in the heart of the Barossa Valley.  Bordered by vineyards and a stunning outlook to the Barossa Ranges, the area is steeped in history and boasts of great walks as well as being surrounded by award winning wineries and restaurants. With modern comforts behind classic settler style and grace, our cottages remain comfortable in every season.

name: The Miners Cottage Barossa
summary: The Miners Cottage is beautifully restored with modern comforts and old world charm. Open fire, gorgeous bathroom, comfy bed, peace and quiet, sleeps two. The Miners Barn, right next to the cottage, can be added to your booking to sleep an extra two people. Beautiful views from every aspect.
space: The Miners Cottage - sleeps 2. Beautiful stone cottage with one bedroom, open fireplace, sitting room and kitchenette. Modern bathroom with claw foot bath, double shower, underfloor heating and heated towel rail.  Deep back veranda overlooks the pool and winter creek. Lovely red gum outdoor table for eating meals. BBQ & outdoor heater. Also have access to the full kitchen and TV sitting room in the Barn The Miners Cottage Barn - sleeps 2. Old timber on the outside, modern on the inside. One bedroom with ensuite shower, (use toilet in cottage bathroom). Full kitchen facilities - oven, gas hot plates,  dishwasher, Nespresso coffee machine, TV.  Breakfast provisions included for cooked and continental breakfast, linen, towels and other luxury extras also included. A fold out bed or portacot is available.  There is only room to fit one child in the cottage.  Small inside dogs (under 15kg) are permitted with prior approval. We do ask that they don't go on the furniture or bedding.  If you k

neighborhood_overview: Set in rural surrounds on the edge of the Barossa, 7 mins to Lyndoch, 10 mins to Gawler, 15 mins to Tanunda, 30 mins to Angaston.  Tour the wineries, visit the farmers market, eat out, ride the Bike trail, fossick in an antique store...
notes: The Cottage and Barn are side by side.  You can enjoy time together and also have your privacy. There is no Wifi available. Telstra service is great but Optus service is patchy
transit: Local tour companies Taxi
access: Access to pool and Cabana. On 18 acres, lovely walks
interaction: Rebecca is usually on hand to greet guests and and answer questions as needed.
house_rules: Small dogs under 14kg are welcome. We ask that they do not go on the beds or furniture. Guests are required to clean up after their dogs inside and out. An additional $50 pet cleaning charge will apply. No Smoking
host_about: Rebecca lives on the property with her husband and their 3 children.  They have a dog, cat, chooks, a duck and a few pet sheep.  Chances are you'll enjoy eggs fresh from the henhouse when you stay at The Miners Cottage!

name: Lavender Cabin
summary: The Lavender Cabin has a queen size bed suitable for up to two people. The main room has a bed, leather couch, small table, and is air conditioned. There is an adjoining bathroom to the bedroom with a shower, toilet, sink, bar-fridge, washing machine and clothes dryer. Basic breakfast provisions such as cereal, toast, tea and coffee will also be provided. There is room next to the bed for a fold out bed or portacot to accommodate a child if needed.
description: The Lavender Cabin has a queen size bed suitable for up to two people. The main room has a bed, leather couch, small table, and is air conditioned. There is an adjoining bathroom to the bedroom with a shower, toilet, sink, bar-fridge, washing machine and clothes dryer. Basic breakfast provisions such as cereal, toast, tea and coffee will also be provided. There is room next to the bed for a fold out bed or portacot to accommodate a child if needed. Guests will have access to the bedroom and bathroom. I live on the property with my family and someone is usually available to greet you and if need anything. The Lavender Cabin is situated near the Whispering Wall as well as the Barossa Goldfields walking trails. There is no public transport in the area and you will be required to arrange your own transportation. There is no wifi available or cooking facilities besides a kettle, bar-fridge and toaster.

house_rules: Check in and Check out Please notify me of your estimated arrival time at least one day before arrival.  Check in/check out will be as stated unless prior arrangements have been made prior to arrival.  Your other responsibilities  Guests are responsible for damage, breakages, theft and loss of the property and any part of it during your stay. You must notify me of this immediately and you may be charged repair or replacement costs.  Only guests nominated and agreed upon in the booking may stay at the property overnight. If any other guests stay extra charges may apply or the agreement may be terminated without refund.  Excessive noise or disturbance to the residences of the property will not be tolerated and may result in termination of your booking.  Before departure all rubbish must be put in bins provided and the cottage should be left in a tidy condition.  The washing machine and dryer may be used by guests.  Smoking is not permitted on the property.  Problems or complaints  In the

name: Luxurious kingsize bed, ensuite & exclusive lounge
summary: TV in bedroom & private lounge, coffee/tea making facilities in room & a large shared kitchen with butlers pantry. 4 wineries within 14 min walk. Quiet & safe cul-de-sac with off street parking in easy walking distance to Tanunda town centre including restaurants Ferment Asia, 1918 and many great coffee shops & bakeries. Short distance to Applelation, Fino & Maggie Beer’s Farm Shop. Fully equipped gym and 25m pool 4 minute drive. Newly built house with classic European decor in Langmeil Estate.
description: TV in bedroom & private lounge, coffee/tea making facilities in room & a large shared kitchen with butlers pantry. 4 wineries within 14 min walk. Quiet & safe cul-de-sac with off street parking in easy walking distance to Tanunda town centre including restaurants Ferment Asia, 1918 and many great coffee shops & bakeries. Short distance to Applelation, Fino & Maggie Beer’s Farm Shop. Fully equipped gym and 25m pool 4 minute drive. Newly built house with classic European decor in Langmeil Estate.
house_rules: - Check in 4-8pm and check out 11am. Arriving slightly earlier, or wanting an extra hour to sleep? Should be fine, but please check with us first. Being a family home we have a non-smoking policy however you are welcome to smoke outside. We are unobtrusively discreet however just at the other end of the house or a phone call away if you need us. We do have two cats that are weary of strangers and live outside most of the time.
host_about: We are Anna, a Kiwi, and David an Irishman,  living in the beautiful Barossa Valley with our grown up children for the last 7 years. We lead an active and full life so you will often have the house to yourself. We have both travelled and thoroughly enjoy meeting new people and sharing our local knowledge. We look forward to meeting you and welcoming you into our home.

name: Barossa Idyll Studio
summary: Barossa Idyll (formerly Barossa Seasons) Studio is located in the centre of the Barossa in Tanunda a short walk to cafes and restaurants. Attached to Barossa Idyll and with beautiful lawns and gardens this is set in amongst magnificent Barossa vineyard and hills views.
space: Barossa Idyll Studio is small and cosy but beautifully appointed with a Queen bed , in a mid century style. A  brand new bathroom with double vanity.  Fully air conditioned and with smart tv also. Great for romantic stays. The studio is set in a lovely gardened area. Walking distance to beautiful café breakfasts! *Mid week special* discount price as listed for minimum two night booking- weekends at full price
description: Barossa Idyll (formerly Barossa Seasons) Studio is located in the centre of the Barossa in Tanunda a short walk to cafes and restaurants. Attached to Barossa Idyll and with beautiful lawns and gardens this is set in amongst magnificent Barossa vineyard and hills views. Barossa Idyll Studio is small and cosy but beautifully appointed with a Queen bed , in a mid century style. A  brand new bathroom with double vanity.  Fully air conditioned and with smart tv also. Great for romantic stays. The studio is set in a lovely gardened area. Walking distance to beautiful café breakfasts! *Mid week special* discount price as listed for minimum two night booking- weekends at full price Barossa Idyll Studio is attached to but private from Barossa Idyll. There is a private entrance with a No. 3 beside the door and a designated car park at the front of the Studio. To the side of the Barossa Idyll Studio is a private garden area with deck chairs for lounging and a small table and chairs  to enjoy a me
neighborhood_overview: Barossa Idyll is located in the centre of the Barossa in the main street of Tanunda. There are  cafes , hotels and restaurants within in a few minutes walking distance . There are many wineries a short drive away. The Barossa Visitor Centre is also located in Tanunda.
notes: As this is a Studio; there are no breakfast provisions or cooking facilities however tea and coffee making facilities are provided with a small bar fridge. There are also several cafes open early within a few minutes walk for fantastic breakfasts. We ask that you park in the driveway and not the lawns please.
access: Barossa Idyll Studio is attached to but private from Barossa Idyll. There is a private entrance with a No. 3 beside the door and a designated car park at the front of the Studio. To the side of the Barossa Idyll Studio is a private garden area with deck chairs for lounging and a small table and chairs  to enjoy a meal or a coffee .
interaction: I am contactable by phone for any queries during your stay.
house_rules: We ask that you respect the privacy of any other guests at the time of your stay. This is a no smoking Studio and it is not suitable for pets. Check out is by 11am on the day of departure unless other arrangements have been made with us
host_about: Our family has had many wonderful experiences travelling in other countries and I would love to share the experience of our regions with you. Living between the vineyards and the coast we are able to share the lifestyle of both with our guests.

name: Luxury & tranquility in the heart of the Barossa
summary: Heritage, peace and tranquility in the heart of the Barossa Valley.  Five minute stroll to Tanunda main street, restaurants, cafes and shops.  Private rooms in family, period property circa 1910, king size bed, ensuite shower and wc, sheltered and secluded outdoor heated spa bath.  Shared use of inground pool in the summer months.  Adjacent, private lounge with Foxtel and cosy open log fire.  Off street parking.
space: King size bedroom with en-suite and adjoining private outdoor spa bath in a beautiful setting. A short walk from the cafes, restaurants and bars in Tanunda and ideally positioned for the ultimate wine adventure!
description: Heritage, peace and tranquility in the heart of the Barossa Valley.  Five minute stroll to Tanunda main street, restaurants, cafes and shops.  Private rooms in family, period property circa 1910, king size bed, ensuite shower and wc, sheltered and secluded outdoor heated spa bath.  Shared use of inground pool in the summer months.  Adjacent, private lounge with Foxtel and cosy open log fire.  Off street parking. King size bedroom with en-suite and adjoining private outdoor spa bath in a beautiful setting. A short walk from the cafes, restaurants and bars in Tanunda and ideally positioned for the ultimate wine adventure! Private use of the comfortable lounge with wide screen tv, Foxtel and a cosy log fire for chilly evenings. Free wifi access We’re happy to be as accessible as you wish. If you’re looking for some private time that’s great, if you want to interact with us then you will find us friendly and approachable Tanunda is the jewel in the crown of the Barossa with plenty to see a
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is the jewel in the crown of the Barossa with plenty to see and do. Walking distance to several world class wineries and a short drive to many more.
notes: We are self contained at the back of the house but will always be around to make sure you have everything you need for a relaxing and memorable stay
access: Private use of the comfortable lounge with wide screen tv, Foxtel and a cosy log fire for chilly evenings. Free wifi access
interaction: We’re happy to be as accessible as you wish. If you’re looking for some private time that’s great, if you want to interact with us then you will find us friendly and approachable
house_rules: - Quiet hours - 11pm to 6am
host_about: Can't believe I'm now semi retired and your AirBnB host.  That's what I call a job. A Pom and living in beautiful SA for 10 years with the family, the kids have just both flown the nest and my wife, Jo and I have plenty of space and lifestyle to share.  Music, sport. good food, wine and travel are my ideas of a relaxing time.  From my days in the Marines, to travels around Europe and most recently Asia, I love to see what's around the next corner.  Look forward to welcoming you to our home and back yard.  Safe Travels. Paul

name: Charming Room in Top Location
summary: Centrally located just metres from Tanunda's main street, this double room with adjacent private bathroom is comfortable and well maintained. Enjoy staying in a lovely home built in the 1920s with a modern extension and beautiful garden to relax in.
space: Location, location! Not only is this a lovely comfortable room in a very nice home, but to be within walking distance from Tanunda's shops, cafes & restaurants sets this property apart!
description: Centrally located just metres from Tanunda's main street, this double room with adjacent private bathroom is comfortable and well maintained. Enjoy staying in a lovely home built in the 1920s with a modern extension and beautiful garden to relax in. Location, location! Not only is this a lovely comfortable room in a very nice home, but to be within walking distance from Tanunda's shops, cafes & restaurants sets this property apart! Private double bedroom & bathroom. Use of living room, dining room, laundry, outside terrace & spacious garden. Level of interaction is up to individual guests. We live in the older part of Tanunda between the Main Street and historic 'Goat Square'. We have great neighbours & love being able to easily walk everywhere! FermentAsian & 1918 are 2 very popular restaurants that are only a 5 minute walk from the house. Trains run to Gawler from Adelaide with a bus connection to Tanunda. Limited buses available around the Barossa but there is taxi service. Bikes ca
neighborhood_overview: We live in the older part of Tanunda between the Main Street and historic 'Goat Square'. We have great neighbours & love being able to easily walk everywhere! FermentAsian & 1918 are 2 very popular restaurants that are only a 5 minute walk from the house.
notes: We do have a cat, Oscar, but he spends 99% of his time outside so he doesn't cause any trouble :). We also have some chickens in the backyard & it's fun to listen to them scratching around.
transit: Trains run to Gawler from Adelaide with a bus connection to Tanunda. Limited buses available around the Barossa but there is taxi service. Bikes can be rented at the Visitor Information Centre. Best way to get around is by car.
access: Private double bedroom & bathroom. Use of living room, dining room, laundry, outside terrace & spacious garden.
interaction: Level of interaction is up to individual guests.
house_rules: As this is a shared living situation, we do expect that guests respect our home & it's contents. Loud noise will not be tolerated & any damages will need to be compensated for.
host_about: Former corporate expat now wine industry professional, enjoying the Barossa Valley lifestyle & happy to share local knowledge & home with others visiting our beautiful region.

name: Angels Place
summary: Our place is located centrally in the town of Tanunda; close to wineries and world class restaurants the Barossa Valley is renowned for. Walking distance to many, and a short drive in any direction to the rest.  An easy stroll to the main street which offers a delightful range of shops, cafe's, restaurants and pubs. We are just a 15 min walk to Peter Lehmann Winery; venue of the annual  'A Day On The Green' event. There are many excellent walking trails and cycling tracks in the area.
space: There will be a detailed information folder in the room, a map, and tour brochures for your use.
description: Our place is located centrally in the town of Tanunda; close to wineries and world class restaurants the Barossa Valley is renowned for. Walking distance to many, and a short drive in any direction to the rest.  An easy stroll to the main street which offers a delightful range of shops, cafe's, restaurants and pubs. We are just a 15 min walk to Peter Lehmann Winery; venue of the annual  'A Day On The Green' event. There are many excellent walking trails and cycling tracks in the area. There will be a detailed information folder in the room, a map, and tour brochures for your use. You will have the private use of the Two Bedrooms, the sitting room and the bathroom. Also the outdoor seating area at the front of the house is for your enjoyment. (Please note that the second bedroom contains a Double Bed not a Queen Bed, but still very comfortable) We are happy to provide advice and directions and assist where possible.  One of us will always try to be present to greet you on arrival, but m
neighborhood_overview: Our street is quiet with a minimum of passing traffic.
notes: There is offstreet parking for two cars, one of them undercover.
access: You will have the private use of the Two Bedrooms, the sitting room and the bathroom. Also the outdoor seating area at the front of the house is for your enjoyment. (Please note that the second bedroom contains a Double Bed not a Queen Bed, but still very comfortable)
interaction: We are happy to provide advice and directions and assist where possible.  One of us will always try to be present to greet you on arrival, but may not always be there on departure. We will let you know where to leave the key when you go.
house_rules: - Although you will have exclusive use of the bathroom, outdoor seating area, and TV/ Sitting Room during your stay, these areas are a part of our home at other times and therefore some of our personal effects will be stored in the bathroom cupboard. We ask that you respect our privacy; these items are not for public use.  Unfortunately we are not able to cater for pets as family members have severe allergies. Smoking is permitted but ONLY outside.  Strictly NO parties and no extra guests over and above the 4 people the booking allows for.  There is a small bar fridge, and tea & coffee making facilities are provided. If there is something you need urgently or any information we can help you with we are certainly ready and willing to assist. We have lots of local knowledge and can give advice, directions and tips as we lead a very busy social life and have personally experienced many wonderful events and places to go to in the area. If you prefer to be left alone that’s fine too!  We ho
host_about:
I am married 34 years to Steve, we are both in our mid 50's, and have three adult children. I am self employed work from home bookkeeper for Steve's Interior Decorating business. We both love going to live music venues/festivals, he loves gardening and I love gardens. We enjoy tropical holidays, beaches, cycling, drinking wine and travelling in general. We take lots of short holidays, and now hope to visit some locations outside of Australia too. 
In our first year of hosting we have met many wonderful people and it continues to be a very positive experience.

name: Barossa Blue - Four Room Apartment
summary: The owner lives on the property - often not home. Your space is the front section...2 bedrooms, sitting room, bath, shower, toilet. Completely private. Lehmann road is a quiet, modern street within walking distance to the town and several wineries. There is a queen sized bed in Bedroom 1 and 2 single beds in bedroom 2. Optional sofa bed for a fifth or sixth person in the Sitting Room. Extra people above 2 - add $30.00 each per night.
space: The front part of the home is for your exclusive use. There is a sitting room with TV, sofa bed and dining table with a view of the front garden. There is also a large bathroom with bath and separate shower recess. Also a separate toilet and large vanity space (not shared). There are two bedrooms - one with a queen bed and the other with two single beds. Also an outdoor setting under a shade sail in the front garden.
description: The owner lives on the property - often not home. Your space is the front section...2 bedrooms, sitting room, bath, shower, toilet. Completely private. Lehmann road is a quiet, modern street within walking distance to the town and several wineries. There is a queen sized bed in Bedroom 1 and 2 single beds in bedroom 2. Optional sofa bed for a fifth or sixth person in the Sitting Room. Extra people above 2 - add $30.00 each per night. The front part of the home is for your exclusive use. There is a sitting room with TV, sofa bed and dining table with a view of the front garden. There is also a large bathroom with bath and separate shower recess. Also a separate toilet and large vanity space (not shared). There are two bedrooms - one with a queen bed and the other with two single beds. Also an outdoor setting under a shade sail in the front garden. Free Wi-fFi. Optional access to washing machine, iron and laundry. I supply coffee/tea making facilities, breakfast provisions and a fridge/f
neighborhood_overview: A very quiet modern street with very little traffic. Close to many wineries and Maggie Beer's Pheasant Farm.
notes: Free Wifi.  Network is Beam(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).  Password is llation8 Angaston.  Angaston Farmers Market each Saturday from 7.30 to 11.30. Beautiful local produce...I have a Patisserie stall there. Coffee from Barossa Coffee Roasters and great breakfast.  Angaston Main Street is a lovely walk and has the Barossa Brauhaus and renowned Roaring Forties Cafe.  Nuriootpa.  Nuriootpa is not as "touristy" as Tanunda or Angaston but has some really charming shops in the Main Street.  The Vine Inn has both formal dining and Bistro Style.  The Angas Park Hotel is more old fashioned and  cozy.  Tanunda.  Tanunda has some beautiful fine dining restaurants. Ferment Asian and 1918 are standouts. Bookings are essential. Tanunda Club (The Clubhouse) is great for family meals and very reasonably priced. Amanti Pizza in Tanunda will deliver gourmet pizzas in 20 minutes. 1918 Restaurant - Modern Australian Cuisine. Ferment Asian Restaurant - Modern Vietnamese Cuisine. Appellation - Fine Dining - four c
transit: There is no public transport in the Valley. Best to have your own vehicle. You can call a cab, ride a bike or walk to the Main Street (20 minutes).
access: Free Wi-fFi. Optional access to washing machine, iron and laundry. I supply coffee/tea making facilities, breakfast provisions and a fridge/freezer. There is a microwave, toaster, sandwich press and electric kettle. Also shampoo,body wash and hairdryer.
interaction: Up to you really. I am often not home but able to assist you with local knowledge if required.
house_rules: No smoking please.  Be considerate of my neighbours.  I charge a very small cleaning fee so please try to leave the space as you find it.  It's a very quiet street in the Langmeil Estate- the new part of Tanunda.
host_about: I'm a Home Economics teacher at Nuriootpa High School. I have a stall at the Angaston Farmers Market every Saturday selling French Patisserie. I am also a professional orchestral trumpet player.

name: Tanunda town house
summary: Private room with 2 single beds, located down a quiet street off of Tanunda's main street. 4 minute walk to the information center and the town centre.

name: (T) Lge room Guest House/vineyard view-w/breakfast
summary: Barossavilla Guest House is a country style hosted Bed & Breakfast, offering genuine Barossa hospitality. Set on a peaceful 11 acre property, with an outlook to the Barossa Ranges, there is plenty of space to explore and wander. Centrally located in the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyards, and on the outskirts of Tanunda, there are garden and/or vineyard views from every room. This ideally situated property is just a 5 minute drive from the main street of Tanunda.
space: Offering: - 4 large and secure bedrooms - Complimentary country style continental/hot buffet breakfast - Free Wi-Fi - Guest lounge/dining room with TV/DVD player - Tranquil setting with great views -All guests share two large and modern guest bathrooms during their stay (the new second bathroom is wheelchair accessible) Guest comfort is assured with meticulous attention to cleanliness and freshly washed linen a top priority - Separate shared guest toilets - Tea/coffee making facilities - In room and household heating/cooling - Piano, air hockey, table tennis, foosball & board games available - Extensive back-yard with children’s play area - Shaded verandah/patio outdoors with views to Barossa Ranges - Porta-cot/camp beds available for small fee (0-12 yrs only) - Free on-site parking A communal lounge/dining room with TV/DVD player, piano, air hockey, table tennis and foosball is available for guests should they wish to relax and unwind somewhere informal. The large back-yard is perfect
description: Barossavilla Guest House is a country style hosted Bed & Breakfast, offering genuine Barossa hospitality. Set on a peaceful 11 acre property, with an outlook to the Barossa Ranges, there is plenty of space to explore and wander. Centrally located in the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyards, and on the outskirts of Tanunda, there are garden and/or vineyard views from every room. This ideally situated property is just a 5 minute drive from the main street of Tanunda. Offering: - 4 large and secure bedrooms - Complimentary country style continental/hot buffet breakfast - Free Wi-Fi - Guest lounge/dining room with TV/DVD player - Tranquil setting with great views -All guests share two large and modern guest bathrooms during their stay (the new second bathroom is wheelchair accessible) Guest comfort is assured with meticulous attention to cleanliness and freshly washed linen a top priority - Separate shared guest toilets - Tea/coffee making facilities - In room and household heating/cool
neighborhood_overview: The main street of Tanunda is about a 30-40 minute stroll (or 20 mins if you're a fast walker!) and about a 5 min drive by car. Barossavilla Guest House is within walking distance to: The REX (Barossa Aquatic and Fitness Centre)  Rusden Wines Barossa Arts & Convention Centre Tanunda Bakery
notes: Barossavilla Guest House has two outside farm cats who are not allowed inside (they are country cats whose sole purpose is to catch mice!)...naturally, they are fed daily and they get frequent pats and attention :o) This property runs on tank rainwater, so please be water conscious during your stay.
transit: Tanunda is approximately 65 kms ( 1 hour drive) from Adelaide by car. There is no public transport available directly to our home, although Link SA provides limited bus transport between Angaston, Nuriootpa & Tanunda and Gawler where you can catch the Metro train to/from Adelaide.   Timetables are available on the Link SA and Adelaide Metro websites.
access: Barossavilla Guest House is a country style hosted Bed & Breakfast, so the family share this residence. (The family have separate living quarters and bathroom) A key may be provided for after-hours access.
interaction: Please be considerate of other guests who may also be staying in the Guest House. Guests are at liberty to make their own plans, however, assistance and guidance is provided to guests when requested.  Barossavilla Guest House is able to offer many suggestions and recommendations of favourite places to visit. For the comfort and security of all guests, unreasonable noise, illegal or inappropriate behaviour will not be tolerated.
house_rules: Barossavilla Guest House is pleased to provide a smoke-free environment. Guests are kindly requested to remove their shoes when inside the Guest House. Additional visitors are not permitted without prior approval. Whilst Barossavilla Guest House does not charge a cleaning fee, it is expected that all guests respect the Guest House and keep the rooms/house clean & tidy. No food or drink is permitted in the bedrooms (except water).  No pets are allowed on the property without prior approval. Guests may be required to show a photo ID and credit card upon check-in. When booking, please remember that your children/babies are counted as guests, so include them in your booking request.
host_about:
Barossavilla Guest House is a country style, hosted Bed & Breakfast set on a peaceful 11 acre property with plenty of space to explore and wander.  

Centrally located in the Barossa Valley, amidst vineyards, and on the outskirts of Tanunda, there are vineyard views from almost every room of the house.  

This family friendly property is just a 5-minute drive from the main street of Tanunda.

A message from resident hosts, Jim & Michelle...

Welcome to our little corner of the world...

We love sharing the wonderful Barossa Valley with people from all walks of life.    

We open our hearts, our home and share the things we love about the valley, and we hope you enjoy your stay! ​

name: Retro Barossa
summary: My Retro Barossa home is a short walk to the main street, the Barossa Regional Art Gallery, The Tanunda Clubhouse, Chateau Tanunda Winery and numerous restaurants/cafes. You’ll love my place because of the location, the retro meets modern interior, as well as the spaciousness of the living area. Your private air-conditioned bedroom is located upstairs with your own private bathroom. My place is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
description: My Retro Barossa home is a short walk to the main street, the Barossa Regional Art Gallery, The Tanunda Clubhouse, Chateau Tanunda Winery and numerous restaurants/cafes. Your private air-conditioned bedroom is located upstairs with your own private bathroom. My place is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.

name: Luxury In Langmeil Estate
summary: Based in the heart of the Barossa Valley, 'Luxury in Langmeil Estate' is the ultimate place to stay to give the best Barossa experience. You will receive a complimentary bottle of local Shiraz on arrival.  The house includes 2 bathrooms (1 with spa), 3 bedrooms (1 Kingsize, 2 Double beds) , with full kitchen facilities and laundry facilities as well as relaxing outdoor area. Just a short 15 minute walk to the heart of Tanunda.

name: Sharay's Barossa Retreat
summary: Luxury, self contained accommodation, located in Tanunda. With up to to 4 bedrooms available, comfortably accomodating up to 9 people, this house is perfect for couples, families or groups of friends. The house is situated in Langmeil Estate, 5 minutes walking distance of Peter Lehmann Wines and Langmeil Winery, making it the perfect location for A Day on the Green events.
space: Luxurious 4 bedroom house in Tanunda with open plan kitchen, dining and family area with views of the pool and access to both alfresco and Bali hut areas. Formal lounge with combustion heater, which can be closed off to other areas. Master bedroom with King bed, WIR and ensuite, with 2 person spa. Remaining 2 bedrooms with built in robes and 1xQueen 1x King beds. 4th bedroom with tri-bunk bed. Ducted reverse cycle air-conditioning and ceiling fans. Paved alfresco area with downlights and ceiling fan overlooking solar heated and salt chlorinated lagoon-style pool, with glass-style fencing. 5 guests is Adults. Children allowed on top of 5 Adults. Extra mattresses available, on request.  Porta-cot and high chair can be provided on request also. Guests will have full use of the house, outdoor areas and pool, no other guests or hosts, however, the rate is per couple and assumes use of the Master Bedroom. Each additional person will incur a $60/person/night fee.
description: Luxury, self contained accommodation, located in Tanunda. With up to to 4 bedrooms available, comfortably accomodating up to 9 people, this house is perfect for couples, families or groups of friends. The house is situated in Langmeil Estate, 5 minutes walking distance of Peter Lehmann Wines and Langmeil Winery, making it the perfect location for A Day on the Green events. neighborhood_overview: The house is located in Tanunda, 15 minutes walk from the Main Street. Tanunda is the tourist heart of the Barossa, boasting excellent cafes, restaurants, boutique shops, wineries and much more. The house is 5 minutes walk from Peter Lehmann Wines, which makes it the perfect location for A Day on the Green.
notes: Complimentary wine and local produce platter will be provided on arrival for stays of 2 nights or more. Continental breakfast provisions provided for first morning. Also included: Linen and towels Complimentary Wifi  TV/DVD/Netflix  Laundry facilities
transit: Tanunda is situated approx 70 minutes by car from the city of Adelaide. There is regional public transport services available, however, please note these are not as regular as in the city. Car hire is available from the airport and there is also a shuttle bus service that can be booked to do pick up from the airport. Bus services run twice daily to the city and there is a taxi service available in the Barossa also. The Barossa Tourism Centre, located in the Main Street, can help arrange tours around the Barossa.  The house has parking available for up to 4 cars and is 15 minutes walk to the Main Street.
access: Host will meet you at the house with keys for your stay.  We can be contacted via email or phone between 7am and 8pm. Guests will have full access to the house, outdoor areas and pool during their stay. Rooms not in use will be locked.
interaction: We live nearby so are able to accommodate your needs, as required. We can have minimal contact after arrival or are free to help with anything during your stay.
house_rules: Strictly no parties to be held at the house; responsible entertaining permitted. The house is in located in a residential area and the council has very strict noise restrictions.  Smoking is allowed but strictly outside only.

name: Barossa Elegance
summary: Barossa Elegance is a stunning, fully renovated spacious three bedroom guest house with backyard views of the beautiful Barossa Ranges and surrounding vineyards. Just minutes away from a plethora of wineries making it a perfect home away from home.

name: Halletts Valley Hideaway
summary: Halletts Valley Hideaway is tucked away on the outskirts of Tanunda, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley. (Just 2 mins drive from the Tanunda main street.) Our cottage completed in January 2017, has been rebuilt from the ground up. It features high quality fittings, furnishings, appliances and lighting, while recycling the original timber beams and local stone. Enjoy a fabulous getaway experience in a unique, private, secluded, self-contained cottage, at a very affordable price.
space: A rare opportunity to enjoy fresh, new, high quality accommodation, while experiencing one of the most outstanding Barossa vistas. The cottage features a magnificent DOUBLE SHOWER featuring high quality Methven shower heads. In the winter months, enjoy the fabulous Nectre slow combustion heater. Kindling and fire-wood supplied.  Note that it is our policy NOT to use the wood heater during the Light Regional Council Fire ban season which usually runs from the 1st of November to the 30th of April each year.

notes: Enjoy the many local wineries - St Hallett - across the valley. Pindarie - featuring great wines and more quality stone work.

name: Casa Mia Barossa
summary: Amazing views and vineyards surround this beautifully renovated 100 year old cottage. You can relax, entertain and enjoy the views from the kitchen, outdoor deck and front verandah. Perfect for groups of friends and family or couples.

name: Indulge and Relax Tanunda
summary: Comfortable, modern cottage within 5-10 minute walk of the centre of Tanunda.  Perfect base for touring wineries, easy walk from FermentAsian Restaurant, 1918 bistro, as well as cafes, bakeries and supermarket of central Tanunda.   Full modern kitchen and bathroom, peaceful garden with several relaxing areas to sip a glass of wine, chat or read.
space: Suitable for one or two couples or small family.  Grassed areas (great for bocce and cartwheels!), bunk beds (cot and highchair available), pool table, dart board and two mountain bikes for guest use (please email us your heights to check with available sizes). Washing machine and dryer, high speed NBN WiFi equipped office area and Netflix access through Apple TV included. Gas BBQ and heated patio area for outdoor dining year round.

neighborhood_overview: Most cellar doors in the Barossa Valley are open 7 days for free wine tastings, mostly 10am or 11am until 4pm or 5pm (no booking required).  Eating at local restaurants, especially FermentAsian and 1918 (both walking distance from the house) may require a booking in advance and are thoroughly recommended Tanunda Foodland Supermarket 5-10 minute walk or easy drive away.
notes: Quiet street and peaceful garden areas are a feature, while location is in the heart of Tanunda.
transit: Short walk into Tanunda and to a couple of cellar doors, while a car is required to visit most of the 60 wineries within a 20 minute drive! Plenty of free parking available at the house and throughout the Barossa Region.  Or why not use our two complimentary mountain bikes to cycle the many km of trails around the Barossa?
access: Quality Riedel Glassware. Coffee pod machine and coffee plunger  both available in full kitchen including oven, hotplates, microwave and dishwasher. Free use of unlimited WiFi, Netflix, 7 foot pool table, table tennis table and two mountain bikes.  Bed linen and towels provided.
interaction: Guests will have private use of all areas, with hosts just a phone call or message away!
house_rules: Smoking indoors is prohibited at this property.  If there is evidence of smoking indoors an additional $500 cleaning fee will be charged.

summary: This lovely 1920's cottage is located in a quiet tree lined street in the heart of Tanunda. Miriam's has an outdoor setting and BBQ which overlooks the beautiful cottage garden.  Miriam's is a 5 minute walk to main shops and restaurants. Breakfast provisions are there for guests to either have a cooked breakfast of bacon, eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms or continental breakfast. Included is also a cheese plate and bottle wine from Greenock Creek Wines plus other goodies

summary: BAROSSA BED & BREAKFAST Luxury self contained accommodation, beautifully renovated original 1880 Ironstone house, located in Tanunda the historical heart of the Barossa.  Barossa B&B comfortably accommodates up to 6 people, children welcome.

name: Goat Square Cottages
summary: Three adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa. Each has king bed, log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts and a welcome bottle of Barossa wine.Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities. Escape to Goat Square
space: Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your bnb experience will be top rate.
description: Three adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa. Each has king bed, log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts and a welcome bottle of Barossa wine.Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities. Escape to Goat Square Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your bnb experience will be top rate. There is a separate laundry building with a washer and drier - plus an outside clothes line There are numerous fruit trees and guests are welcome to pick fruits in season Your host lives nearby and will usually meet you on arrival (or soon after). She is only a phone call away Your cottage is right in the heritage heart of Tanunda - fronting o
neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is right in the heritage heart of Tanunda - fronting on to Goat Square where the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday. Its walking distance to the main street with the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill.
notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download. The access code is provided when booking confirmed
transit: The public bus operates from the main street (250 metres away) Onsite off street parking is provided for guests We suggest one of the local tour operators to take you around the Barossa - save drink driving and you get to learn a bit about wine food and history There are two local taxi companies
access: There is a separate laundry building with a washer and drier - plus an outside clothes line There are numerous fruit trees and guests are welcome to pick fruits in season
interaction: Your host lives nearby and will usually meet you on arrival (or soon after). She is only a phone call away
house_rules: - If you arrive home late or leave early, please consider guests in other cottages. Talk quietly and don't bang doors!
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 20 years experience in the BnB industry.
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Possum Cottage in Barossa Valley
summary: This accommodation combine's a Barossan element of class.  Outside your front door is the cycling track that winds amongst the picturesque vineyards. By car, enjoy a self-guided driving tour visiting all the family friendly wineries.   For your dining experience, you are minutes away from restaurants and pubs . Enjoy the outdoor secluded decking area. Make your own fire in the outdoor chiminea as you unwind. Full privacy is assured as you slip into your outdoor tranquil Jacuzzi.
space: In Possum Cottage there are two bedrooms with a maximum of 3 beds.  . We can accommodate up to 4 Adults for the 2 x king beds, we can accommodate up to two children for the day bed and trundle. BEDROOM 1- has a King bed so it can accommodate up to 2 people. BEDROOM 2- Is available and has a King Bed and also comprises of a Day and the roll out trundle bed if needed. Come and enjoy the many attractions and take in the fresh Barossa Valley air.  By Day, Lovely cooked breakfast minutes up the road on those relaxing mornings or simply cook your own in the self-contained Bistro Style kitchen .Walk outside your front door and take the 14 km cycling track along the north Para River and take in the picturesque vineyards. By car enjoy a self-guided driving tour visiting all the family friendly wineries. Across the road is the Barossa Brewery. Enjoy hand crafted beer and local produce or take away is an option if you are looking for a quiet movie night or romantic weekend. Straight opposite the

Come and enjoy the many attractions and take in the fresh Barossa Valley air.  By Day, Lovely cooked breakfast minutes up the road on those relaxin
neighborhood_overview: The Barossa Valley is situated 70 km Northeast of Adelaide.  The Cottage is situated in the iconic tourist township of Tanunda and has many attractions which are only a hop skip and jump from the Cottage’s front door. Tanunda is home to some beautiful wineries and is a five minute drive to the famous Jacobs Creek Winery.
notes: THE COTTAGE OFFERS: *King Room (1 x King Bed) *King Room (1 x King Bed & Day Bed with a trundle ) *Linen/Bedding/ Towels *Pillows/Blankets *1 x Shower/Toilet room  *Shower Mat/Hair Dryer/Toilet paper *Full equipped self-catering Kitchen *Lounge Room *Lounge/TV/DVD-Video  *Laundry Room  *Washing Machine/ Iron & Board *Large decking area with BBQ facilities *Outdoor Table/ Electric BBQ *Wood is Supplied for winter bookings only *Slow combustion fireplace & Split system *Board Games/Cards/Movies
transit: Depending on what type of experience you are looking for there is lots of Transport ideas *If you have your own car there is parking at the Cottage for one vehicle. *There is bike hire from the local businesses to enjoy the bike track which is located outside your front door. This track meanders through the vines and you will be able to experience the Barossa's Premium food and wine. *You are in walking distance to the information centre which has transport around to different wineries and attractions for your convenience. *Transport from Adelaide Airport can depend on your budget there are shuttle buses/Taxis or you can catch trains and buses to Tanunda. *If you would like to see the Barossa from up above a Hot Air Balloon or Helicopter that is an option in the region.
access: The day before your arrival i will issue you the code for the door. Please- Check in time is anytime after 2pm. Depending on flight details or your situation you can have the ease of arriving at your own leisure to Possum Cottage. Just pin in the code and enjoy your stay. ( no keys )
interaction: The hosts haves no interaction with guests except via Air Bnb messenger. There is lots of information for a beautiful stay in the Barossa Valley at your fingertips located in the cottage. The Mystery is up to you.
house_rules: -Check in 2pm -Late check out 10am Please note:  -No pets Allowed -No Parties -No smoking in the cottage -Please do your own dishes -Enjoy your stay -Respect our lovely cottage On arrival please read the guest information booklet. This has all the house rules and information you will need to know about the cottage, to make your stay more comfortable.
host_about:
Hi our name is Brett and Renee we have the pleasure of being your Hosts.

We have lived in the Cottage for 10 years and over the past 3 years we have opened it up to Backpackers from all over the world who have enjoyed their stay.
We now are offering Airbnb users the unique opportunity to come and stay in our 1856 Cottage and experience what the Barossa Valley has to offer it's visitors.

Brett and I like to travel to Fiji and have formed many local friendships over the last few years. This is our little paradise.

We work hard and like socializing on our days off, we also look forward to working around our home and garden to design tranquil spaces. We now have the opportunity to share it with others.


Your Hosts

Brett and Renee

name: Veritas Cottage Bed & Breakfast
summary: Lovely vineyard views as well as a convenient, central Barossa Valley location. This recently renovated, self-contained cottage is full of character and furnished with unique retro pieces.  It's a private home owned and operated by winemaker, Rolf Binder and partner, Cynthia. An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 60 acre property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping.
space: What's special about our place?? 1. The location - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently close to wineries, restaurants & shopping. 2. Privacy 3. Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & look for kangaroos on the top of the hill around dusk!
description: Lovely vineyard views as well as a convenient, central Barossa Valley location. This recently renovated, self-contained cottage is full of character and furnished with unique retro pieces.  It's a private home owned and operated by winemaker, Rolf Binder and partner, Cynthia. An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 60 acre property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping. Staying at Veritas Cottage means you will have great access to: - Wineries - Langmeil Winery & Peter Lehmann Wines are within walking distance. Our winery (Rolf Binde
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
notes: If particularly interested in wine, we love to also show guests around our winery during their stay. Drop in for a wine tasting & we'll give you 15% off any wine purchase of 6+ bottles during your stay.
transit: Unfortunately there isn't great access to public transport so most drive.  There is a train from Adelaide to Gawler & then bus to Tanunda. Guests can hire bikes from the Visitor Information Centre or use local taxis.
access: Staying at Veritas Cottage means you will have great access to: - Wineries - Langmeil Winery & Peter Lehmann Wines are within walking distance. Our winery (Rolf Binder) is just 1.6km north on Stelzer Road.  - Tanunda shopping, cafes & restaurants - 2.3km - Bike trails (rental bike drop off is available) - Seppeltsfield Road Scenic Drive - 2km - Maggie Beer's Farm Shop - 2.5km
interaction: We leave interaction up to guests! We live close by & would love to share a coffee or a glass of wine over a chat but certainly don't want to intrude on any guest's privacy.
house_rules: We ask that guests respect our property & leave it in the same condition at departure. If you have a booking for 2 guests, please be aware that we consider that use of one bedroom only.  If you do require the second bedroom, an additional cleaning/laundry fee of $50 will be charged.
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. It's also fun to be able to see guests at our cellar door nearby, where we offer wine tastings and tours of the winery.
Rolf Binder winery was established in 1955 and we produce a wide range of white, red and fortified wines, selling into 18 countries around the globe. Our guests can enjoy a special bottle with any 2 night stay! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region.  Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

name: Barossa Welcome
summary: Tanunda is a great central point with its quaint cafes, pubs, shops and wineries from which to explore the Barossa Valley. Numerous seasonal events including wine tours, weddings, concerts and food fairs occur.  Your comfort and enjoyment are assured with a home away from experience. Our home there sleeps up to three couples, with two full bathrooms, both including separate shower and spa bath.  It has a well appointed eat in kitchen and large family room with all amenities.

name: The Marble Room - Barossa
summary: The Marble Room is actually a suite of rooms situated in a lovely turn of the century marble fronted Villa in the centre of the Barossa Valley ; Tanunda.  With large rooms , high ceilings and classic stained glass feature windows, this suite is spacious and quiet. The Marble Room suite has a beautifully light filled bedroom luxuriously appointed, a cosy lounge with a comfortable sofa bed , a dining area and a stunning bathroom .    A beautiful place from which to enjoy the Barossa Valley.
space: The Marble Room is situated in a turn of the century marble fronted Villa. Set in a central position; walking distance to cafes, restaurants and shops and close to Barossa Wineries. The Marble room is a suite of rooms with a  beautifully appointed large bedroom for couples or singles. There is also another sofa bed situated in the lounge , so that two couples can be accommodated . A luxurious bathroom with deep bath and a separate dining area complete the suite. This suite of rooms has some shared access but privacy is guaranteed.  There is a large screen TV with dvd player and Netflix available in the lounge, FREE WIFI. *Price listed is for two people (and use of one bedroom) only and includes a continental breakfast for each day.

access: The Marble Room  suite of rooms , consisting of a Queen size bedroom , a dining room and a lounge with a  luxury bathroom and separate toilet . The sofa bed in the lounge is very comfortable with an innerspring mattress. The suite is part of our home and does therefore has some common access areas  with another family bedroom located nearby however we give guests as much privacy as possible . Being an old house , it is very quiet. Guests have a separate private entrance.
interaction: We like to give guests as much privacy as possible but are always available if guests require anything.
house_rules: - The Marble Room is part of our home and has shared space areas with another bedroom nearby, however we respect privacy and keep any family use of these to a minimum. Bathroom is for guests only. We can give total privacy if requested by guests. Please respect our beautiful old wooden floors by not wearing high heels inside.
host_about: Our family has had many wonderful experiences travelling in other countries and I would love to share the experience of our regions with you. Living between the vineyards and the coast we are able to share the lifestyle of both with our guests.

name: The Stables
space: Situated in Rowland Flat on a three-acre property, the stone cottage was the original tack and feed rooms for Mr Rowland's stables. Separated by a courtyard the stables are now the home of the host. The cottage is comprised of a truly delightful bedroom with an antique double bed with stunning garden views; comfortable lounge room with TV/DVD, CD/radio, books and games; light and open equipped kitchenette with bar fridge, microwave, large electric frying pan and breakfast bar overlooking gardens through french windows (provisions for continental breakfast); the bathroom has both separate shower and claw foot slipper bath, toilet and vanity. R/c air-conditioning/heating and ceiling fans throughout. Access from the cottage to your own verandah with garden spilling over…serenity…the perfect spot for breakfast, coffee or bottle of local wine. Enjoy walks through our vineyard and paddocks and come across surprises such as our free-range chooks, wood fire pizza oven, an array of interesting

neighborhood_overview: There’s plenty to do, only minutes away: Tanunda Pines Golf course, the bike/walking path (from Angaston to Gawler) runs past the top of our property, hot air ballooning, helicopter scenic flights, wineries, restaurants, art galleries, cafes and day spa (at the Novotel). What more could you want?
notes: Bicycle hire available (price available on request).
transit: We are only six minutes from Tanunda in one direction and Lyndoch in the other. The best way to get around is by car (public transport is very limited). The excellent tourist office is in Tanunda and they are a wealth of information regarding local tours and more.
interaction: Up to you…if you want solitude - it’s yours, or we are more than happy to help you in any way we can.
house_rules: No smoking inside. Please leave gates as you find them (open or shut), we have animals.
host_about:
A Barossa girl, I started my nursing at Angaston Hospital, played netball for Sandy Creek and Lyndoch clubs, was a tour guide for Orlando and, the then, Kaiser Stuhl wineries and also a wine rep for Tolleys; so I do appreciate Barossa wines and just love this area.

After many years living both interstate and overseas the magic of the Barossa Valley always draws you back!

Gardening, animals, people, fine wine and food are a few of my passions.

name: Barossa Idyll
summary: Barossa Idyll ( formerly Barossa Seasons) with five bedrooms and three bathrooms is the perfect place for groups or families to experience the Barossa. Situated in the heart of Tanunda; close to wineries and with only a short walk to restaurants and cafes.
space: Architecturally designed in the early 1960s to enjoy the magnificent views over the Barossa Valley, Barossa Idyll is now furnished in the mid- century style from the era it was originally built.

Architecturally designed in the early 1960s to enjoy the magnificent views over the Barossa Valley, Barossa Idyll is now furnished in the mid- century style from the era it was originally built. Barossa Idyll has five bedrooms and three bathrooms , there are two large lounge areas both with large screen internet TVs. Bedrooms consist of three Queen beds , one Double and one King ( which can convert to two singles). notes: Longer stay rates are negotiable, one night rates for weekends on notice.

name: Macdonnell House
summary: Located in the centre of Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley,  our house is light and airy perfect for families, friends or couples.  It's just a couple minutes easy walk to the Main Street where you will find great restaurants, boutique shops, cafes, pubs and other facilities such as the supermarket, pharmacy and visitors centre.
space: THE SPACE 2 comfortable bedrooms - the master has a king size bed and the second is a double. Both bedrooms have overhead fans and linen is provided. There is an open living dining with a well equipped kitchen with an overhead fan and split system for heating and cooling. Parking is undercover and the backyard is private.

notes: As the house is situated in a residential area noise is to be kept to a minimum after 10 pm. The house is strictly non smoking.
transit: GETTING AROUND  Tanunda is situated approximately one hour by car from Adelaide. There is a twice daily bus service to and from the city and a taxi service in the Valley. To fully experience the Barossa though a car is recommended.

name: Hanisch Haus Bed & Breakfast Guest House
summary: Premium self-contained Bed & Breakfast accommodation with a fantastic central location & lovely vineyard views. This recently renovated, historic home is full of character. Guests have full access to an entire home, owned and operated by renowned Barossa winemaker, Rolf Binder.  An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 60 acre property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping.
space: What's special about our place? 1. The Location - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently close to wineries, restaurants & shopping. 2. Space - A lovely spacious home ideal for longer stays and especially those who like to cook and feel 'at home' when travelling. 3. Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & enjoy the wildlife  / birdlife. Keep and eye out for kangaroos on the top of the hill around sunset! 4. Great breakfast provisions and a nice bottle of Rolf Binder wine included.
description: Premium self-contained Bed & Breakfast accommodation with a fantastic central location & lovely vineyard views. This recently renovated, historic home is full of character. Guests have full access to an entire home, owned and operated by renowned Barossa winemaker, Rolf Binder.  An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 60 acre property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping. What's special about our place? 1. The Location - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently close to wineries, restaurants & shopping. 2. Space - A lovely spacious home ideal for longer stays and especially those who like to cook and feel 'at home' when travelling. 3. Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & enjoy the wildlife  / birdlife. Keep and eye out for kangaroos on the top of the hill around sunset
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
notes: Staying at Hanisch Haus means great access to: - Wineries - Langmeil Winery & Peter Lehmann Wines are within walking distance. Our winery (Rolf Binder) is just 1.6km north at 185 Stelzer Road.  - Tanunda shopping, cafes & restaurants - 2.3km - Bike trails (rental bike drop off is available) - Seppeltsfield Road Scenic Drive - 2km - Maggie Beer's Farm Shop - 2.5km If particularly interested in wine, we love to also show guests around our winery during their stay. Guests also receive 15% off any wine purchase of 6+ bottles during a stay at Hanisch Haus.
transit: Unfortunately there isn't great access to public transport so most drive to the Barossa Valley. There is a train from Adelaide to Gawler & then bus to Tanunda. Guests can hire bikes from the Visitor Information Centre or Barossa Bike Hire in Nuriootpa or use local taxis to get around.
access: Guests have access to the entire house as well as outside terrace, verandah and garden.
interaction: We leave interaction up to guests! We live close by & would love to share a coffee or a glass of wine over a chat but certainly don't want to intrude on any guest's privacy.
house_rules: - Hanisch Haus is located in close proximity to Veritas Cottage B&B so we ask that guests respect the privacy & peaceful environment of this location.
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. It's also fun to be able to see guests at our cellar door nearby, where we offer wine tastings and tours of the winery.
Rolf Binder winery was established in 1955 and we produce a wide range of white, red and fortified wines, selling into 18 countries around the globe. Our guests can enjoy a special bottle with any 2 night stay! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region.  Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

name: Bilyara House - in the heart of Tanunda
summary: *** Just Renovated 2017 *** SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF TANUNDA Bilyara House offers a perfectly central location to explore the region, located adjacent to Tanunda Main Street. Our décor is modern and comfortable with tasteful reflections of the house’s 1940s' and 50’s romance and Art Deco Style. It has an Open Wood Fireplace.
space: It is designed to accommodate up to 8 guests comfortably with 3 bedrooms and 2 Bathrooms. Breakfast provisions are supplied for cooked breakfast made up of the best local produce on first night. The Butcher, Baker & Supermarket are also within short walking distance, allowing you to make your own home cooked fine dining experience as our accommodation offers fully equipped modern kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas comfortably seating 8 people. HISTORY Built in 1947, Bilyara House was the home of one of the Wallent Sons. The Wallents were well known identities about the town. F.C.G. Wallent & Sons was a fine Tanunda Haberdashery Store (now "Living by Design") with the adjoining Wallant Family Home now housing 1918 Restaurant. Maurice Wallent was the Tanunda Mayor for a time. /  Natalie & Andy

neighborhood_overview: Bilyara House offers you a perfect location in the centre of the Tanunda Township to begin you exploration of the Barossa Valley, it wineries, restaurants and fine food experiences. You will be able to walk to the local supermarket, butcher and baker if you want to self cater. All of these stock the fine local provisions the region is known for. Alternatively you may like to visit the local Barossa Farmers Markets located within 10 mins drive on Saturday Morning. Here the local store holders provide everything from fresh fruit and seasonal veg, baked goods, condiments, curries, ice creams and the list goes on. But there is no need to cook! Bilyara house is located across the road from 2 of the Barossa’s fine dining experiences – Ferment Asian and 1918.
transit: There is close walking access to 4 fine dining experiences, family friendly pubs, the Tanunda Club, as well as no less than 12 coffee shops. The Butcher, Baker & Supermarket are also within short walking distance.
access: Natalie and Andy invite you to enjoy Bilyara House. We have endeavoured to provide a comfortable space suitable to accommodate up to 8 people. You will have all the comforts and conveniences of home. A fully equipped kitchen, comfortable bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and living areas that accommodate todays modern entertainment needs.
interaction: Andy and Natalie live locally and should any need arise they can assist upon request.
host_about:
Barossa Valley, South Australia
Musician
