name: Bridgets House
summary: Bridgets House is within 2 minutes walk of the main street of the Tanunda located in the heart of Australia's most famous wine region, the Barossa Valley. It's an easy walk to our favourite restaurants, beautiful retail stores, pubs and main town facilities such as pharmacy, supermarket and a great wine store. Everything you need is at the end of the street and the price includes up to 4 guests! No chintz or friezes, just a much loved sunny home (and best of all, no cabs required).
space: Bridgets House is a 1950's brick home on the outside, with lashings of love and contemporary styling on the inside. It's a great space to spend some time either sitting around the old butchers block over a cup of tea in the kitchen or relaxing on the deck which looks over a dwarf organic fruit orchard (which you're welcome to help yourself to).  A main bedroom at the front of the house is available as well as a smaller double bedroom off the living space.
description: Bridgets House is within 2 minutes walk of the main street of the Tanunda located in the heart of Australia's most famous wine region, the Barossa Valley. It's an easy walk to our favourite restaurants, beautiful retail stores, pubs and main town facilities such as pharmacy, supermarket and a great wine store. Everything you need is at the end of the street and the price includes up to 4 guests! No chintz or friezes, just a much loved sunny home (and best of all, no cabs required). Bridgets House is a 1950's brick home on the outside, with lashings of love and contemporary styling on the inside. It's a great space to spend some time either sitting around the old butchers block over a cup of tea in the kitchen or relaxing on the deck which looks over a dwarf organic fruit orchard (which you're welcome to help yourself to).  A main bedroom at the front of the house is available as well as a smaller double bedroom off the living space. In true Airbnb style, this is my home but I vacate it
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is the heart of the Barossa Valley and home to the best retail experiences and some great restaurants and coffee shops. It's literally all at the end of the street. The Barossa is famous for its wine, delicious regional produce, evocative dining experiences and beautiful scenery. You can choose to go out during the day to visit wineries and places of interest and during the evening everything is at your fingertips.
notes: There is a folder outlining my favourite things to do in the Barossa to help you have the best experience possible.  I'm a Barossa native, so we are all friends around here and we love making sure that visitors have a really positive experience. Also please note there is no microwave in the house so please be aware of that when booking.  All other cooking facilities are provided.
transit: You really need car to visit the Barossa, but it's worth it!
access: In true Airbnb style, this is my home but I vacate it often to travel, so you have the whole house and garden block to yourself.  Consequently I am not often here to meet you but I am always available by phone and not always so far away. There is a undercover carport and the back of the house is completely private.
interaction: Because this is my home I obviously have to vacate and often it will be before you arrive. I'll be able to talk to you at any stage during your stay but I have a friend Bianca who is my cohost and lives locally so can help with anything if I'm not available, which is unlikely
house_rules: - Four people maximum - no extra charge over 2 people - please love my house like I do, it's my home - please use heating and cooling with respect to the environment and the low cost of this accommodation, ie. turn off overnight or while you are out

name: The Writer's Studio, Barossa
summary: Perfect for one or two people, The Writer's Studio is fully self-contained. It has a really comfortable and firm inflatable queen bed.  Away from the main house, it opens out onto a small orchard. This is a quiet oasis you can enjoy in between exploring all the Barossa has to offer. It has dining and sitting areas as well as a reading nook in the loft. It has a sofa which can open out for a child if necessary.  Or we can set up another inflatable bed in the loft, accessed by a loft ladder.
space: The Writer's Studio is great for singles or couples.  I originally called it, The Shed, as it was once a hay shed with three walls and a grass floor.  It morphed into The Writer's Studio after various friends asked to use it as their retreat to spend time quietly catching up on writing projects. Wineries abound, as do eating opportunities,   ranging from the award winning Appellation at The Louise and fermentAsian (consistently names in the Top 100), to Vintners, Harvest Kitchen, 1918, St Hugo’s and Maggie Beer's Farm.  There is also a huge selection of light meal options offered by most of the wineries.
description: Perfect for one or two people, The Writer's Studio is fully self-contained. It has a really comfortable and firm inflatable queen bed.  Away from the main house, it opens out onto a small orchard. This is a quiet oasis you can enjoy in between exploring all the Barossa has to offer. It has dining and sitting areas as well as a reading nook in the loft. It has a sofa which can open out for a child if necessary.  Or we can set up another inflatable bed in the loft, accessed by a loft ladder. The Writer's Studio is great for singles or couples.  I originally called it, The Shed, as it was once a hay shed with three walls and a grass floor.  It morphed into The Writer's Studio after various friends asked to use it as their retreat to spend time quietly catching up on writing projects. Wineries abound, as do eating opportunities,   ranging from the award winning Appellation at The Louise and fermentAsian (consistently names in the Top 100), to Vintners, Harvest Kitchen, 1918, St Hugo’s and
neighborhood_overview: There is a vineyard and winery cellar door directly the house.  It is a short, two block walk to the main street, supermarket, bakery, coffee shops, restaurants, Information Centre and bicycle hire.
notes: The Writer's Studio is literally at the bottom of the garden of the main house and there is plenty of street and pavement parking at the front.
transit: You will need a car, although there is a limited taxi service and there are bikes for hire.  If you don't have a car, we can arrange to pick you up from the Gawler Central railway station 25 minutes away.  There are also some good walks and walking tracks.
access: You are free to sit in the garden or the orchard. The kitchenette has a small oven, hot plate, microwave, fridge, toaster, kettle, crockery and cutlery.  If you are cooking and need specific utensils or pots, just let us know and you are welcome to borrow them from the house kitchen. Bed linen and towels are provided.
interaction: I will usually be there to welcome you, show you around and answer any questions. On the odd occasion when I can't be there, my assistant or a close friend will do the honours.  If you have questions during your stay, you can tap on the door or send a text and we will respond quickly.
host_about:
I am a full time business coach helping business owners create businesses that work form not because of them.  My clients are mainly in Australia, New Zealand and the US, and as long as time zones are compatible I can work with them from anywhere. In the last 18 months I have conducted my client meetings from Jaipur (India), New York, Perth, Sydney, South Australia and San Diego.
Clearly - one of the  things I can't live without is travel.
And I can't live without my Kindle - which has lightened my travel load enormously. No more books to carry and leave as I pick up more.
I love great food and wine - I live in a wine region where the two go together.
I am a great guest. Quiet, fun, a reader and a walker.
My life motto is Stride Into Life.

name: Creeve Roe-Come and enjoy the view
summary: Creeve Roe has wonderful rural views, close to Tanunda and Lyndoch.  It is a great place to relax and unwind with friends with plenty of wineries, cafes and restaurants nearby.
space: Creeve Roe is a contemporary open plan home, with accommodation for 6 people, is set in the picturesque Barossa Valley, with views of rolling farmland, trees and hills from each of its panoramic windows.  Set on its own 40 acres, Creeve Roe provides privacy and relaxed living style within 10 minutes of some of the best vineyards and winemakers in Australia.  The wineries span the valley between the quaint towns of Tanunda, Lyndoch and Angaston providing easy access to their shops, galleries, restaurants and home grown produce.  Creeve Roe is also just 10 minutes from Gawler a thriving country town and a further 45 minute drive will have you in the state's capital city of Adelaide, renowned for its festivals, restaurants and twinkling city lights.  South Australian weather is most frequently fine with hot dry summers and mild winters.  The Barossa Valley is slightly cooler than the Adelaide plains and Creeve Roe's breezes, wide opens skies, sunsets and starry nights are wonderful.  The

name: Treasured Memories Cottage ideally located Tanunda
summary: Step back in time in this enchanting three bedroom turn of the century cottage, exclusively yours to enjoy. Circa 1890's stone cottage with spa, open wood fire, all in the heart of Tanunda walking distance to restaurants/cafes. Laundry facilities, enclosed backyard, also ideal for families to enjoy. WiFi available at $10 p/n and subject to availability at time of booking. 2 night mini stay on selected weekends. Why not book one of our wine and sightseeing tours with our business Tour Barossa.
space: There are three bedrooms, the third bedroom requires access from the second bedroom. Children are very welcome to stay at our property, and can provide cot's and highchairs, also a pram if needed (upon prior request) Tanunda has some wonderful restaurants, cafes and some great wineries to walk to, too.

name: Barossa Vista, your home away from home
summary: Barossa Vista is a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom home located at the start of the main street in Tanunda.  You will be able to walk to cafés, wine tasting and restaurants. You will enjoy views of the Barossa Ranges and the Barossa Valley vineyards.  The 1915 Bungalow as been renovated to include all the conveniences of a modern home with a full kitchen. The backyard has been re developed to include a stunning decking for alfresco dining and BBQ area.
space: The cottage is exclusively yours, regardless of the number of guests in your party.  Each booking will have full access to the kitchen, dining room, lounge room, decking and facilities.  Bedrooms are opened according to the number of bedrooms you require. Please note we charge by the room, not the person.  for example if you require 2 bedrooms please select 4 people (even if you are only 2 or 3 people) or if you need 3 bedrooms please select 6 guests (even if you are only 3, 4 or 5 people)  For one person/couple you will be sleeping in the King bedroom with an en-suite for $330 per night, (select 2 people).  For a second person/couple the second bedroom has a Queen bed with access to the common bathroom with laundry facilities for a total of $495 per night, (select 4 people). For a third person/couple the third bedroom has a Queen bed and will share the common bathroom for a total of $660 per night, (select 6 people).

notes: The keys are available via the Key Safe located above the BBQ by the back door.  We will sms you the keys safe code the day before arrival.
transit: We have space for 4 cars to park in our drive way.
access: You will be able to relax on the leather sofa in front of the open fire place whilst entertaining yourself by watching a DVD’s on the flat screen TV; choose from one of the 100 books available; connect your phone or MP3 to the speakers or even log onto the wireless broadband (NOTE:  Max 2GB per stay) to keep in touch with friends.    If you fancy cooking a gourmet meal using gourmet Barossa produce will be able to take advantage of the full cooking facilities, or enjoy the expansive decking whilst cooking a traditional Aussie BBQ.
interaction: The house is exclusively yours with no onsite manager, however we are only a phone call away should you need any assistance.
house_rules: 1 bedroom (King bed, max 2 people) - $300 per night 2 bedrooms (King + Queen bed, max 4 people) - $450 per night 3 bedrooms (King + 2 Queen beds, max 6 people) - $600 per night Minimum 3 night booking for Public Holiday long weekends. Minimum 3 room booking for Public Holiday weekends and Events. Children requiring a bed are deemed as 1 person, infants or toddlers in a cot may use the onsite cot with their own bedding free of charge.

name: Little Para Cottage
summary: Our  cottage is hidden away in Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It's little - just one cosy bedroom - but in a very handy location  just up the road from iconic Tanunda wineries. It has a private garden and undercover off-street parking.
space: Our cottage is unique because it look old and rustic on the outside but inside it has a modern kitchenette and bathroom, separate lounge with two sofas, cosy furnishings and cable TV. All linen is provided. It is hidden from the road at the back of a half acre block, with vineyards just over the back fence and local wineries in walking distance. Surprisingly its also close to the main street on the edge of the township, and just a 5 minute drive to the town centre. It also has a private garden to relax in which is fully fenced. People like our cottage because it feels like a home away from home.
description: Our  cottage is hidden away in Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It's little - just one cosy bedroom - but in a very handy location  just up the road from iconic Tanunda wineries. It has a private garden and undercover off-street parking. Our cottage is unique because it look old and rustic on the outside but inside it has a modern kitchenette and bathroom, separate lounge with two sofas, cosy furnishings and cable TV. All linen is provided. It is hidden from the road at the back of a half acre block, with vineyards just over the back fence and local wineries in walking distance. Surprisingly its also close to the main street on the edge of the township, and just a 5 minute drive to the town centre. It also has a private garden to relax in which is fully fenced. People like our cottage because it feels like a home away from home. You have the entire cottage and garden to yourself. As hosts we are available if you need us. We respect our guests' privacy and leave you to relax
neighborhood_overview: We are on the edge of town in a residential street that feels more rural than township. Houses are on one side, and wineries and few homes on large allotments are on the other side. We are on the winery side!
notes: The cottage doesn't have a laundry but there is a laundromat in town, just a 5 minute drive away. The kitchenette is fully equipped for self catering with a fridge, oven, hotplates and microwave. The local supermarket is easily accessible and there is also a Farmers Market every Saturday.
transit: There is a local taxi service but no local bus or train passengers service. There are many tours you can book, or you can hire bikes from our visitor centre. There is plenty to do and see in walking distance of our cottage. If you have a car, every thing is easily accessible.
access: You have the entire cottage and garden to yourself.
interaction: As hosts we are available if you need us. We respect our guests' privacy and leave you to relax and enjoy our location!
house_rules: - Note only small dog breeds are accepted - no large dogs sorry. - Please observe checkout times so we can prepare for next guest - Relax and make yourselves at home - Treat the cottage as you would your own home - turn lights and appliances off when you are out for the day - Relax and enjoy our location! - Do your own dishes please - Smoking outside only - Parties are not allowed
host_about: We feel very lucky to live and work in the Barossa and hope you will enjoy exploring our region during your stay! We like the rural feel where we live, with vineyards just over our back fence, but we are minutes to the centre of the township. We enjoy our wine and food and the opportunity torelax, so we understand that our guests might just like to be left to do their own thing and enjoy some time out. We like to take short impromptu getaways. Hubby loves his footy and horse-racing hence Foxtel in the cottage for people who may not want to miss a game while away. I enjoy gardening as being surrounded by a natural setting is important to me. If you want recommendations of where to dine out and what to do, we are happy to point you in directions that we have experienced and recommend! Careers in hospitality brought us to the Barossa in 1997... we're still here!

name: "The Hideaway Central"
summary: "The Hideaway Central" is a lovely, fully furnished and spacious unit available in the main st of central Tanunda, in the picturesque Barossa Valley. We also have another place called "The Hideaway" on the same block. Both units are available for both short and longer terms stays. Staying at one of The Hideaways means everything is at your doorstep!!
description: "The Hideaway Central" is a lovely, fully furnished and spacious unit available in the main st of central Tanunda, in the picturesque Barossa Valley. We also have another place called "The Hideaway" on the same block. Both units are available for both short and longer terms stays. Staying at one of The Hideaways means everything is at your doorstep!! Guests have access to:  Guests have access to the entire unit, and courtyard with a BBQ. The garage is not available.  Fully equipped kitchen (glassware, crockery, cutlery, pots and pans), with fridge, freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher and washing machine.  Coffee, tea, sugar, salt and pepper.  Large bedroom with queen sized bed and ceiling fan. Small bedroom with Queen sized bed. (Available for 3 + guests) Dining room. Airconditioned lounge room with TV and DVD player. (There is a DVD rental place two doors down :) Bathroom and separate toilet. Towels and linen provided Foodland, Pharmacy, Newsagent and a Laundromat are a short walk away,
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda lies in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Australia's best-known wine region and South Australia's most visited tourist destination.   Tanunda is the focal point of the Barossa. With its strong European heritage, distinctive church spiers, wineries, cafés and restaurants there is plenty to see and do in the town.  "The Hideaway" is right in the centre of Tanunda. Foodland and Priceline are right next door. There are two cafes within 100m of the unit, and a hairdresser and health food shop right opposite. 1918, one of the Barossa’s finest restaurants, is also within 100m of the unit.(URL HIDDEN) Tanunda is home to the Barossa Visitor Information Centre, an ideal starting point for any visit to the Barossa, located at 66-68 Murray Street (the main street) and open seven days a week(URL HIDDEN)The town also boasts a number of wineries, including Peter Lehmann Wines, Langmeil, Richmond Grove, Lambert Estate and Chateau Tanunda, with its impressive buildings and grounds, located next
notes: 1) WHERE CAN I FIND OUT ABOUT WINE TOURS, WINE CELLARS ETC? The Barossa Visitors Centre is on Murray st, not very far from The Hideaway Central. You can either ring or visit them.  Monday to Friday 9am-5pm Saturday 9am-4pm Sundays and Public Holidays 10am-4pm Address: 66-68 Murray St Tanunda SA 5352 2) CAN I CHECK IN EARLY AND/OR CHECK OUT LATE? CHECK-IN: Anytime from 3pm CHECK-OUT: 11AM or anytime before. Most of the time we only have a 4 hour window in between bookings, and there's a lot of cleaning to be done. Please forgive us if we cannot accommodate requests for late check outs/early checks ins 4) DO YOU PROVIDE BREAKFAST? Sorry, we don't offer breakfast. In the kitchen you will find instant coffee, sugar, tea bags, condiments, salt and pepper. Foodland is conveniently located right next door to cater for all your food requirements :) 5) DO YOU HAVE FOXTEL/CABLE? We don't have Foxtel or cable TV, just the free-to-air digital channels. 6) DO YOU HAVE AIRCONDITIONING? There is an a
transit: You really need a car to get to the Barossa. But once you're here, if it's nice, hire a bike and take a leisurely ride along the new fabulous bike paths that have been placed all along the Barossa.  There's really not much in the way of public transport. There is a Bus to Gawler and Angaston in front of Tanunda library.
access: Guests have access to:  Guests have access to the entire unit, and courtyard with a BBQ. The garage is not available.  Fully equipped kitchen (glassware, crockery, cutlery, pots and pans), with fridge, freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher and washing machine.  Coffee, tea, sugar, salt and pepper.  Large bedroom with queen sized bed and ceiling fan. Small bedroom with Queen sized bed. (Available for 3 + guests) Dining room. Airconditioned lounge room with TV and DVD player. (There is a DVD rental place two doors down :) Bathroom and separate toilet. Towels and linen provided Foodland, Pharmacy, Newsagent and a Laundromat are a short walk away, approx. 100m distance.
interaction: Entry is via Keyless entry so there is no key hand off. After we receive your booking for The Hideaway Central, we send you an email with information about how to check in and plenty of other details.  I can easily be reached by mobile if you need anything :) Please enjoy your stay and make yourselves at home!
house_rules: USE OF BEDROOMS We consider each bedroom (Main and Small) to sleep two guests. If there are two of you, but you do not wish to share a bedroom, and wish to use both bedrooms,  please enquire with us and we can work out the extra charges for you.  CLEANING We don't charge a cleaning fee, so we do expect all our guests to keep the place tidy, and take care of all dirty dishes (washing and putting away) and take care of kufany spills that might occur. CHILDREN The Hideaway Central accepts guests ages 5+ years and up. SMOKING AND PETS No smoking and no pets thank you. CHECK IN  The Hideaway Central has a 24h Check-in (from 3pm), with a keyless entry. ADDITIONAL GUESTS No additional guests to be on the premises without prior arrangement. Having nearby neighbours means we are always informed of the number of guests at the unit :)

name: Tanunda Cottages
summary: Four charming, old world cottages in Tanunda with all of the comforts and convenience of today, 700 metres to shops & restaurants. Three Cottages offer quality self-contained accommodation with 2 bedrooms (1 queen bed, 2 singles) and sofa bed in lounge with cosy gas real flame fire.  Our Winery Cottage with 3 bedrooms (two queen beds, 1 single) with a full kitchen, formal dining + lounge with open fire. Continental breakfast provisions + free Wi-Fi. Surrounded by beautiful shaded grounds.
space: As we have 4 cottages, it is hard to reflect if we have availability on this calendar, so please make sure you enquire even if it is showing as booked.  We are perfect for large groups as we can accommodate up to 23 (if sharing queen beds).  For groups not sharing beds we can accommodate up to 15.  We have a lovely shaded private lawn area, perfect for picnics or even a marquee can be erected (at guests expense).

name: Mataro Cottage Barossa Valley
summary: Mataro Cottage is positioned in the beautiful historic district of Tanunda surrounded by churches and other character homes. Located only 150 metres from the main street of Tanunda it is an easy walk to restaurants, wineries, cafes and retail shops. Mataro cottage is a fully renovated 1925 cottage offering 2 bedrooms, separate lounge room inc queen sofa bed,stunning full bathroom with second toilet,fully equipped laundry,and an open Kitchen with separate dinning area overlooking the garden.
space: To enhance your stay with us we also are owner operators of the multi award winning touring business Tour Barossa / Getaways SA. Happy to organise tours in the Barossa, Clare, Adelaide Hills, McLaren Vale, KI, Adelaide, restaurant transfers, and airport transfers. We are happy to offer a special discount for our guests.

summary: A self contained modern three bedroom three bathroom 4.5 STAR rated executive style house in a top address in Tanunda - walking distance to wineries. Air conditioned plus has log fire. space: OK - so what does 4.5 STAR rated mean - it means that Lochnagar Barossa has been independently assessed by STAR Ratings Australia - the body owned by the motoring agencies across Australia and being up the top when it comes to Cleanliness Quality and Facilities. Others may claim to be good but Lochnagar Barossa has been checked out - and been rated at 4.5 STARS since

notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience Two night minimum at all times - three or four on long weekends, Barossa Events or Easter
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 20 years experience in the BnB industry.
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: cottages4u - Jewel of the Valley
summary: When you really are looking for the best in town, then you can't not look at Jewel of the Valley. You get the whole house to yourselves and it is fully equipped - including breakfast provisions  Right in the heart of Tanunda - quality throughout this restored Californian bungalow offers superior self cont accommodation for up to 6 in 3 bedrooms. 2 bathrooms, spa & double shower. Air cond. Walk to restaurants - fermentAsian is across the road and 1918 just around the corner.
space: Discover the quiet times of the past as you unwind to the flicker of flame from the log fire in the casual lounge or the rich smell of leather from the Chesterfield in the formal lounge. Choose between a magnificent antique four poster bed in the Master bedroom, a Queen size bedroom or a twin room with two King size singles. You have a choice of bathrooms – one with a deluxe spa bath, the other a double shower. There is one toilet. Indulge in a gourmet breakfast prepared using the freshest Barossa produce in the fully equipped kitchen with top of the range appliances.  Relax outside in the entertaining area that boasts a gas outdoor BBQ ready to be enjoyed.  A precious Jewel.
description: When you really are looking for the best in town, then you can't not look at Jewel of the Valley. You get the whole house to yourselves and it is fully equipped - including breakfast provisions  Right in the heart of Tanunda - quality throughout this restored Californian bungalow offers superior self cont accommodation for up to 6 in 3 bedrooms. 2 bathrooms, spa & double shower. Air cond. Walk to restaurants - fermentAsian is across the road and 1918 just around the corner. Discover the quiet times of the past as you unwind to the flicker of flame from the log fire in the casual lounge or the rich smell of leather from the Chesterfield in the formal lounge. Choose between a magnificent antique four poster bed in the Master bedroom, a Queen size bedroom or a twin room with two King size singles. You have a choice of bathrooms – one with a deluxe spa bath, the other a double shower. There is one toilet. Indulge in a gourmet breakfast prepared using the freshest Barossa produce in the ful
neighborhood_overview: Jewel of the Valley is at Number 1 Elizabeth Street, Tanunda.  Turn off the main street at the Band Rotunda and veer left down Elizabeth Street.  Number 1 is immediately on your right adjacent the Apex Bakery. Fermentasian (the Barossa's famous Viet restaurant is just over the road. The 1918 Restuarant is only 200 metres away
notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download. The access code is provided when booking confirmed
transit: Onsite parking for two cars is provided The public bus operates from the main street (250 metres away) Onsite off street parking is provided for guests We suggest one of the local tour operators to take you around the Barossa - save drink driving and you get to learn a bit about wine food and history There are two local taxi companies
interaction: Your host lives in the town but not on-site. Phone contact numbers are in the House Manual in the kitchen
house_rules: Jewel of the Valley is a NO SMOKING INDOORS property.  If there is evidence of smoking indoors an additional $500 cleaning fee will be charged. If you book for 2 adults it is assumed that you are a couple sharing a bed.  If this is not the case, please indicate at the time of booking.  When 2 people use separate beds an additional charge of $50 is payable to cover additional linen and cleaning. Payable on arrival.
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 20 years experience in the BnB industry.
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Homestead - Barossa Valley
summary: Rowland Flat, Heart of the beautiful Barossa. Come and stay on a working vineyard in the centre of Barossa. 5 mins from Lyndoch and Tanunda. 2 mins away from Krondorf Road, hope to St Hallet. Rockford and St Hugo.
space: The house is a beautifully restored with 4 rooms. Rent out entire home. Has a very large Dining Room and Terrace.. beautiful views across the vineyard. There are 3 King Beds - you can make one of the king beds into two king single beds, and there is also a queen bed. We have a travel cot for toddlers and baby cot for babies.

name: Pembury Homestead Barossa Valley
summary: Pembury Estate built in 1905 is situated on 10 acres. Your room has a comfortable queen bed, is charming & spacious with tall ceilings only 5 minutes walk into historic Angaston in the Barossa Valley.
space: We are in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Our home is in a prime location for travelers! Set on the edge of the town of Angaston we live in a 1905 blue stone homestead built for one of the Salter family  sons of Saltram wines Our 10 acre property has 1 acre of vines, we have sheep and alpacas and 2 dogs You have a lovely large room, a quiet environment, and as hosts we do our best to welcoming you and are sensitive to your privacy need Our blue stone homestead, has four bedrooms with a kitchen, lounge, combined laundry / large bathroom. It is centrally heated and we find we do not require cooling due to the stone walls, but there is a fan for summer in case we have a heat wave. We are used to sharing our home with others, as we have been providing accommodation for the last 2 years with vintage casuals working short term in wineries for vintage. You will find us to be relaxed, friendly and happy to have you stay with us. We love our house and hope you will too. We look forward to answ

neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a quiet heritage town. A town walk is a must. We are middle of the Barossa Valley close to the famous Barossa Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning Though we are set in a beautiful location with views up the valley overlooking vineyards and paddocks with ancient gums. We are only 5 minutes’ walk to a variety of the Barossa's top restaurants, pubs and cafes. As well as the butcher bakery, supermarket and pharmacy. We are also right next to the walking/bike track that will take you into Angaston, Nuriootpa and now all the way to Gawler.  There are a couple of cellar doors and restaurants in Angaston within walking distance as well as many cellar door options throughout the valley. Angaston is 8km from Tanunda and 7 km from Nuriootpa As there is no public transport so a car is a must. Other options are booking a personalised vineyard tour, or utilising the local taxi service.
transit: Located one hour from Adelaide, the Barossa Valley is a truly fantastic location to explore the best of the regions wines.  Angaston is just 8km from Tanunda and 7 km from Nuriootpa 5 minute walk into Angaston Bike/walking track, bike hire available at the hardware store 5 minute walk The town of Angaston offers you access to an amazing variety of cafes, bars, restaurants, cheese shop award winning Schultz butcher, bakery, supermarket, pharmacy and any time fitness gym, as well as 2 ATMs
access: YOUR PRIVATE ROOM (4 x 4.5 meter) comes with: Comfortable queen bed, fresh and clean linen and towels  (option for extra single mattress for a 3rd person)  central heating , flat screen TV, desk, full length mirror, free wifi, cupboard and ample space for suitcases  Shared large bathroom/ shower and toilet Shared kitchen facilities and cookware, dishwasher, washing machine, living room, bathroom, Milk and  tea available. Please treat the space like it's your own, we want you to have a great time. We will give you a key so you have the freedom to come and go as you please.
interaction: We will be sharing the living room, kitchen and bathroom. However we are social and busy people and tend to spend quite a lot of time out, so you will often have the house to yourself, but we may also have friends around from time to time. Enjoy a drink overlooking the garden, gum trees and neighbouring vines. We have plenty of off-street parking and are situated close to the walking/bike track that is very popular with cyclists and walkers alike. Surrounding the house is 10 acres to enjoy walking and exploring. There is also a shared large bathroom with a bath, shower and hand basin and toilet  Being local we have a wealth of local knowledge we are happy to share and help guests get the most out of their stay. We can give you local tips on going out, dining, and are up to date with what’s going on in town. We don’t mind sharing what we know, but we can also be as hands off as you want. Jonathan runs a tour business Barossa Taste Sensations and therefore has a wealth of knowledge to he
house_rules: Treat our home the same way you would treat your own. We are power and water conscious.  We appreciate most guests will respect our property, however so there are no misunderstandings please note the following  Only a few house rules...  - Respect each other's belongings/properties  - Turn off any unused electrical appliances you have switched on  - No smoking inside, Smoking outside please, Smoking is permitted on the verandah but not inside.  - We prefer guests to talk to us first before inviting other friends over  - We are happy to have a book in time that suits our guests if check-in is later than 10pm, please kindly notify us  24hrs ahead of time  - If any significant damages is made by Guest during the stay, then Guest may be liable for additional cost of repair -We're friendly if you want interaction or unobtrusively discreet if you'd prefer.

name: Hill House Angaston
summary: Hill House is bed and breakfast accommodation in the Barossa Valley, South Australia's world renowned wine region, overlooking the picturesque township of Angaston. Stay in 1851 the original 2-room cottage part of this outstanding historic country mansion. Ideal for couples, 1851 is a beautifully appointed suite with private access. Take advantage of the many wineries, cellar doors and award winning restaurants nearby.

name: ~ Tranquil Private Room ~
summary: Our tranquil setting will have you relaxed the moment you arrive. With a five-minute walk in to the main street of Angaston, you have on your door step all that this beautiful little village has to offer. You will require a car to view the sights further a far, or you can hire a bike, scooter or trike within the Barossa to add to your adventure. Your private room consists of a comfortable queen bed, and shared use of our bathroom, kitchen, dining and lounge area.
space: This is a very quiet relaxing space, your room has a comfortable queen size bed. You are close to the town, that consists of many cafes, restaurants and an IGA Foodland. We ask that you do not use our kitchen space for cooking meals. Should you require to purchase any food, you are welcome to keep it in our shared fridge.

We ask that you do not use our kitchen space for cooking meals. Should you require to purchase any food, you are welcome to keep it in our shared fridge. You have your own private room with basic amenities. You have access to our living area, dining area, kitchen area and bathroom areas. Should you wish to utilise our washing machine this can be done by prior
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet and open estate with lovely elderly neighbours, and we ask that you respect them by keeping noise to a minimum and avoid parking in their driveways. You will be provided with your own car parking space. There is no smoking in or around our home, although if you do require to smoke you will be required to do this away from the homes and estate.
transit: We have very little public transport in the Barossa Valley. You will require a car to get around. Taxi's are available at certain times. There is access to bike hire, scooter hire or trike hire should you wish to book this yourself. I do have a standard ladies bike here that you are welcome to use anytime. (We have road safety rules in SA and helmets are required when cycling. The helmut is in laundry).
access: You have your own private room with basic amenities. You have access to our living area, dining area, kitchen area and bathroom areas. Should you wish to utilise our washing machine this can be done by prior arrangement. You will be provided with your own parking space. Please note that I enjoy using essential oils, candles and occasionally incense...These can bring some strong smells that do not agree with everyone. Should you wish to book and you may be sensitive to essential oils, please be mindful of this.
interaction: We generally will be home during your stay although I do travel and will be away most weekends if you are staying at that time. You have contact to myself if needed, and a family member that will be feeding our cat will not be far away from town should you require their assistance. If I am here I am happy to provide as much information as possible and interact with you or give you as much space as you require. We are a very quiet family, so this is a very quiet space.
house_rules: This is a family home with a young child. We ask that you be mindful with respectful behaviour at all times. We ask that there are no parties or late noisy evenings with no additional guests unless it is a prior arrangement with the host. We have our beautiful, friendly cat Jester that resides with us, and you may at times require to let him in or out, if you are going in and out, if we are out and about town. We live in a quiet and open estate with lovely elderly neighbours, and we ask that you respect them by keeping noise to a minimum and avoid parking in their driveways. You will be provided with your own car parking space. There is no smoking in or around our home, although if you do require to smoke you will be required to do this away from the homes and estate.
host_about: I have a passion for healing and self-discovery, following my heart and being inspired, meeting new people and discovering that there is so much beauty, joy, peace, and freedom within.

name: Collingrove Homestead
summary: Collingrove (c1856) was conceived as a little piece of England by the pioneers of the Barossa Valley, the Angas Family.   Collingrove is perfect for those who like a step back in time.  Come and experience life in an authentic Barossa mansion.
space: Collingrove is suited to a romantic getaway or a family/friends get together. Each guest room is individually styled.  All rooms are furnished with French Provincial hand-carved beds, crisp white linen and French Toile quilts.  The beds are of a high quality ensuring a good night sleep. We have five guest rooms in total, three have ensuite bathrooms which are decorated in black and white English tile. There are two more bedrooms which are the Maids Quarters - Wisteria and Jasmine.  The Wisteria room can be a private room with sole use of the bathroom or both (Wisteria & Jasmine) can be used as a two bedroom suite with shared use of the bathroom.     Guest amenities include a large Hydrotherapy spa located in the old Carriage House.  The Guest Lounge is a great space to socialise, relax on the leather lounges and stoke up the open fire.  The Lounge has wine glasses, tea, coffee facilities and a full size fridge for guests use. Collingrove is set on 14 acres, with manicured gardens and a

neighborhood_overview: Collingrove is located 5kms out of Angaston in a peaceful and serene country setting.  The Homestead is surrounded by century old English trees and are home to many species of native birds. We have many world class wineries within easy reach of Collingrove.  We are more than happy to assist you with planning your itinerary or arrange a local tour operator to take you around the Barossa Valley. We are a short drive from the world renowned Kaiserstuhl Conservation Park which is perfect for bushwalkers. There are two walking trails passing through a variety of landscapes including creeks, rocky outcrops, areas of low forest, scrub and open grassland. The park has panoramic views across the ranges to the Barossa Valley.   The Wallowa Hike offers a comprehensive look at the park's main features, including rock formations and a scenic lookout, while the Stringybark Loop provides a brief look at the park's diverse flora and fauna.   Dusk and early mornings are the best time to observe the par
transit: We recommend you hire a car.  We can advise you on Taxi's and winery tours.
access: Access to guest lounge and Hot tub is available at your convenience.
interaction: We are happy to meet you at a convenient time to check-in you in to your rooms, show you around the property and explain the facilities.  We are also happy to give you some local recommendations if you would like us to :) We are contactable 24hr by mobile or text as well.
house_rules: - We are happy to accommodate most check-in times  All check-in's must be prearranged  SMS on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or call (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

name: Strathlyn Coach House Barossa
summary: Please note there is a minimum stay of 2 nights. Make use of the new Gymnasium and Guest Laundry on the property. Enjoy the location set among the vineyards. Conveniently close to the town of Angaston, cafes, restaurants, wineries and  bike track.
space: Strathlyn Coach House is an independent building located at Strathlyn Estate, a privately owned 5 acre historic property located on the fringe of Angaston in the Barossa Valley. The coach house was constructed circa 1905 was restored in 1995 as comfortable accommodation for two. Built of local stone with 30 centimetre walls, the coach house is quite an historic landmark, testifying to life of a bygone era. The outside of the building remains much the same as it was in 1905, but the interior has been finished with extensive use of timber. A mezzanine level bedroom has been created from the original loft floor. A large balcony area, reached from the attractive bedroom, has panoramic views across the width of the valley to the Greenock Ranges. Guests can sip a glass of wine while watching the setting sun, or enjoy an intimate breakfast for two on a warm, still morning. A separate driveway to the building, and secluded location away from the main residence ensure guests' privacy. The facil
description: Please note there is a minimum stay of 2 nights. Make use of the new Gymnasium and Guest Laundry on the property. Enjoy the location set among the vineyards. neighborhood_overview: Strathlyn Estate is a very private property surrounded by extensive gardens. It is off the main road located amongst vineyards within walking distance of Saltram Winery. The accommodation is 1 km from Angaston town where guests can access the start of the bike track that runs through the centre of the Barossa Valley to Gawler.
notes: When first arriving check in at the Reception located on the eastern verandah of the main residence facing the tennis court. During certain times of the year (harvesting) there will be activities and some occasional noise within the vineyards.
transit: Please ask your host Heather about the local taxi service and tours of the Valley.
access: Guests can access the whole property except the main residence interior.  The coachhouse is a stand alone building 80 m from the main residence located in an old Almond Orchard.
interaction: Your host, Heather, is available to provide local knowledge and suggestions upon request. Guests should be mindful that there may be other guests staying in some of the other accommodation options on the property.
house_rules: Please leave the Coach House in a tidy condition upon departure. No smoking. No more than 2 people per room.  No extra guests permitted.

name: The B&B of Bliss
summary: A lovely old, bluestone cottage which sits at the top end of the beautiful, leafy main street of Angaston, in the Barossa.  A small shop/café runs in the front of the cottage and a snug, private B&B has it's home in the back.
space: The cottage is over 100 years old and was originally the home of the town blacksmith.  His forge is still next door and gets fired up every weekend by local volunteers.  Living heritage. Inside Bliss, the queen sized French iron bed is very comfy and the kitchen is light filled, spacious and well stocked.  In the lounge room, there is an eclectic mix of armchairs and sofas, perfect for curling up with a book and something good to drink.  The smart TV is decently sized for a cosy night in. Fancy a carpet picnic?  The local pizza joint, Roaring 40's, is very good and only a two minute walk down the street).  The bathroom at Bliss is generously sized and includes a rather large raised spa bath.  Happy days :) The Barossa is famous for its food as well as its wine and part of staying at Bliss is the menu that goes with it.  Freshly made food with a strong emphasis on local, homegrown ingredients will always be on offer.   Being in the main street of Angaston, the cottage is walking distanc

His forge is still next door and gets fired up every weekend by local volunteers.  Living heritage. Inside Bliss, the queen sized French iron bed is very comfy and the kitchen is light filled, spacious and well stocked.  In the lounge room, there is an eclectic mix of armchairs and sofas, perfect for curling up with a book and something good to drink.  The smart TV is decently sized for a cosy night in. Fancy a carpet picnic?  The local pizza joint, Roaring 40's, is very good and only a two minute walk down the street).  The bathroom at Bliss is generously sized and includes a rather large raised spa bath.  Happy days :) The Barossa is famous for its food as well as its wine and
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is absolutely the prettiest of the Barossa towns, set slightly up in the hills that border the East of The Barossa.  Green, leafy and with a main street that is full of interesting shops and some beautiful parks.  There are plenty of coffee spots, (including ours!) and eateries in Angaston.  As previously mentioned, the little Italian cooking school and restaurant Casa Carboni is a stand out, as is The Barossa Valley Cheese Company.  Yalumba Winery is a two minute drive away and Saturday morning Barossa Farmers Market is about 3km down the road.
notes: A small shop/cafe, The Little Shop of Bliss, runs from the front of the property from Wednesdays through to Sundays.   It is completely closed off from the B&B by a stout, locked door and doesn't impact in any way apart from being a fun place to wander into for a good browse and a coffee, (always on the house for guests).
transit: It's all walking distance to so much and just a short drive to everything else.  It couldn't be easier or more convenient.
access: The B&B includes a private courtyard, shaded by an ancient currant vine (planted in 1912) and decked out with a red gum picnic table and a barbeque.   Next to the courtyard is a covered car port for guests to park and access to the B&B is via a door within the courtyard.
interaction: We will always be available for our guests.  While they are staying with us, they are honoured members of our family and we are here to look after them and make sure that their time in the Barossa is a wonderful experience.
house_rules: Mainly it's the smoking thing- by all means, smoking is permitted, but only outside.  Apart from this, we simply expect our guests to respect and love the cottage as much as we do, (which is lots!)
host_about:
I live on a beautiful, little, old farm in the hills of the Barossa Valley with my two children.  My love of animals has seen me work as a veterinary surgeon for many years and that is reflected by the menagerie that live with us, including the three ponies and beautiful foal, our dogs- Audrey, Lynch and Finn and our meet and greet goats Nancy Drew and Inspector Frost. 
When not working as a vet, I am usually in my kitchen or my garden.  Preparing a meal with a glass of good Barossa wine by my side or tending to my garden while my geese wander through inspecting my efforts are both my idea of happiness.
I have been lucky enough to travel to many places in the world and have made friends and beautiful memories to last me a lifetime.  Now it is time to show the world how amazing my place is.

name: The Sculptors Shed
summary: Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyard and just a stroll away from the Barossa Farmers Market.  This private room is separate to the main house, situated in the families back yard.  The Sculptors shed is a small, simple room with the basics on hand.  It is clean, warm, modern and comfortable all year round and a perfect place to rest your head while exploring the Barossa during the day.
space: The room is part of a shed in the garden of local metal sculptor, Tony Howard.  It is separate to the main house, looks out onto the garden and backs onto vineyard.  A family of 5 live in the house and therefore children may be playing in the backyard, near the room on occasion.
description: Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyard and just a stroll away from the Barossa Farmers Market.  This private room is separate to the main house, situated in the families back yard.  The Sculptors shed is a small, simple room with the basics on hand.  It is clean, warm, modern and comfortable all year round and a perfect place to rest your head while exploring the Barossa during the day. The room is part of a shed in the garden of local metal sculptor, Tony Howard.  It is separate to the main house, looks out onto the garden and backs onto vineyard.  A family of 5 live in the house and therefore children may be playing in the backyard, near the room on occasion. The room has it's own ensuite bathroom and you also have access to a basic kitchenette in the shed next door.  The kitchen is not fancy and we don't provide any food but it has everything you should need if you wish to use it. There is plenty of secure, off street parking. The family in the main hous
neighborhood_overview: We are smack bang in the middle of the Barossa Valley on the Valley floor, a short stroll from the famous Barossa Farmers Market, that runs every Saturday morning, and walking distance to one of the Barossa's top restaurants, Vintners Bar and Grill.  We are also very close to the bike track that will take you into Angaston, Nuriootpa and now all they way to Lyndoch.  Hundreds of cellar doors and resturants are also close by.
notes: This room is very private but you are in the back yard of a family home and family life - including children- will be happening around you!
transit: We have plenty of off-street parking and are situated close to the bike track that is very popular with cyclists and walkers alike. Public transport in the Barossa is limited and we are situated slightly out of town so a bike or preferably a car is essential.
access: The room has it's own ensuite bathroom and you also have access to a basic kitchenette in the shed next door.  The kitchen is not fancy and we don't provide any food but it has everything you should need if you wish to use it. There is plenty of secure, off street parking.
interaction: The family in the main house are happy to help any way we can during your stay, or you can have as much privacy as you like. We are happy to recommend local eateries, cellar doors and attractions.  The room is in a shed directly behind the main house, in the back yard of the family home, so we usually see our guests as they arrive and leave. We are happy to share our back verandah where there is outdoor seating and tables. We sometimes like to sit on our back verandah for a drink and the kids like to play outside so there may be people and chatter outside the room on occasion.
house_rules: No smoking inside. Please turn off air conditioner/heater and lights when you leave the room.
host_about: Food and wine lovers that love being surrounded by family and friends and meeting new people

Private ensuite bathroom,aircon,electric blanket, robes, fridge, micro,expresso coffee machine.Your own private lounge has 42" TV. Free Netflix.Free Wifi. Shared access to our pool. A 2nd Queen bedroom is available.The Queen room cannot be booked by itself as it shares the bathroom/toilet in the  King.

neighborhood_overview: We are a 1 min walk to the main street of Angaston which is not called the Jewel of the Barossa for nothing. It's a beautiful village surrounded by vineyards,great restaurants and stunning scenery.
notes: Maddie,our gorgeous Jack Russell, lives in our part of the house. She is very people friendly. A picnic basket & rug is available to borrow.
transit: It's best to have a car to get around the Barossa to visit the wineries & restaurants. There are taxis and tour companies but no Uber.
access: Your modern apartment style accommodation is totally private, quiet and separate from our area. You will have your own bedroom/s, private lounge,  Continental Breakfast,expresso coffee machine, microwave, fridge, plates, cutlery and shared pool access.However, the other end of the house where we live,including our lounge/kitchen  are not accessible to guests.
interaction: We are available at  the other end of  the house if needed.Happy to give advice on local wineries and restaurants and the Barossa generally.
house_rules: - Free wifi, however we are not on an unlimited plan and are in a regional area so please no extra large video file downloads.  - We provide a 42 " flat screen TV with unlimited Netflix,however we ask your cooperation in keeping the volume down after 10pm. - You are welcome to use our shared pool on the strict condition that you are solely responsible for yourself and your children. No glass at  the pool.Pool towels provided, no excessive noise please. - Check in 3 pm - Check out 11 am
host_about: I was a New York jewellery designer and spent 5 years traveling the world selling my original work on six star cruise ships.Came to this  beautiful country 4 years ago,first to the northern beaches of Sydney,now recently settled in the beautiful wine growing region of  the Barossa Valley,Australia and here I am staying.I am a houseproud homebody who enjoys the simplicities of life and meeting like minded souls from around the world.

name: Wroxton Grange
summary: Our place is close to restaurants and dining. You’ll love our place because of the outdoors space and the light. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids).
space: We are a married couple who live in a spacious bluestone homestead, circa 1870, & are proud to share our family heritage with others.  You are welcome to walk our beautiful 500 acre property with its birdlife, drystone walls, vineyards, sheep & cattle.
description: Our place is close to restaurants and dining. You’ll love our place because of the outdoors space and the light. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids). We are a married couple who live in a spacious bluestone homestead, circa 1870, & are proud to share our family heritage with others.  You are welcome to walk our beautiful 500 acre property with its birdlife, drystone walls, vineyards, sheep & cattle. The spacious guest suite is private & self contained with all amenities & has its own private entrance from the front verandah which is ideal for outdoor breakfasts. As we live under the same roof as our guests, we  need to respect each others' space.  However, we are usually on hand & happy to help with our local knowledge & any problems you may encounter. We are situated close to a conservation park with its Aussie wildlife or take a short 5km drive to the nearest town of Angaston, which has an English heritage & is known as the f
neighborhood_overview: We are situated close to a conservation park with its Aussie wildlife or take a short 5km drive to the nearest town of Angaston, which has an English heritage & is known as the foodie capital of the Barossa.  It has a Saturday morning Farmers Market, cheese shop, coffee shops, wine tasting room, parks & a pleasant village atmosphere.
transit: We can offer to transport you for a small fee in our accredited tour vehicle to visit the small wine producers of the Eden Valley wine region, but if this is your first trip to the Barossa you may prefer to drive yourselves to explore the various attractions of the area which interest you most.
access: The spacious guest suite is private & self contained with all amenities & has its own private entrance from the front verandah which is ideal for outdoor breakfasts.
interaction: As we live under the same roof as our guests, we  need to respect each others' space.  However, we are usually on hand & happy to help with our local knowledge & any problems you may encounter.
house_rules: Guest accommodation, while private, is under main roof of homestead so we need to respect each others' space.
host_about: My husband, Ian & I are third generation vignerons on our family vineyard property in the Eden Valley region of the beautiful Barossa, renowned for its fine food & wine.  Ian is the vigneron & I work at the library as local history officer.  We have travelled widely, to North & South America, Europe, Africa, Asia & New Zealand and a favourite destination is England.  We now enjoy driving with our caravan to all parts of this wide brown land of Australia.  We have hosted B&B guests in a self contained queen suite in our spacious Victorian homestead  for many years & have always enjoyed sharing our corner of the world with others.  We would now like to welcome you to this special place with its peace amid immense rural beauty, yet close to all the attractions of the Barossa, such as the nearby Conservation Park, Saturday Farmers Market, wineries, restaurants & more!

name: Pembury Cottage ~ Angaston,  Barossa Valley
summary: PEMBURY *** Newly Renovated 2017 *** SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF ANGASTON Pembury is a charming, stylish, fully renovated three-bedroom house centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region. Situated at the quiet end of the main street of Angaston, this classic late 1800s cottage features modern and comfortable décor as well as a fully fenced, level backyard.
space: Pembury is a luxury self-contained property, beautifully renovated, classic late 1800s cottage, with a modern and comfortable décor and secure backyard suitable for pets. Located in historic Angaston Pembury Cottage comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests with 3 king sized bedrooms and a spacious shower/wet room and 2 toilets. House trained pets are welcome.    Provisions are supplied for a cooked breakfast, made from the best local produce, on the first morning of your stay. Settle into the comfortable lounge with a wood burning combustion stove, or head out to the large covered pergola, complete with gas BBQ, or relax in the covered eating area under the verandah.  All rooms have reverse cycle split system air-conditioners for year-round comfort. Take an easy stroll down the street to the many cafes and restaurants, no cabs required! Great pizzas, coffee, Italian Cooking School at Casa Carboni, the Barossa Valley Cheese Company, Thai restaurant  - lots of options to keep you fed and

Settle into the comfortable lounge with a wood burning combustion stove, or head out to the large covered per
neighborhood_overview: Angaston known as the Jewel of the Barossa offers a great diversity of restaurants, cafe's, a cooking school and Taste Eden Valley, a tasting room featuring wines exclusively from Eden Valley. Easy access to the other towns of the Barossa is within a 8 minute drive which opens up this great wine and food region. Don't forget the Farmers Market every Saturday, do some shopping, have some breakfast and cook up a great dinner in the modern kitchen, Or, let us get the chef to do that for you!
notes: Kate and Jonathan have lived locally for many years. They are well known characters. Should any need arise they can assist with suggested itineraries. Otherwise you will have the house to yourselves and will not be disturbed Please do give us a call if you do require anything.  We can organise great local chefs to provide an' in house' degustation dinner (no need to go out after a day of wine tasting) or provisions for a picnic. Prior notice is required.
transit: There is a taxi service but no Uber available in the area. As a special offer to our guests we can arrange a private wine tour for the day guided by Jonathan from Barossa Taste Sensations and your host at Pembury Cottage. Drawing on over 10 year experience  the tour focuses on the boutique wineries that highlight the diversity of this great wine region.
access: Access – We have a key safe at the rear of the property, so access is easy. We can be contacted on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or via email (EMAIL HIDDEN) Shops, just a short walk away include a butcher, great bacon, baker, pharmacy, ATM's and supermarket that's open until 8.00 all within a 5 min walk.  Our accommodation offers fully equipped modern kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas comfortably seating 6 people.

name: Bluebird Cottage is a relaxing 100year old cottage
summary: My place is good for couples and business travellers.  Bluebird Cottage is a unique and historic Bed & Breakfast nestled in the heart of South Australia's famous Barossa Valley region in Angaston. Your stay at Bluebird Cottage is all about winding down and relaxing to enjoy the atmosphere created by the charm in the cottage. Capture the Barossa Experience with a day of wine tasting at many world class wineries and we are in walking distance to first class restaurants, cafes and pubs.
space: You can take the direct route from Adelaide via Port Wakefield Road, Northern Expressway up to Nuriootpa then across to Angaston (80 km). You may prefer to take the route through the Adelaide hills to Birdwood, Mt Pleasant which is a more scenic drive. Our guests are pleasantly surprised at the size and space our cottage provides which is ideal for one or two couples to enjoy comfortably.

notes: If you like walking or bike riding there walking trails and a bike hire shop in the town.   you can also hire a motor scooter which is a great way of seeing the Barossa Valley
access: Bluebird Cottage is a charming early settlers cottage which acquires its name from the feature hand-painted lead light windows in each bedroom. The cottage is furnished with period furniture, comfortable beds, lounge chairs, luxury dining and modern kitchen/bathroom facilities (with second shower, toilet and laundry) and an outdoor entertaining courtyard under the 100 year old vines and barbecue.
interaction: We are always available to help our guests with local knowledge of the beautiful Barossa Valley and if required we can suggest a tour which could save time.We also offer a complimenary 2 hour guided tour,with a map of suggested wineries and places of interest

A perfect relaxing escape  Provisions for continental breakfasts are supplied along with home made slice, chocolate fudge. Free Wifi connection

name: Angaston Masonic Lodge SAs Heritage
summary: Hello & welcome to Angaston (Crown of the Barossa) & home to one of South Australia's most prized architectural listing. The 147yo lodge is located within walking distance to everything Angaston. Local cafes, restaurants, award winning produce, wineries, bikeways/walkways, historical points of interest & surrounded by beautiful scenery. Affordable luxury.
space: Architectural brilliance at its best. The overwhelmingly large space with impossibly high ceilings offer overwhelming spaciousness while the half metre thick stone walls are a great natural insulator. Nature sometimes needs a little help. The air-conditioning will keep you cool in summer while the oversized combustion heater & individual space heaters will keep you warm in winter. Natural light streams through the well appointed windows and offers glimpses of the historic walk and surrounding trees outside. Naturally beautiful & well appointed collectable furniture complements all the modern amenities, including a full size pool table, large wall mounted smart tv, karaoke style DVD player and chess table set. The marble hearth is set at just the perfect height to sit by the fire with your wine while contemplating how fluffy are those well appointed mats.
description: Hello & welcome to Angaston (Crown of the Barossa) & home to one of South Australia's most prized architectural listing. The 147yo lodge is located within walking distance to everything Angaston. Local cafes, restaurants, award winning produce, wineries, bikeways/walkways, historical points of interest & surrounded by beautiful scenery. Affordable luxury. Architectural brilliance at its best. The overwhelmingly large space with impossibly high ceilings offer overwhelming spaciousness while the half metre thick stone walls are a great natural insulator. Nature sometimes needs a little help. The air-conditioning will keep you cool in summer while the oversized combustion heater & individual space heaters will keep you warm in winter. Natural light streams through the well appointed windows and offers glimpses of the historic walk and surrounding trees outside. Naturally beautiful & well appointed collectable furniture complements all the modern amenities, including a full size pool table
neighborhood_overview: Put simply, friendly country hospitality.  We look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to our township and world class Barossa region. You will love the culture, history and regional diversity. Our community is safe, walking the streets isn't a worry, please consider, not all roads are well lit. we can provide you with a torch or download a torch to your mobile phone.
notes: We live on site, please let us know if this will impact on your stay. With the 990 millimetre tapered stone walls, noise and temperature is well regulated.  Blue tooth your favourite music to the karaoke style CD player and "crank out some tunes". Or maybe you prefer to settle back into the textured chesterfield lounges and download a movie to enjoy with wine and cheese, or weather permitting, we will set you up outside under the winter creek lined tree canopy. Sufficient wood for the combustion heater will be provided during your stay, please let us know if you need assistance to fill the fire. We'll provide you with some education if you have never filled a fire before.  General maintence to clear ash from the fire will be required during longer stays. Please nominate a suitable time of day for this routine procedure to occur, together with restocking of the wood supply for your use. Please enquire about our laundry facilities and additionally for longer stays, linen changes and hous
transit: Will are situated approximately 90 minutes by car from the city of Adelaide. Regional public transport services are available but do not run as regularly as the city. Please let us know if you need assistance. Bus services run twice daily to the city and Linksa run local regular services around the district.  Taxi services are also available.  There are ample push bike and walking trails. Oh, did we mention you can hire our scooters. And of course we can link you with our partners chauffeured vehicles.
access: You will be in awe of this State Heritage listed space. You will have exclusive acces to level 1 (7 steps from street level) with approximately 180 square metres and 5 1/2 metre height ceilings devoted entirely for your comfort.  The property has been listed by the State of South Australia for its grand design and unique prominence above the Main Street of Angaston. Travellers and locals alike, often seek a photo opportunity on the steps with the bluestone and slate building in the backdrop and 145 year old State Heritage listed Moreton by fig trees create a frame for the building in the foreground. You will have exclusive access to two diverse areas, the formal dine with 145yo piano, Chesterfield daytime reading area and smaller smart television. This area adjoins the separate kitchen and leads onto the entertainment room. This room  We encourage book exchanges.  The kitchenette is complete with all modern basic amenities, dishwasher, bar fridge, full size electric stove, convection m
interaction: Your experience is of paramount importance. Please let us know how much interaction you would prefer, we are happy to provide exclusive minimally intrusive private stays for the honeymooners in all of us or if you wish to interact more we are more than willing to assist planning your must do's both locally and the Barossa surrounds.
house_rules: Please, no smoking inside. Please consider the environment by placing your butts in the tray provided. Sorry. No pets. We ask that you leave the premises in the same condition. Please note, additional cleaning fees may apply.  We respect our environment and ask that you give consideration as well. We can provide a carton for recycling of wine and drink bottles.  There are no restrictions on noise levels. Our local council however does not permit the consumption of alcohol in the parks next door after 10pm. Street parking during Monday to Friday, is a 2 hour limit. If you choose to park beneath the Moreton bay fig trees, please consider we are unable to prevent debris falling from the trees onto your property. The same risks will apply to the off street parking on the premises.
host_about:
My partner Andrew and myself look forward to meeting you. The kids have almost all flown the coupe, yeh to some couple time. Well, until they return or drop off of the grandchildren. 
We have commenced a couple of new ventures and look forward to the trials and trivellations ahead. We both share a passion for living life to the max. Whether it's water skiing, wake boarding or attempting a new water based activity we will endeavour to give it a go.  We may not walk for a few days after, but that's another story. We love open air concerts, festivals, camping, gardening, building/construction/renovation. I love reading adventure novels and studying factual information to assist in new ventures, where as Andrew prefers me to provide him with the condensed version. 
We both firmly believe in ageing disgracefully.

The King has a private ensuite,aircon,makeup area,robes, fridge, micro,expresso coffee machine.The 2nd bedroom is a Queen.Electric blankets. Your own private lounge has 42" TV. Free Netflix. Free Wifi. Shared access to our pool.The Queen room cannot be booked by itself as it shares the  bathroom/toilet in the King Suite. Suitable for 2 couples or a family. We live at the other end next to the pool.

We live at the other end of the house next to the pool .Your have your own private,  entrance, off street parking and shared access to our beautiful in ground pool.

neighborhood_overview: Angaston is not called the Crown of the Barossa for nothing. It's a beautiful village surrounded by vineyards and stunning scenery.
notes: The 2 bedrooms are perfect for family or 2 couples travelling together. The Queen room shares the bathroom & toilet in the King room.  Maddie,our gorgeous Jack Russell, lives in our part of the house. She is very people friendly.
transit: It's best to have a car to get around the Barossa to visit the wineries & restaurants. There are taxis and tour companies but no Uber.
access: Your modern apartment style accommodation is totally private,quiet and separate from our area. You will have your own bedroom/s, Continental Breakfast, expresso coffee machine, microwave,fridge,plates,cutlery and shared pool access. However, the other end of the house where we live,including the lounge/kitchen  are not accessible for guests.
interaction: We are available at the other end of the house if needed. Happy to give advice on local wineries and restaurants.
house_rules: -  Free wifi,however we are not on an unlimited plan and are in a regional area so please no large video files please.  - We provide a 42 " flat screen TV with unlimited Netflix,however we ask your cooperation in keeping the volume down after 10pm. - You are welcome to use our shared pool on the strict condition that you are solely responsible for yourself and your children. No glass at the pool.Pool towels provided, no excessive noise please. - Check in 3 pm - Check out 11 am
host_about: I was a New York jewellery designer and spent 5 years traveling the world selling my original work on six star cruise ships.Came to this  beautiful country 4 years ago,first to the northern beaches of Sydney,now recently settled in the beautiful wine growing region of  the Barossa Valley,Australia and here I am staying.I am a houseproud homebody who enjoys the simplicities of life and meeting like minded souls from around the world.

name: The Corner House
summary: Our sweet, cosy and comfortable home, decorated in a simple, country style, is perfect for a holiday in the Barossa Valley with everything you'll need for a relaxing stay with room for a party of 5. Walking distance to the Main Street with restaurants, cafes and coffee shops. Relax on the plush rear lawn and vast deck, play tennis on the public courts opposite or cycle through the vines to Nuriootpa on the dedicated cycle path. We hope you'll love the Barossa as much as we do.
space: Our home is a painted brick 40s cottage that has been lovingly renovated and filled with bits and pieces from our global travels. The beds are comfy, great water pressure, deep old-school bath, dishwasher and fully equipped kitchen. Unlimited wifi, well-stocked bookshelves (lots of cycling books!) and everything we think you'll need during your stay. Main bedroom with queen-size bed with electric blanket and TV on the chest of drawers. Small writing desk. Hanging hooks and hangers behind the door. Second, smaller bedroom with double bed also with an electric blanket and chest of drawers. Hangers behind the door. Third bedroom with a single bed which could be used by an adult or child. There is also room to put up the travel cot if you have a little one. Let us know in advance and we will happily set it up for you.  One bathroom with deep bath, shower, vanity and loo. Laundry with washing machine, laundry liquid, iron etc Kitchen with dining setting for 6, fridge freezer, microwave, ket
description: Our sweet, cosy and comfortable home, decorated in a simple, country style, is perfect for a holiday in the Barossa Valley with everything you'll need for a relaxing stay with room for a party of 5. Walking distance to the Main Street with restaurants, cafes and coffee shops. Relax on the plush rear lawn and vast deck, play tennis on the public courts opposite or cycle through the vines to Nuriootpa on the dedicated cycle path. We hope you'll love the Barossa as much as we do. Our home is a painted brick 40s cottage that has been lovingly renovated and filled with bits and pieces from our global travels.
