neighborhood_overview: The Barossa is a stunning place to live. We love it! We can't wait to help our guests with hints and tips of where to visit, dine, taste and shop.  Angaston is where the locals live and it has a cosy, village vibe. We have the famous farmer's market on Saturday mornings (you'll need to get up early), awesome coffee shops, Yalumba winery just around the corner and sweet little gift and clothing stores. The Barossa Valley Cheese Company is a 5-minute walk down the hill, there is a super-cool bike track 3 minutes away, on which you can cycle through the vineyards to Nuriootpa, and Casa Carboni is stumbling-distance away for a long Sunday lunch.  There are also 2 pubs just a 5-minute stroll away for Friday-night drinks.  You could easily not leave Angaston during your stay but the rest of the Barossa also awaits and you'll have no problem filling up a weekend or even a week. We would love to make recommendations if you would like. We hope you'll love it here as much as we do.
notes: This is our home but we've recently moved not so far away owing to our work. We are available on the phone at any stage - don't hesitate to text or call.
transit: Public transport is pretty non existent in the Barossa so we encourage you to hire a car. Also, there is scooter rental just 5 minutes walk away next to Blonde Coffee- that's a cute way to get around the valley.
access: You'll have access to the whole home and entire garden - the space is entirely yours for your stay with us.
interaction: We know you'll want to relax and enjoy your stay in the magnificent Barossa Valley - so we want you to set the tone! If you want lots of interaction, then we will be there and if you don't then we will give you all the space you need.
house_rules: This is our home and we would love you to enjoy it and care for it, and our belongings, as much as we do: that's all we ask. Make yourself at home!
host_about: Australian citizen, returned to Australia in 2015 after 7 years in the UK. Wine industry professional.

name: Angaston by the Winter Creek
summary: Two storey log cabin style home nestled amongst a cottage garden and well established privacy trees. Imagine sitting on the front porch with a cuppa watching the birds and listening to the meandering winter creek. A perfect backdrop for your wedding or commitment ceremony.
space: This property is within a short walking distance to everything Angaston while assuring peace, tranquility and privacy. We offer versatility, whether catering for families, small groups of friends or even holding your own small private garden function.  You have sufficient space for two families. Please let us know if you require bedding alterations. We are more than happy to substitute a queen bed for two additional single beds.  We have a queen bedroom upstairs with your own private balcony. Downstairs, you have views over the garden and grounds from the dine.  The setting goes well with your complimentary full breakfast. Cook this up in the full size kitchen or outdoors on the entertainment deck BBQ. We are even equipped with a juicer and coffee machine. The lounge room sets the scene for a quiet night in. Perhaps enjoy a movie from the DVD selection. Maybe we have your old favourite to watch while lounging in front of the combustion heater in addition to heating and cooling. If movi

neighborhood_overview: Angaston is defined as the Crown of the Barossa nestled amongst the foothills. Country hospitality, beautiful scenery, culture, ample free open public spaces, walking tracks and push bike tracks coupled with the necessities, cafes, cheese shop, award winning butcher/small goods, restaurants, wine bars and of course, the world famous Barossa cellar doors. Why not consider hiring a scooter and capture you entire days experience on the go pro. We can load your day's captured experience onto the usb stick. Check us out on the (EMAIL HIDDEN)
notes: We do have some friendly semi free range chooks on the property who are responsible for laying your breakfast eggs. Our seasonal fruit is pesticide free and available for you. Additionally you will have access to any seasonal vegetables and spices.
transit: Public transport to the Barossa region departs from the city bus centre or you can jump off the train at Gawler and jump on a Linksa bus from there. Please let us know if you need assistance with public transport information. Additionally, there are chaeffeur driven hire cars, taxis, helicopters, push bikes and scooter hire.
access: You will have access to the entire property, secure partially enclosed outdoor entertainment area with 8 person spa, BBQ facilities, bar fridge and wall mounted television. The grounds are a key feature of the property, providing ample opportunity to watch the native birds going about their daily routines or engage in a game of backyard cricket.  During the winter months you can enjoy toasting some marshmallows over the bonfire drum. A good bonfire evokes relaxation and conversation.
interaction: Your privacy and guest experience is of paramount importance to us. We will interact with you as much or as little as you desire. We will link you with our preferred catering partners, party equipment hire and assist you to plan your event or we can suggest some must do's while visiting the Barossa. We can even suggest some family friendly activities.
house_rules: - The cabin is located within the historic town of Angaston and amongst our former neighbours. We ask that you enjoy yourselves while respecting the needs of our neighbours and our community.  - Smoking is permitted outside the house. Please place your cigarette butts in the entertainment deck trays. - Our grounds are not fenced, please ensure your children's safety.  Additionally, we ask that the spa covers are removed by two adults. The outdoor area and spa is fenced, however the winter creek draws its supply from neighbouring public space. We ask that you monitor your children's safety at all times. There is undercover parking for 2 cars and additional off street parking for a further 4 cars. The property is provided to you in good faith. Unfortunately our water, electricity, waste treatment, gas, rubbish collection, grounds maintenance, spa draining/refilling, firewood, clean and pressed linen together with free wifi and consumables are all provided for your convenience. In order t
host_about:
My partner Andrew and myself look forward to meeting you. The kids have almost all flown the coupe, yeh to some couple time. Well, until they return or drop off of the grandchildren. 
We have commenced a couple of new ventures and look forward to the trials and trivellations ahead. We both share a passion for living life to the max. Whether it's water skiing, wake boarding or attempting a new water based activity we will endeavour to give it a go.  We may not walk for a few days after, but that's another story. We love open air concerts, festivals, camping, gardening, building/construction/renovation. I love reading adventure novels and studying factual information to assist in new ventures, where as Andrew prefers me to provide him with the condensed version. 
We both firmly believe in ageing disgracefully.

name: Somerton House
summary: Somerton House is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the beautiful Barossa Valley after a hard day wine tasting and sampling regional produce. The outside entertaining area is equipped with a dining table and full size sofa, perfectly positioned in front of the outside television. Or relax in our solar heated pool if the weather is fine.
space: Somerton House was built in 1925 but has had some more recent modern additions. It is a wonderful mix of charm with all of the modern comforts. The house has ducted evaporative cooling for the summer months and has central heating to keep you cosy in the winter.

name: Angaston Masonic Lodge SAs Heritage
summary: Welcome to Angaston, Crown of the world renown Barossa wine region. Experience one of SA's most unique & grand designed buildings framed by 100 yo Moreton Bay fig trees. The Lodge towers prominently above Murray St and oh so conveniently located within minutes to award winning local cafes, shops & restaurants. The lodge is well situated to access walking - cycling paths while road/mountain bike riders will delight in the local routes.
space: The State of South Australia has listed the privately owned property on the State Heritage listing together with the two centuries old Moreton Bay Fig Trees encapsulate and frame the front festarde.  From the moment you open the door you'll step back through time. You'll be amazed and impressed by the height of the ceilings and the generous private space. The delightful collection of complementary period furniture and collectables will excite dreamy wonderment while the plush rugs are a tactile delight. We are surrounded by beautiful public gardens and walking trails. Enjoy your complimentary wine and cheese platter under the vines or on a picnic rug over looking the historic gardens, meandering creek and vineyards in the background.

neighborhood_overview: Angaston, 'the Crown of the Barossa' is nestled in the Barossa Ranges. You will need to set aside a couple of days to walk and taste and experience all the Main Street and historic surrounds have to offer.  Welcome to country hospitality.
notes: Free wifi per supplied tokens. We have recently installed a washer & drier.  We are surrounded by beautiful grounds and continually strive to improve your guest experience with value adding ammenities. You'll have access to a BBQ area or we can provide you with a picnic rug and basket.  We are currently planning our road/mountain bikers lockable storage and workshop area. Together with the outdoor spa and secondary BBQ area with fresh seasonal produce ready to be picked from the garden. Direct bookings are available, please provide a Visa or MasterCard credit card will be required prior to accessing the accommodation. The bond security amount is equivalent to 1 nights stay. If you don't have a credit card, no problem, we can accept cash or pay pal.
transit: We are 90 minutes drive from the heart of the city of Adelaide. Please let us know if you need assistance with your chauffeur, self drive hire car, uber driver, regional taxi, twice daily bus service or helicopter.  Once here, our scooters are a great fun economical way to explore and start creating some new memories and lasting friendships.
access: As our guests you will be greeted as life long friends. You will have complete access to the entire first floor entry is via the grand front entrance depicted on the photo's. Once inside, settle in, explore over a complimentary wine or sparkling paired with cheese tasting platter exclusively chosen for you.  Winter is simply wonderful when shared with great company, a wine or two some oversized sheepskins a large slate hearth prominently displayin your very private combustion wood heater while your selection of music plays in the background. Maybe now you've spotted that large pool table and consider its time for a friendly game of snooker, your music plays from the karaoke style CD player while accessing the free wifi to display the words prominently on the wall mounted large interactive tv. Perhaps even split the screen to check on those sport scores.
interaction: We will interact with you as much or as little as you wish. Our aim is for you to unwind, relax and enjoy the Angaston hospitality. Let us know if you require any assistance when planning and exploring the Barossa.  We have recently launched our scooter hire business, Scoot'n'Toot Barossa. It's a fun way to get around and explore, all things Barossa. Go Pros are also available to capture your fun and excitement. We will download your captured experience to a usb stick for later self editing.
house_rules: Please, no smoking inside the premises. Please deposit cigarette butts in the pot outside the main front door entrance.  Sorry, no pets. We ask that any young children are strictly monitored to reduce accidental property damage. Any such damage will be charged to your nominated credit card.

We try our best to offer you the home-feeling accommodation.

name: Retro Barossa Style
summary: A lovely fully renovated 1950's house in the heart of Angaston. A great way to experience the Barossa like a local. Just a short walk to the main in street, or if you feel like exploring everything is within striking distance. Drop into a local winery for a glass of wine, stop for lunch at one of the many restaurants, enjoy a balloon ride across the Barossa or just kick back enjoy the pace of life.
space: This is an original 1950's house located in the heart of Angaston.  Ample space in the living area to relax and a fully equipped kitchen if you wish to take advantage of the tasty local produce. There is a large garden with seating amd a BBQ, so in the warmer months you can delight in the outdoors. In winter a gas fire keeps you toasty warm creating a lovely space to just hang out.  The house is exclusively yours and we leave a welcome bottle of wine as well as some breakfast provisions. Brand new queen size beds in both rooms with quality linens means after your day of exploring you will be sure to get a good night's rest. The house has been lovingly renovated. The bathroom has a spacious shower with a rainfall shower head. Soaps, shampoo, conditioner and towels are all provided. Polished 50's baltic pine floors throughout as well as double brick meaning cool in the summer and warm in the winter.   If you just feel like chilling out there is a new 42 inch Smart TV with Netfix and high

neighborhood_overview: A beautiful town in the heart of the Barossa, Angaston is nestled in the rolling hills away from the hustle and bustle of the city. A great place to unwind and just enjoy the local places to dine or take a walk around the streets soaking up the feel of the Barossa.
transit: To travel around the Barossa you will need a car. There is very little public transport in the area.
access: You will have access to the whole house. There is also off street carparking and a spacious garden.
interaction: Happy to help out in any way we can. Contactable by phone.
house_rules: - This is a quiet neighbourhood, so no noise after 10pm please.  - We would appreciate it if you took your shoes off when inside just to help keep floors scratch free.  - There will be an additional cleaning fee if any smoking has occured in the house.
host_about: I am a winemaker who has spent many years travelling and living overseas. I love the idea of living like a local when I travel and hope that my experience of being a traveller and a regular user of Airbnb as a guest will help create a wonderful experience for others:)

name: Lindsay House Home 5 bedrooms 3 bathrooms
summary: Lindsay House is ideally located on the edge of Angaston, with fantastic views, on 5 acres, great for a group of friends or family to have a get together. You can also walk to the main street for shopping, dining and enjoy local wine. Offering 5 bedrooms 3 bathrooms, 1 large kitchen, laundry facilities and balcony to really enjoy the views. We can also organise your own wine tours with our multi award winning touring business.

name: Brown Bear Woods Holiday Home
summary: Nestled away in a quiet, leafy cul de sac of Lyndoch, this gorgeous home emphasizes natural elegance, showcasing a dynamic mixture of tailored finishes and quality fixtures. Grandeur in living space, the floor plan is well designed for large families. Impressive proportions continue with the additional games room which sets the precedence for stylish entertaining. Winter chills are comforted by combustion heating and the summer afternoons cooled by ducted air conditioning.
space: The formal living quarters feature vaulted ceilings giving an additional sense of space, together with chandelier lighting and elegant window furnishings. The Master suite is generous in size featuring a large walk-in robe and ensuite with spa bath and double vanity. Bedroom 2 and 4 are also generous in size, featuring built in wardrobes. Bedroom 3 has 2 single beds, with additional pull out beds stored underneath. Large family bathroom with separate toilet and vanity. Well appointed laundry with washing machine. The open plan living comes alive with the combination of meals and family room complimented by the large kitchen. Fully appointed with copious amounts of cupboard and bench space, stainless steel appliances, dishwasher and a walk-in-pantry. All the features a distinguished home-chef needs are right here! The rumpus room is an exciting space for guests of all ages, with a table tennis table and traditional wet corner bar. The large backyard features 2 main spaces. A large concr

neighborhood_overview: A quiet family friendly environment minutes away from world-class wineries, restaurants, bakeries and local shops. Leisure activities, local crafts and markets within a short walk or drive. Close proximity to Tanunda, Nuriootpa,  Angaston and Gawler.
notes: All guests will receive a complimentary hand-made Brown Bear Woods gift tray featuring local treats. Please notify us in advance of your booking if your furry friends are also wanting to stay at Brown Bear Woods.

name: The Coffee Palace - Historic Barossa Home.
summary: Located in the beautiful Barossa Valley, your home away from home is a character filled, comfortable, historic property. There are five living rooms to share with your friends and family along with cosy nooks to escape and read a book when you want some quiet time to yourself. Lovely outdoor spaces with country views provide a backdrop that will refresh your senses and it's a 5 minute stroll to all of the pretty village of Lyndoch's handy amenities.
space: The home you will enjoy was originally built in 1855 and was the 'New Lord Lyndoch Hotel'.  Read about it's interesting history as you sip a glass of Barossa Shiraz in front of the wood burning heater or gaze over the lovely rural views from the back deck. We have many beautiful rooms to relax in or share with your family, friends or group. The large games room has a billiard table, big T.V with foxtel and DVD player and there is an extensive collection of reading material throughout the house. The country style kitchen has all the amenities of home with a falcon range with electric oven and gas cooktop and there is a BBQ outside. We supply all your dining and cooking requirements with lots of extras including delicious welcome platters with home baked treats. Our bedrooms are very versatile and range from Luxurious king beds to twin rooms. Most of our beds are long singles which can be converted to king size, so let me know what your requirements are. You can look forward to modern co

There are five living rooms to share with your friends and family along with cosy nooks to escape and read a book when you want some quiet time to yourself. Lovely outdoor spaces with country views provide a backdrop that will refresh your senses and it's a 5 minute stroll to all of the pretty village of Lyndoch's handy amenities. The large games room has a billiard table, big T.V with foxtel and DVD player and there is an extensive collection of reading material throughout the house. The country style kitchen has all the amenitie
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is know as the gateway to the Barossa Valley and our place is literally less than five minutes to the village centre (at a gentle stroll). Lyndoch has the feel of a village, with all the amenities, including supermarket, butcher, bakery, library, restaurants, cafe and hotel.  Great options for dining (the Lord Lyndoch Restaurant is superb) and of course, numerous local wineries.
notes: We live about 10 minutes away, so can help out when needed. Please feel free to call if you need assistance with managing any aspect of your stay.  We may be available to help with transport for smaller parties or to assist with other travel arrangements.
transit: We are very lucky to have a bus stop almost out the front of our house, you can catch the bus either in to the Barossa townships of Tanunda, Nuriootpa or Angaston or back to Gawler.  From Gawler there is a train service to Adelaide.
access: It's all yours, 6 bedrooms, five living rooms, 3.5 bathrooms and cellar (also a bedroom) and 1400m2 of gardens.
interaction: It's up to you, we can meet you on arrival for a glass of wine or cup of coffee and give you a tour of the house or  we can give you details to let yourself in and have your time on your own. We are very flexible and happy to accommodate your wishes.
host_about: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cats, including Leonard, Polly and Blackie (the waif who comes for breakfast). We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places, personal favourites being Venice, U.K, Ha Long Bay, Rhodes, Meteora, Kotor etc.....I could go on with a very long list. We are friendly people who are happy to be as involved or not with your Barossa and Australian travel experience. We have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.

name: Azalea Cedar-Rose Barossa Valley Villa
summary: The whole Barossa is on your doorstep and this property is exclusively yours. A Parisian enchanting retreat, high ceilings, french doors, lead light windows, polished Baltic floor boards and luxurious furnishings.  Accommodates from 2 to 9 guests. Ideally suited to four couples as sharing the cost makes this beautiful home great value. Be tempted with 4 glamorous queen size bedrooms to choose from and single day bed in the Lounge room. Taking inquiries only via "contact host"
space: Enjoy this property any time of the year, taking full advantage of the vineyard position with picturesque views over the Valley, one of the best views in the Barossa. Relaxing on the back veranda gazing over russet hues of autumn vines, through to cosy winter nights curled up beside a crackling log fire or immersing yourself in the bubbles of a deliciously warm spa. Our guests comment: "It is truly so beautiful. We have stayed in many, many places around Australia but we think this has been the best by far. Absolutely presented with no expense spared with loads of luxury and style" Taking inquiries only for this property via "contact host"   For your convenience and enjoyment –  4 queen size extremely comfortable bedrooms with quality furnishings, linen and quilts. Separate lounge room with log fire, TV, DVD player and comfy day bed. Fully equipped kitchen with nespresso coffee pod machine. Selection of Teas, sugar and perculated coffee. Afternoon tea, port and chocolates. Two bathroom

neighborhood_overview: Easy stroll to bakeries, cafes, restaurants, pubs, super-market, fashion shops, cellar doors and art Galleries. Hot air-ballooning  Helicopter Scenic flights Lord Lyndoch Restaurant  Lavender farm Excellent Tourist office in Tanunda
notes: If you would like the complete or continental breakfast package please email us for the rates.
transit: Walking distance to all the local village has to offer.  A car is advisable to travel the full extent of the Barossa or book a tour.  A bus service to Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston or back to Gawler. From Gawler there is a train service to Adelaide. Barossa Taxi's are a good idea as well, especially if your a group. Only charge per hour not per person. Fantastic bike riding tracks.
access: The whole house and property is exclusively yours, even if just two people book. Car parks are available both sides of the property. Taking inquiries only through "contact the host" and I will answer asap.
interaction: We are just a phone call away as we live in Adelaide, our housekeeper is on call and only lives down the road.  Nothing is too small a matter to ensure your complete satisfaction. So please contact us immediately if we have not exceeded your expectations. We can recommend  wineries and restaurants for you to visit. As this property is not hosted a key lock is situated on the front porch and the code will be sent to you before arrival. Please note if you would like to book, an inquiry is necessary, so "contact the host" and we will get back to you asap.
house_rules: We appreciate most will respect our beautiful properties but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following Terms & Conditions.  1: The person booking for themselves or on behalf of other people is responsible for the property, and for making all guests and visitors aware of house rules and these Terms and Conditions. Payment of the rental property constitutes the guests acceptance of these Terms & Conditions. 2: Functions are prohibited on the property. Holding parties, BBQ's or any type of Function whereby extra people are invited onto the property is not allowed without prior approval.  3: The number of guests staying at the property must not exceed the number stated on the booking confirmation.  4: Check in time is after 3pm and check out time is 11am. If the property is not vacated by the agreed time then extra charges may be incurred. 5: Early check in and late check out may be available in agreement with the owner.  6: Our properties are no-smoking properties. Please
host_about: Hi, I am happily married to my sweetheart who I met when I was 12. Married at 19, have 4 lovely kids who married 4 lovely partners and we now have 14 adorable grandies!! Very blessed, and I have my faith in God. We have run a florist shop for 15 years whilst renovating two properties for Bed and Breakfast in the Barossa Valley. Now we have retired from floristry we are enjoying the beautiful serenity of the Barossa Valley more and more. We love to travel and have been fortunate to visit many countries overseas, which helps when it comes to seeing what our guests in our accommodation need for comfort and an unique experience.

name: Jasmine's Barossa Valley Cottage
summary: Drink in the grandeur of the Barossa from this cosy retreat. Perfect for a romantic escape or for couples to share.  Soft furnishings superbly compliment the 1880's cottage, and offer guests maximum comfort with the popular shabby chic style. Easy stroll to Wineries, restaurants, bakery, super market, and Lyndoch hotel. Safe and quiet neighborhood surrounded by beautiful scenery. Jasmine's is completely private and not hosted. Send an inquiry to "the host" to check for availability.
space: For your convenience and enjoyment.. -Fully equipped Kitchen -Selection of Teas and Nepresso Coffee pods, milk, chocolates & port. -Log fire, comfy sofas, TV, surround sound system and DVD player with DVDs -Cosy dining area -Luxury underfloor heated bathroom with 2 person spa, separate shower,   Gilchrist and Soames amenities with use of fluffy bathrobes. -Seperate Toilet -Queen size beds in both bedrooms with soft, beautiful furnishings, -Reverse cycle air-conditioning for your comfort. -Enjoy meals outside using the BBQ and outdoor setting -Off street undercover parking -Easy stroll to wineries, cafes, bakeries, restaurants and art galleries. -Amazing views of vineyards that back onto the property. -Next door there is a park with an amazing historical gum tree along with   plaques describing all the amazing history in the area. -If you have a larger group why not book Azalea Cedar-Rose Barossa Valley   Villa that I own right next door.  -Send through any questions and inquiries to th

neighborhood_overview: A quiet neighbourhood and very safe. You can walk to the Pub or Lord Lyndoch at night without any worry at all.
notes: In all directions from our cottage it is beautiful scenery. Take a drive to Williamstown, go past beautiful vineyards, call in to the Barossa chicks and take a ride in a helicoptor for only $40. Go in the other directions and head to Tanunda and Angaston and see all the attractions that is on offer. So many wineries on the way to explore. Dont forget a visit to Maggie Beers for lunch and to purchase some of her delicious condiments. A drive to Sepeltsfield winery is amazing and in the other direction, we enjoy visiting Yalumba winery. Just around the corner from our cottages is Hemera Cellar doors, a lovely log fire in winter and a free tour on offer. Chateau Barossa just up the hill has a great gift shop, and an amazing unique antique tour. A must is the Angaston Markets on a Saturday morning! Have your breaky there, sample all the local produce, so yum.
transit: A car is preferable to visit all the wineries or you could take tours. There is a bus that leaves Lyndoch and goes to Tanunda or Gawler. Adelaide is only one hour away.
access: This unique home is exclusively yours and private. Entrance by a key code which will be sent to you once your booking has been confirmed
interaction: We are here to help you have the best possible holiday. We can offer ideas of places to visit and where to dine. We are just a phone call away and our housekeeper lives in the same street, so if you need anything or want to to know anything, we are available 24/7

name: Casa Rossa - Barossa Valley
summary: A hidden paradise in the heart of the Barossa, with everything you need for a peaceful family-friendly getaway. It is the perfect home base for exploring the Barossa Valley and making the most of your stay, whether you're an outdoors type, a wine connoisseur or just simply here to unwind. Then spend your evenings looking out onto its private vineyard and drinking in the sights and smells of nature at your doorstep, or cozy up by the log fire with a glass of wine and the vinyls spinning...
space: Picture a rustic-style farmhouse, complete with solid red bricks, wide windows and wooden fixtures throughout - but with a newly refurbished contemporary bathroom and full air-conditioning for a touch of modern luxury. Upon arrival you may enter through the laundry, or take the scenic route via the garden, vineyard and terrace courtyard to enter into the kitchen area, which is equipped with a dishwasher and brand-new induction stovetop, and soaks up the sun all day long through its French doors and windows.  The kitchen leads into the dining and living room, laundry, hallway and secondary lounge room. The laundry is equipped with a brand new washer, and a second shower and toilet. A clothesline is provided in the courtyard, which can be accessed via the door across from the laundry.  The open-plan dining room and living area is fitted out with top of the range furnishings, beautiful, locally hand-painted artwork, a Smart TV and a log fire for your enjoyment in winter. This room has a s

It is the perfect home base for exploring the Barossa Valley and making the most of your stay, whether you're an outdoors type, a wine connoisseur or just simply here to unwind. Then spend your evenings looking out onto its private vineyard and drinking in the sights and smells of nature at your doorstep, or cozy up by the log fire with a glass of wine and the vinyls spinning... neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is a small but thriving town in the heart of the Barossa Valley, and is growing and improving constantly. From the property, it is about a twenty minute scenic walk into town, or a speedy five minute drive.  You should be able to stock up on most things in Lyndoch, especially if you are in need of a quick fix. There is an IGA and convenience store, hairdresser and beautician, pub, and a number of great restaurants and cafes. Make sure you get to the Lord Lyndoch bistro for dinner!  For bigger shops, head to Gawler, about a ten minute drive from the property, which has a shopping mall and main street strip with Coles, Foodland, Big W, Target etc, as well as a number of boutiques and specialty stores.  If you are a foodie, Tanunda and Angaston are not to be missed. FermentAsian, 1918, Harvest Kitchen and Vintners of Barossa are just some of the most fantastic places to eat in the Barossa Valley, and all are within a twenty minute drive from Casa Rossa.  There is also a DVD store
notes: If you are able to hire a car, we recommend you do so! It is the best way to access the magic of the Barossa, especially from Casa Rossa, which is less than a twenty minute drive from some of the Valley's most fantastic towns - and some of South Australia's most exquisite restaurants!
transit: As mentioned earlier, the best way to get around Lyndoch and the Barossa is by hiring a car. However, there is also a newly built scenic bicycle path running from Angaston to Nuriootpa which is worth experiencing.
access: Full access to all areas of home, apart from garage and laundry storeroom.
interaction: Should you need any assistance do not hesitate to contact Maria, Jess or Andy.

name: The Cottage at Riverside Farm
summary: A beautiful, secluded, self contained cottage in the Barossa Valley overlooking the North Para River. There are many places to walk, picnic or simply enjoy the view. All modern amenities included and sleeps up to 4 people. A couple of minutes away from Chateau Yaldara, the Lyndoch Hill Restaurant and the Lyndoch main street. Only a few minutes more to Tanunda and the other wineries and restaurants in the Barossa Valley.
space: Unique views and park like surrounds make this a truly relaxing getaway. With virtually no surrounding noise or light sources the days are peaceful and the night sky truly stunning. Find us at www/riversidefarm/net/au or search for 'Riverside Farm Barossa Valley' on the web.

name: Edmunds Cottage-Must Love Cats
summary: This little cottage was built by my Great Great grandfather in 1870.  Restored  5 years ago, the original Cornish miners cottage remains but we have included a lovely spacious living room, modern bathroom with luxury spa, deck & modern kitchen.   Our 2 "fur babies" will frequent the house during your stay so if you don't like cats unfortunately this is not the place for you.
space: We are located on the outskirts of the quaint little village of Lyndoch. Surrounded by old (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN)s, our cottage includes a large deck for relaxing and a large garden with fruit trees...please help yourself.  You will also have access to discounted dining at our cafe, the Table Cafe, located just 1 km away in the heart of Lyndoch.

neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the gateway to the Barossa Valley.  From here you can access any of the 75 wineries within a 35 minute car journey with the closest one being only 1km away.  The town is small with a post office, general store, pub and a great cafe and wine bar (the Table Cafe), the only place to get your coffee, glass of wine, great local beers and fantastic food (URL HIDDEN)
notes: The Tour Down Under on 19th January will go along Jollytown road 4 times so its an ideal location for the cycling enthusiast!
transit: Public transport is limited but trains go from Gawler which is 15 min away and we do have a local bus service.  Mini buses or taxis can help you get around to the wineries if you don't want to drive.
access: You will have full access to the house excluding the 2nd bedroom and a couple of cupboard spaces.
interaction: We will be in Lyndoch most of the time at our cafe but if we happen to be out of town we will leave instructions with my folks who live just around the corner.
house_rules: We are in the country however we have neighbours  We want you to have a great time and utilise the alfresco dining and lounge area but be mindful of the neighbours.  Our cats Hunter and Dora are lovely and friendly.  They appreciate a good scratch if you are a pet lover.
host_about: We live and have a cafe in Lyndoch.  I am totally in love with the Barossa.  I am a 5 generation Lyndochian and the cottage was one of the first built in the Barossa by my forefathers.  My partner, James and I met in Balmain Sydney where I also had a cafe....very long story but it leads us to this little cottage.  We are the proud parents of Mollee who turns 5 in January.

name: Mount Pleasant - Namgarina Vineyard
summary: Our property is 12 Ha with a 2 Ha vineyard comprising Shiraz & Riesling. It is approximately  1.25 hours from Adelaide airport. We are within 45mins to 2 hrs  from 6 of the major wine areas of South Australia, & many popular tourist destinations. Mount Pleasant (3Km)  has 2 hotels, 2 bakeries, chemist, medical centre, hospital, butcher,fuel, convenience store, golf course & bowling club.
space: We provide a comfortable, clean and bright double room and are happy to share the kitchen living and outdoor spaces. If needed we have a cot for a small child and, could squeeze in an extra young child or two on spare mattresses if requested and organised ahead of time.
description: Our property is 12 Ha with a 2 Ha vineyard comprising Shiraz & Riesling. It is approximately  1.25 hours from Adelaide airport. We are within 45mins to 2 hrs  from 6 of the major wine areas of South Australia, & many popular tourist destinations. Mount Pleasant (3Km)  has 2 hotels, 2 bakeries, chemist, medical centre, hospital, butcher,fuel, convenience store, golf course & bowling club. We provide a comfortable, clean and bright double room and are happy to share the kitchen living and outdoor spaces. If needed we have a cot for a small child and, could squeeze in an extra young child or two on spare mattresses if requested and organised ahead of time. Guests are welcome to explore the garden and property, bearing in mind that we do not have control over native fauna. Guests need to be aware that they will be in the country and that there are snakes, kangaroos and sometimes koalas which can be disruptive and noisy. Guests are advised never to approach the wildlife,especially kangaroos
transit: There is a regular bus service from Mount Pleasant to Tea Tree Plaza, in Modbury. This links with the Obahn to Adelaide city. If connections are made, this trip would take just over an hour. For other wine areas and tourists destinations a car is necessary.
access: Guests are welcome to explore the garden and property, bearing in mind that we do not have control over native fauna. Guests need to be aware that they will be in the country and that there are snakes, kangaroos and sometimes koalas which can be disruptive and noisy. Guests are advised never to approach the wildlife,especially kangaroos, however cute, as all can inflict wounds. They are not domesticated.
interaction: I am happy to provide as much information and social interaction as my guests require. I am mindful that some people would prefer to have a quiet space and I would respect this.
house_rules: - Clean kitchen after use
host_about:
My family has lived in the Southern  Barossa area of the Adelaide Hills in South Australia for fourteen years. We have have a small working vineyard on a picturesque property.
My husband and I have travelled to other countries where we valued personal contact and hospitality. We enjoy hosting visitors, especially from other countries and we would like to share this idyllic environment with others.

name: Eden Valley B&B
summary: More than a B&B. Originally built by Penfolds, the heritage winery building nestled on 3 acres, offers visitors a unique experience. It's on the doorstep of the famous Barossa Valley and all of its wineries. The expansive accommodation space with its high ceilings and comfortable bed, overlook a beautiful courtyard.
space: This room has over 3 MT high ceilings, it has a total uniqueness of it's own. It's not in a house or cottage, it is 100 year old winery building. Before that one of the first steam driven flour mills in south Australia, you will actually be on the ground floor of the oldest part of the building.

name: Go Go's, Eden Valley the Garden of Grapes and Gums
summary: Nestled into a tranquil acre block in the main street of Eden Valley township, Go Go's enjoys the peaceful serenity of country South Australia but with easy access to highlights of the Barossa and Adelaide Hills. With 2 large bedrooms including a cot for the littlies, Go Go's is perfect for couples, families, and wandering nomads who need to park up and power up. A fully equipped self catering kitchen and BBQ allow you the option of creating your own gourmet delights from your local purchases.
space: In 2016 the Meadley family set up Go Go’s as a comfortable place for family and friends to enjoy when visiting from interstate and overseas. “Go Go” is the Swahili name for Grandma, and became Grandma Meadley’s nickname during her and Grandpa Meadley’s travels over seas. This seemed the perfect name for their home away from home when visiting family in Eden Valley. The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their quality wines, and Eden Valley offers a taste unique to its cooler climate. However a visit to the area doesn’t have to be just about gourmet food and wine. There are activities for all the family including the whispering wall, the big rocking horse, Kaeserstuhl Conservation Park; local arts and crafts such as the Eden Valley Gallery; walking trails; or perhaps you are a group of avid cyclists who want to test yourselves on parts of the Tour Down Under routes; or wandering nomads who feel you want a place to rest from the road, park up with plenty of space and access to p
description: Nestled into a tranquil acre block in the main street of Eden Valley township, Go Go's enjoys the peaceful serenity of country South Australia but with easy access to highlights of the Barossa and Adelaide Hills. With 2 large bedrooms including a cot for the littlies, Go Go's is perfect for couples, families, and wandering nomads who need to park up and power up. A fully equipped self catering kitchen and BBQ allow you the option of creating your own gourmet delights from your local purchases. In 2016 the Meadley family set up Go Go’s as a comfortable place for family and friends to enjoy when visiting from interstate and overseas. “Go Go” is the Swahili name for Grandma, and became Grandma Meadley’s nickname during her and Grandpa Meadley’s travels over seas. This seemed the perfect name for their home away from home when visiting family in Eden Valley. The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their quality wines, and Eden Valley offers a taste unique to its cooler climate. How
neighborhood_overview: The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their wines. Many people visit the  region for the quality and varietals of wine they have to offer to suit every pallet. The cooler climate of the Eden Valley creates zesty Rieslings, the Barossa Valley offers bold Shiraz, and the Adelaide Hill's crisp clean whites are only a short drive away too. Local wineries include Henschke and Yalumba, plus numerous boutique cellar doors such as Fernfield Wines just 3km away and Edenmae 10km away in Springton.  South Australia and the Barossa Region are proud of more than just their quality grapes, but other gourmet foods galore.  There are lots of opportunities to "Eat Local" in the main towns, or purchase delicious produce from the Mount Pleasant or Angaston Farmers Markets if visiting on a Saturday morning, which you can relax and enjoy at home in the comfort of Go Go's. Alternatively wander 100m down the street to the friendly Eden Valley Hotel where they can provide a quality value for money f
notes: If there is no availability on the calendar please still get in touch as we may still be able to help.
transit: There is a limited bus service through Eden Valley, however enjoying the flexibility of 4 wheels (or 2 if you are particularly fit and adventurous) allows you the opportunity to explore off the beaten track. Of course if you are inclined to visit the wineries there are details on tour options that will happily pick you up from Go Go's door.
access: Go Go's is set on a 1 acre block that is exclusively yours to enjoy, so there is plenty of space to park, to stretch your legs or just rest up. End your day of exploring, by sipping a glass of local wine on the swinging chair under the cool shade of the vines out the back, or soak up the warmth of the final rays of sun on the front veranda enjoying the native flora and fauna of Go Go’s garden.
interaction: Both Karine and Michael are available by mobile throughout the day, and live locally.
house_rules: Go Go's is the home away from home for our visiting friends and family, so please enjoy the added comforts and treat it with the respect you would of your own home. We ask that you help us to tread lightly on this world - respect water usage and use the environmentally friendly products we provide. Young families are welcome at Go Go's, please keep an eye on the littlies as they explore the acre block, particularly around the veranda, and the old barn.

name: Barossa Glen - Henri's Cottage
summary: The perfect getaway. A uniquely secluded cottage in a romantic setting, exclusively for two. Vistas over looking rolling hills and vineyards from the paved terrace. A country charmed garden, a self cook full breakfast and a two person therapeutic spa.
space: Enjoy the peacefulness and exclusivity of the Barossa Valley countryside. Stunning paranoramic views of glorious green rolling hills and vineyards as far as the eye can see. Evening visits by the local birds kangaroos and koalas . The flora and fauna will keep you encapsulated to the region.
description: The perfect getaway. A uniquely secluded cottage in a romantic setting, exclusively for two. Vistas over looking rolling hills and vineyards from the paved terrace. A country charmed garden, a self cook full breakfast and a two person therapeutic spa. Enjoy the peacefulness and exclusivity of the Barossa Valley countryside. Stunning paranoramic views of glorious green rolling hills and vineyards as far as the eye can see. Evening visits by the local birds kangaroos and koalas . The flora and fauna will keep you encapsulated to the region. You'll have full exclusive access to a fully equipped kitchen, BBQ, two person spa, TV with Foxtel. Breakfast provision including eggs, bacon, continental breakfast and many teas and coffees along with samples of local chocolate and port. I will endevour to greet you upon arrival and give you a regional outline and some suggested attractions, restaurants and other activities.  If this is not possible I will be able to make a key accessible and have a
neighborhood_overview: Secluded country cottage. Shops and restaurants are within a  comfortable driving distance. This is a great location to launch your self drive tour of the Barossa.  If you are traveling here for the first time or would like some new ideas - We are more than happy to help with additional information and suggestions on restaurants, wineries, places of interest, walking trails and more.
notes: -A two night minimum applies -Wifi is available upon request
transit: Own vehicle is recommended, for winery, restaurant and other attraction visitations.  There are numerous tours and tour operators in the area if you're more inclined to get into the spirit and wine.  There is a bike track 2.2 km ride away.  It will take you through the Barossa but keep in mind the Barossa by bike is a rather large undertaking with 40 km of quality sealed bike track.
access: You'll have full exclusive access to a fully equipped kitchen, BBQ, two person spa, TV with Foxtel. Breakfast provision including eggs, bacon, continental breakfast and many teas and coffees along with samples of local chocolate and port.
interaction: I will endevour to greet you upon arrival and give you a regional outline and some suggested attractions, restaurants and other activities.  If this is not possible I will be able to make a key accessible and have a large number of brochures available to you.
house_rules: I expect you to respect Barossa Glen as they would your own home. Keep tidy, yet please relax and enjoy. If there are any amenities or facilities not working as they should please let me know, this way i can help make yours and others stays as carefree as possible.  No smoking indoors. I am also open to hosting small garden weddings ( its a lovely spot) but please recognise that there will be an additional charge. I am more than willing to help with additional resources such as chairs and trestle tables to help make it a special day. Advance notice is appropriate so i can deliver the best outcomes . I also have friends who can help with a couple of wedding cars (fj holden and hd holden) for a fee. The barossa is beautiful at any time of year. Please use the bins provided. And if you do smoke please keep cigarette butts in the ashtrays provided outside. They are there for convenience and to maintain a healthy environment for all.

name: Buckbury End Farm - Farm Cottage (Barossa Valley)
summary: BUCKBURY END FARM - Est. 1895 Peace and quiet in a private freshly renovated stone cottage, Come and enjoy the pure serenity Buckbury has to offer. The North Para river meanders it's way through and creates a lovely backdrop.  Buckbury End Farm is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and is minutes to some fabulous wineries. The ideal getaway location for couples or executives on a business trip to the Gawler/Barossa region.
space: FARM COTTAGE - Private, freshly renovated stone cottage set on a 100 acre farm. The farm cottage consists of stone walls, a freshly renovated inside with a nice touch of modern yet trying to retain the old country feel.  Enjoy the peace and quiet, Stroll down to and along the North para river. Kangaroos often graze on the green river grass or sleep under the shady river red gum trees.  Sit by the river and enjoy the sounds of nature. Rich in history, the main homestead was built in 1895.  The cottage is ideal for an away from it all holiday in a country setting or equally suited to an overnight stay.
description: BUCKBURY END FARM - Est. 1895 Peace and quiet in a private freshly renovated stone cottage, Come and enjoy the pure serenity Buckbury has to offer. Enjoy the peace and quiet, Stroll down to and along the North para river. Kangaroos often graze on the green river grass or sleep under the shady river red gum trees.  Sit by the river and enjoy the sounds of nature. Rich in history, the main homestead was built in 1895.  The cottage is ideal for an away from it all holiday in a country sett
neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the pure peace and quiet that Buckbury End Farm has to offer. I have one friendly neighbour over the road only.
notes: Buckbury End Farm is a working farm. There will be be various machinery movements from time to time depending on the season. Livestock (predominantly sheep and a few cows) are present. Being a rural area, there is potential snakes, lizards, spiders and mice etc. to be present. Possums are native to our area and can often be found via torchlight in the trees outside. One or two Australian Red Kelpie dogs 'Rocket and 'Jazzie' are sometimes at Buckbury with me. They are super friendly, but if you are unsure of dogs, please let me know and i can make sure they will be in their yard for the duration of your stay.
transit: Private parking area next to cottage for 2 cars.
access: Farm Cottage and walking trails down to the river area (table and chairs are available for use by the river).
interaction: I am contactable 24/7 via mobile phone. Guests will be left to enjoy their private stay. However I am more than happy to socialise with guests and offer advice if you would like.
house_rules: Please leave the cottage as you found it. Everything is provided to give a quick clean of the benches and kitchen area before leaving.  - I am happy to unload the dishwasher after you have left. The small cleaning fee charged is to cover the washing of all towels, linen and a clean of the cottage.  Your cooperation is greatly appreciated and will keep the price affordable for future guests.

name: Naimanya Cottage Bed & Breakfast
summary: Naimanya Cottage is situated in the Barossa Ranges, ten minutes drive from Tanunda and Angaston. This 19thC attached cottage has been tastefully restored and is comfortable and homely. It is sole occupancy with own private entrance and facilities. Breathtaking views of Flaxman's Valley overlooking vineyards. The cottage has two bedrooms - one queen size brass bed and the other with two single beds. Lounge room has a TV and open fireplace. Daily breakfast provisions included.
description: Naimanya Cottage is situated in the Barossa Ranges, ten minutes drive from Tanunda and Angaston. This 19thC attached cottage has been tastefully restored and is comfortable and homely. It is sole occupancy with own private entrance and facilities. Breathtaking views of Flaxman's Valley overlooking vineyards. The cottage has two bedrooms - one queen size brass bed and the other with two single beds. Lounge room has a TV and open fireplace. Daily breakfast provisions included.
host_about: I live in Flaxman Valley in South Australia ,part of the Barossa Valley. I'm in my late 50's  and work as a Winemaker . We live on a cattle ,sheep, vineyard property. We have been running our B&B for 20 years . I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and sharing our small part of a very beautiful area with them. I enjoy reading Australiana Books , cooking , wine, gardening and I speak fluent German.

name: Boongarrie
summary: Charming self-contained apartment  in our country farmhouse. Located in the Barossa Valley, close to wineries on a beautiful parcel of land. Watch the sunset and listen to the kookaburras laughing while enjoying a  glass of wine.  Very generous breakfast supplies, nibbles and a complimentary bottle of Barossa Valley Red. A perfect place for couples to explore the valley.
space: Your apartment is an air conditioned semi detached section of our house. It has its own  entrance, deck and little courtyard area. It has a kitchenette/laundry area with all necessary utensils. A fridge, microwave, electric frypan,toaster , kettle and a private BBQ in the courtyard. There is a neat bathroom and charming bedroom with a 4 poster bed. Ceiling fan and air-conditioning make this a very comfortable area at all times of the year. Plenty of parking and a sealed road access to our property.  Breakfast provisions are left in your kitchenette area-farm fresh eggs, bacon homemade bread, homemade jam, butter, tomatoes, muesli, yoghurt, milk, tea, coffee(instant & plunger), sugar and usually a treat or 2. A complimentary bottle of red wine and and some delicious nibbles make this a lovely welcome treat to enjoy while relaxing and enjoying property views.
description: Charming self-contained apartment  in our country farmhouse. Located in the Barossa Valley, close to wineries on a beautiful parcel of land. Watch the sunset and listen to the kookaburras laughing while enjoying a  glass of wine.  Very generous breakfast supplies, nibbles and a complimentary bottle of Barossa Valley Red. A perfect place for couples to explore the valley. Your apartment is an air conditioned semi detached section of our house. It has its own  entrance, deck and little courtyard area. It has a kitchenette/laundry area with all necessary utensils. A fridge, microwave, electric frypan,toaster , kettle and a private BBQ in the courtyard. There is a neat bathroom and charming bedroom with a 4 poster bed. Ceiling fan and air-conditioning make this a very comfortable area at all times of the year. Plenty of parking and a sealed road access to our property.  Breakfast provisions are left in your kitchenette area-farm fresh eggs, bacon homemade bread, homemade jam, butter, tomat
neighborhood_overview: You will have trouble seeing our neighbours, but occassionally one may drop in. It is a friendly area surrounded by sheep, cattle properties and wineries.
notes: Our property is 10 km out of Angaston and this means you will need your own vehicle. There  is sealed road access and many wineries and tourist destinations  are situated close by. The property has a pond and a dam so is not suitable for young children.
transit: Your own private car is a necessity as there is no public transport closeby. Cars are available for rent from the Adelaide airport. Tour operators will pick up from the property.
access: Our property is a gorgeous place to explore. Go for a walk down to the creek area in Spring or Autumn and check out the frogs, birds or say hello to my beautiful horses, give Noddy the pet sheep a pat and check out any little black head dorper lambs. If you are a cyclist. You will notice that lots of your cycling friends cycle up our road, aptly named Seven Steps Road because of the climb.  Why not bring your bikes along. You have 2 of your own outdoor deck areas to sit and relax or you are welcome to share our huge  outdoor room.  You are welcome  to use any quiet spots in the garden or the creek area for a picnic, relax or just to sit and read a book. The large outdoor entertaining area is a beautiful place to sit and have breakfast at the red gum bar area and enjoy the great views. If you go for a walk through the paddocks just remember to shut the gates.
interaction: When ever we are around we are happy to spend time with guests and offer any assistance we can regarding tourist venues, winery visits, tours and pick ups. We are social people who love travelling ourselves and enjoy meeting people and hearing about their part of the world. We also understand that sometimes people just want privacy and  time alone. So please let us know what type of stay you want and we can accommodate for your needs.
house_rules: Please enjoy yourselves and take the time to see a truly beautiful part of Australia. We only ask that you love and respect the property, look after my beautiful animals by shutting gates and have some fun.
host_about:
My partner Garrry and I have lived in the beautiful Barossa for over 20 years. We enjoy all the fine foods and wines that are at our doorstep and love meeting new people. We enjoy travelling both overseas and in Australia, and love getting away from it all under the stars and living it up in luxury.
We love fishing and retreating when possible, to one of our beach houses on the Yorke Peninsula. 
We understand from our own travelling that guests may want total privacy and independence or wish to have some assistance and interaction.

name: Jandas Lake View
summary: This fully self-contained three bedroom home (with included breakfast provisions) is situated on the water's edge, surrounded by large gum trees and located in the Barossa Foothills near Eden Valley. Relax under the wide verandah, in the heated outdoor spa, aboard the pedal boats or on the lake's pontoon. This 30-acre property is exclusively yours and only minutes away from wineries and other Barossa Valley attractions.
space: -privacy and seclusion relaxing under a wide verandah or in a hot tub spa watching wild ducks swim on the lake. - exclusive use of pedal boats if you wish to experience the lake closer. - just 10-15mins drive to Angaston or Tanunda to explore more of the Barossa Valley.
description: This fully self-contained three bedroom home (with included breakfast provisions) is situated on the water's edge, surrounded by large gum trees and located in the Barossa Foothills near Eden Valley. notes: Full breakfast provisions are provided including local bacon, free range eggs, tomatoes, bread, cereal, fresh fruit, butter and a selection of jams, milk, juice, plunger coffee, selection of gourmet teas, regular tea and coffee, a bottle of local wine, chocolates and port from the port keg!
access: - check in is from 3pm and check out is by 11am. Within your stay, you are welcome to explore the 30 acre gum studded property at your leisure. - the home at Jandas Lake View is not visible from the road, and neighbouring homes are not visible from the home ensuring total privacy.
house_rules: - Pets outside only, with guests bringing everything their pet will need (ie food, bedding) and clean up after them. - Smoking allowed outside only. (Butt bins provided.) - Several lifejackets provided, guests to use as they deem necessary with pedal boats. - Children to be supervised around lake (particularly as it is so close to the house.)

name: Vineyard cottage - Tarrah Mhor Barossa B&B
summary: Tarrah Mhor is an eight acre farm in the picturesque Barossa Ranges  - Self contained, c. 1924 cottage with modern amenities - Vineyard setting - Private & peaceful - Spectacular views - A scenic, ten to fifteen minute drive to Barossa towns - Easy reach of wineries, restaurants & Farmer's Markets - Generous, locally sourced breakfast provisions - Comfortable beds  - Fast speed internet - Air conditioning -  Wood heater - 49" Smart TV with Netflix - Off road parking
space: Ideal for couples, families with older children (7 yrs & over) & groups of friends.  The cottage has three large bedrooms, two with king & one with queen-size beds. There is a  sofa bed in the lounge, so we can sleep up to eight guests.  If the dates you seek are not available please message me. Private, peaceful & a ten kilometre scenic drive to the townships of Tanunda and Angaston, this an ideal base from which to explore the Barossa region. Surrounded by vineyards, our organic farm has uninterrupted views.   Features include: Three bedrooms:  -  comfortable king & queen-size beds   - quality linen  - down quilts. -  air conditioning   - electric blankets   Lounge-room: -  Sofas which convert into beds if needed. - Wood-fired heater  - Wood provided  - Smart TV with Netflix - Bluetooth - Books & games  Kitchen: - fully equipped with modern  appliances - gas stove-top  - electric oven - dishwasher - microwave   -cooking utensils.  We are very much about supporting our local community
description: Tarrah Mhor is an eight acre farm in the picturesque Barossa Ranges  - Self contained, c. 1924 cottage with modern amenities - Vineyard setting - Private & peaceful - Spectacular views - A scenic, ten to fifteen minute drive to Barossa towns - Easy reach of wineries, restaurants & Farmer's Markets - Generous, locally sourced breakfast provisions - Comfortable beds  - Fast speed internet - Air conditioning -  Wood heater - 49" Smart TV with Netflix - Off road parking Ideal for couples, families with older children (7 yrs & over) & groups of friends.  The cottage has three large bedrooms, two with king & one with queen-size beds. There is a  sofa bed in the lounge, so we can sleep up to eight guests.  If the dates you seek are not available please message me. Private, peaceful & a ten kilometre scenic drive to the townships of Tanunda and Angaston, this an ideal base from which to explore the Barossa region. Surrounded by vineyards, our organic farm has uninterrupted views.   Features in
neighborhood_overview: A ten kilometre drive takes you to the Barossa townships of Tanunda and Angaston; ideal starting points for exploring wineries, restaurants, cafes, art galleries and boutique shops.   Nearby Kaiser Stuhl Conservation Park (a 5 minute drive away) has excellent walking trails & is home to an abundance of Australian native wildlife.   Menglers Hill Lookout (a five minute drive) is an ideal spot to take in the view across the valley floor. Tanunda and Nuriootpa have large supermarkets and all three townships have excellent bakeries, butchers, cafes, pubs, and shops.
notes: For safety reasons, we only accept children over seven years of age. There is a fishpond close to the cottage, which may pose a safety hazard. There is one bathroom/toilet. We have a wood heater in the lounge & an electric heater in the bathroom. In winter we provide electric blankets & heaters in the bedrooms. We do not have central heating.  The farm contains rocky, uneven ground & steep drops in places.
transit: Your own vehicle is best. Some wine tour operator's provide pick-up/drop off service to the house. Barossa Bike Hire is another great way to see the valley.
access: The house is yours exclusively for the duration of your stay.  You are welcome to wander through the garden & vineyard or light the outdoor fire (May - October).
interaction: We'll be here to greet you on arrival, to show you through and make sure you have everything you need.   I remain contactable by mobile throughout your stay. Please ask me if you'd like recommendations regarding places to eat, cellar door tastings, walking & bike trails. I'd like your trip to be a memorable one and I'm happy to help you plan your itinerary if you wish.  Tourist maps of the area and information on local attractions and events are provided for your use.
house_rules: We aim to leave a light footprint. Water is precious in country Australia & the cottage relies solely on rainfall. Please help conserve our precious resource by using carefully. Local regulations state NO FIRES, indoors or out, during fire ban season (mid November to April).  At other times, ensure the fire pit is fully extinguished on your departure.  Please refrain from smoking inside. Dispose of cigarette ends in the container provided by the back door. If bringing a pet please clean up after them & keep under control.  We love this special place and trust you will treat it respectfullly.
host_about:
Tarrah Mhor has been home for the past fifteen years and now we have taken the opportunity to offer the house & this lovely space to guests.
We embrace the Barossa's famous food and wine culture; growing organic produce, cooking, maintaining the small, estate vineyard & making our own wine are among favourite pastimes.
We have a passion for nature & a commitment to restoring habitat for native wildlife, reflected in the property's large garden and ongoing revegetation projects. 
We love the Barossa's physical beauty, lifestyle and sense of community.
Avid travellers, we welcome guests from all over to share and experience this beautiful part of the world.

name: Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm
summary: If you long for a quite retreat away from the crowds and close to nature, MtMcKenzie Raspberry Farm could be for you. Perched on the hills above the North Para River in the south eastern ranges of the Barossa, you will be serenaded with the tweets from native birds, bleets from lambs and mesmerised by stunning sunrises and sunsets. When the riches of local food and wine are needed, wineries, markets, cheese shops, cafe's and restaurants are just a 10 minute drive.
space: Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm is a fully-furnished, cosy log cabin on 10 acres located in the Barossa Valley between Angaston and picturesque Eden Valley. The property has a dam, a small flock of resident sheep and a modest crop of raspberries plants.  The Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm is perched on ‘Mount McKenzie’, located on the eastern edge of the Barossa Valley in the sub-region of Eden Valley famous for its Riesling. Due to the elevation of the property, there are stunning views of surrounding rolling hills, grazing land and neighbouring vineyards. Sunset is not to be missed.  The beauty of Mt McKenzie is location. It is situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley but offers the privacy and independence of a rural property.  There is an abundance of bird life, from Blue Wrens, Cockatoos, Adelaide Rosella's and migratory Swallows. Our cabin is located high on the banks of the North Para with tree canopy at eye-level. Mobs of Kangaroos are also regular visitors.  The region is known as t

neighborhood_overview: The beauty of Mt McKenzie is location. Close to all the facilities that the Barossa Valley offers while giving privacy and independence of a rural property.
access: Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm has a spacious log cabin with 3 bedrooms, 2 living areas, 2 bathrooms, modern kitchen and undercover parking.
interaction: We love to meet all guests on arrival however we also understand most guests like to get into the house and plan their stay, this is when we leave. For help and questions regarding our property or the Barossa Valley we are a phone call or message away.
house_rules: Water is precious in country Australia. Please use water wisely with short showers.  Water at Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm is from rainfall. We do not recommend drinking tap water without boiling. Spring water is supplied for drinking.  Mt McKenzie is located in rural South Australia. Bush fires are a real risk in our summer months. Fires are not allowed  ( open, heaters) at Mt McKenzie during the period 1 November to 30 April Smoking is not allowed in the house or on property  The house is ideal for 4-6 guests. We do not accept bookings of greater than 6 guests.

name: Boongarrie Luxury Tent
summary: Boongarrie Luxury Tent offers privacy and luxury on a beautiful parcel of land  located in the Barossa Valley. Wake to views of majestic red gums and in the cooler months enjoy a campfire and savour the Barossa Red left for your enjoyment.  Little touches of luxury, gourmet nibbles and generous breakfast supplies make this the perfect place for couples to explore the valley.
space: The tent has a luxurious interior with a gorgeous ensuite bathroom.  A large queen size bed,  kitchenette, with fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and plunger coffee facilities,  and for your comfort there is a reverse cycle air conditioner, TV and blue tooth speaker.   The bathroom has a rain shower and a claw foot bath, toilet and vanity. Ironing facilities and a hairdryer provided. Outside there is an outdoor kitchen with a BBQ and a side burner, sink, all utensils and pans cooking facilities and a red gum bar and stools.

name: Old Mill Cottage
summary: Old Mill Cottage is ideal for a quiet getaway with its picturesque garden to relax in or suitable for families or small groups wanting to catch up.  It is close to Dutton Park Recreation area including the Golf Course and Trotting Track.  Walking distance to the main street with great eateries and up to date information centre.  The Historic Mine site and the Mawson, Heysen and Kidman walking trails are on the doorstep.  Kapunda is nestled between the famous Barossa and Clare wine regions.

name: A Barn in the Barossa
summary: A Barn in the Barossa is a beautiful 2 storey picture book stone home architecturally renovated to celebrate natural materials of wood & stone. It was previously home to artist Jacqueline Coates and has been featured by Qantas and national magazines
description: A Barn in the Barossa is a beautiful 2 storey picture book stone home architecturally renovated to celebrate natural materials of wood & stone. It was previously home to artist Jacqueline Coates and has been featured by Qantas and national magazines
host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm an artist and business owner living  in the Barossa Valley. I love characterful houses, homes and hospitality and I have  three accommodations available in South Australia.
I have a weakness for beautiful stone homes typical to South Australia, that have a European feel. I appreciate natural light, wooden floorboards, enhancing architectural features and preserving what works from the past whilst adding charm and modern comforts. I like my guests to feel they have a stylish home away from home. 
My renovations style is comfy French provincial with a touch of vintage and original artworks on the walls for a restful and inspiring stay.
I travel a lot myself so I appreciate what it is to arrive to a place that feels like you can kick your shoes off, pour a wine and relax.

name: Carob Cottage
summary: A stay at Carob Cottage places you in a relaxed & private vineyard setting, close to all major towns and wineries in the Barossa. It has 3 bedrooms with 1 Queen, 1 Double & 1 Single bed. Fully equipped kitchen & laundry and an outdoor BBQ.
space: The  3 bedroom cottage is located just off the main tourist route in a vineyard setting and can accommodate up to 5 people. It has 1 queen, 1 double and 1 single bedroom. Two separate lounge areas with flatscreen TV in main lounge. Reverse airconditioning in main lounge with fans/heaters in other rooms. Bathroom with bath and separate shower. Toilet is separate from the bathroom. Fully equipped kitchen and laundry. All linen and towels provided. Breakfast provisions for your first morning only.  Out door setting with BBQ. A 2 night minimum stay is required. The cottage is not appropriate for children, people with limited mobility and wheelchairs.

neighborhood_overview: Carob Cottage is situated close to the 3 major towns in the Barossa Valley and is nearby to some of the regions finest boutique cellar doors such as Torbreck, Tscharke. Two Hands Wines and Seppeltsfield Winery. And also a short distance to the award winning Hentley Farm Winery and restaurant.
notes: A minimum 2 night stay is required, minimum 3 nights at Easter and Vintage Festival. Carob Cottage is not appropriate for children or people with limited mobility. No wheelchair access. If your mobile phone provider is Telstra, you will receive little or no coverage, as Carob Cottage is in a "black spot", however, free WIFI is available.
access: Only the queen bedroom will be made available when 1 couple only is staying. Please let me know at time of booking if you are 2 singles.
interaction: I live right next door so you are welcome to contact me if there are any problems.
house_rules: Terms & Conditions Not appropriate for children. Pets not allowed under any circumstances. Deposit is non refundable. name: Seppeltsfield Vineyard Cottage. Luxury & privacy.
summary: You will love your time at the cottage because of the vineyard location & gardens, the luxury facilities and amenities and the peace, quiet and privacy. Perfect for couples, the cottage is surrounded by Barossa cellar doors and Fino, Hentley Farm and Appellation restaurants. Relax in the cottage gardens or enjoy invigorating walks amidst vineyards.  We live nearby on the property if you would like help with touring recommendations for your stay.
space: Perfect for celebrating any special occasion or just for a holiday, the cottage is a wonderful place to relax as well as the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. Many international guests comment it is a welcome "home away from home" if they are travelling for an extended period.  The cottage is self-contained and the tariff includes cooked and continental breakfast provisions, a bottle of estate wine, gourmet platter produce, free WiFi and complimentary restaurant transfers to Appellation, Hentley Farm or Fino restaurants are offered on one night of your stay.  The carpeted lounge is cosy with quality soft furnishings, Bose sound systems, recent magazines and LED TV with a selection of CDs and DVDs.  The bedroom offers a king bed with white linens and the adjoining large ensuite bathroom offers underfloor heating and heated towels in winter, a double shower and deep rainwater claw foot bath.  Indoor and outdoor kitchenettes with Scanpan cookware, Global and Wusthof knives and all c

Perfect for couples, the cottage is surrounded by Barossa cellar doors and Fino, Hentley Farm and Appellation restaurants. Relax in the cottage gardens or enjoy invigorating walks amidst vineyards.  We live nearby on the property if you would like help with touring recommendations for your stay. The cottage is self-contained and the tariff includes cooked and continental breakfast provisions, a bottle of estate wine, gourmet platter produce, free WiFi and complimentary restaurant transfers to Appellation, Hentley Farm or Fino restaurants are offered on one
neighborhood_overview: We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants and the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and a heritage winery tour, but also the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker and potter. You can even book to make your own knife (but plan and book well ahead!) Other wineries include Hentley Farm, Barossa Valley Estate, Two Hands, Greenock Creek Wines, Kalleske, Whistler, Tscharke, Seiber and Torbreck, to name just a few! Seppeltsfield is the perfect place for walking. The undulating hills and palm lined road with many historic and beautiful landmarks a
notes: Very occasionally and depending on the season there may be work required to be done in the vineyard. This is always worked around a guest's stay where possible and rarely impacts on our guests because we usually have control over this.  Having said that, guests are often intrigued and interested in what needs to be done in the vineyard and enjoy speaking to us about what it's like to have a vineyard and grow grapes.
transit: Being in a rural region, you will ideally need your own car. If coming from the airport we are an easy one hour drive on a mostly dual lane highway to within 4 kilometres of the cottage. Otherwise there are many excellent tour operators who offer private or group tours. We have an excellent taxi service in the Barossa. Some guests use a taxi or private tour operator for airport transfers and for touring if they really do not want to drive. As previously mentioned, we also offer guests complimentary restaurant transfers to Appellation, Hentley Farm or Fino restaurants on one night of their stay. There are also several cellar doors within walking distance (500 metres to 3 kilometres). We use the services of an excellent bike hire company who will deliver your bikes to the cottage, or you can drive to their business and ride designated Barossa bike trails from there.
access: Guests have exclusive use of the cottage and their own private gardens surrounding it.  They are also welcome to explore the vineyard and the 25 acre property, helping themselves to any fruits and vegetables in season (including figs, pomegranites, cherries, plums etc). Guests can walk through the neighbouring vineyards to Fino retaurant (10 minutes) and Hentley Farm restaurant (5 minutes).
interaction: We are always contactable. We are either on the property or guests have our private mobile phone details and we check our emails very regularly. We enjoy socialising with guests if this is something they wish to do, but are very aware of offering privacy for those who desire this. We offer a wine tasting of our Seize the Day Shiraz to guests who have an interest in wine.
house_rules: Permission from the owners  is required before people other than paying guests are allowed on the property. Thank you.
host_about:
In a past life I was a Registered Nurse/Midwife and enjoy meeting people and sharing my passion for the Barossa. Helping guests discover and enjoy the best of the Barossa makes life interesting and fulfilling.

Peter and I spent two years restoring our 1850s early German settler's cottage from a ruin into premium Barossa accommodation and are very proud to have helped preserve some precious Barossa history. Now, with nearby Seppeltsfield Estate undergoing a renaissance, we find ourselves in one of the Barossa's "go to" destinations, Seppeltsfield.

I love my family and grandchildren, gardening, food and wine (of course!) We have lots of great friends here in the Barossa. It's a fabulous place to live with lots of festivals and music and wine events. 

I enjoy anticipating, meeting and exceeding our guest's expectations!

name: Budget Barossa Kombi Experience
summary: Bobbi is a 1972 Low-Light pop top camper. Ideally suited for traveling on a budget or backpackers. She is stored under a private carport which is set up for the best  'Glamping’ holiday. Everything you need is on hand, fridge, bbq, microwave kettle, toaster outdoor table and day bed ready for you to Enjoy!
space: We live on a quite street in the older part of town. A large block of land which is taken up by an old bull-nosed veranda tin home, fruit trees,cottage gardens pool and shed/outdoor room  The local community are friendly and helpful Freeling is a very peaceful town surrounded by the best farming land in Australia!!  It”s a Great place to live and stay!

neighborhood_overview: Freeling is a small Agricultural town putting us on the map as the 'Home' to the McLeod's Daughters TV show. It’s a short walk to some of the iconic sites, such as the Truck Stop, Bath and Windmill and the infamous Gungellan Hotel where they make the best meals! Wineries are close by in the famous Barossa where you can plan day trip(s) of tastings and cheese platters!   Historic towns like Kapunda - once a copper mining town and Gawler are also minutes away.
notes: As I mentioned we have Maggie our black Labrador and we also have a black cat called Lightning, they are both very friendly so if you were to bring your fur baby with you, all will be well-behaved. However the area for rent is separate to the main back garden and has it's own secured closed in fence
transit: As mentioned walking to local attractions is just minutes away by foot. The Barossa wineries, Kapunda, Greenock, Gawler etc are best accessed by car.
access: There is a portable toilet and outdoor shower on offer however guests can use the bathroom inside the house if they wish. The in-ground pool can be accessed however notice will be needed as we have a young Labrador pup (Maggie) that will try and distract you from you mission ha! So she will need to come inside to give you peace...
interaction: I live in the main house with my x3 children (mature young adults)  and will respect your privacy however I am available and happy to help if the need arises
